analyzed: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //

original: rtog pa rnam pa gnyis bstan to //

analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa ni shes pa'i chos yin la /

original: de lta yin dang mtshan nyid byed pa skabs ma yin pa brjod pa por byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rgol ba'i dogs pa bsu nas ming la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /

original: ci ste rigs dngos por 'gyur ba med mod kyi /

analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa de nyid don de rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: If that very conceptual thought causes one to understand the object,

original: de'i tshe 'das pa la sogs pa don rjod par byed pa 'gags pas sngon po la sogs pa de nyid ming dang sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'das pa la sogs pa don rjod par byed pa 'gags pas sngon po la sogs pa de nyid ming dang sbyor bar byed de /
translated: then when the expression of the object such as the past has ceased, that very blue, etc. is connected with the name.

original: gcig la brjod pas gnyis dang 'dres par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa 'gag pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gcig la brjod pas gnyis dang 'dres par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa 'gag pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Since there is no understanding of the mixture of two things by the expression of one, it is explained that the expression of the past, etc. has ceased.

original: mngon du gyur pa de'i ming ni de ming ngo //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa de'i ming ni de ming ngo //
translated: The name of that which is manifest is its name.

original: de sbyor ba na bsre ba ste der 'gyur ba ni thob pa ste thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de sbyor ba na bsre ba ste der 'gyur ba ni thob pa ste thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When it is connected, it is mixed. That which becomes it is obtained, that is, it is inferred.

original: 'di snyam du rnam par rtog pa gzhan nyid de'i tshe don de rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba de lta bur ci'i phyir shes par byed snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rnam par rtog pa gzhan nyid de'i tshe don de rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba de lta bur ci'i phyir shes par byed snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, â€œWhy is it known in this way: â€˜At that time, another conceptual thought causes one to understand that objectâ€™?â€

original: de'i ming dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i ming dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, â€œIts name,â€ and so on.

original: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba dam bcas ni go rims bzhin du mngon sum dang 'gal ba dang khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba dam bcas ni go rims bzhin du mngon sum dang 'gal ba dang khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar bshad do //
translated: This shows that the simultaneous occurrence of two conceptual thoughts is contradicted by direct perception and is contradicted by what you have accepted, respectively.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba la rnam par rtog par zhes bya ba lhag ma'o /
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba la rnam par rtog par zhes bya ba lhag ma'o /
translated: â€œTwoâ€ is the subject. â€œConceptual thoughtsâ€ is the remainder.

original: rnam rtog ces bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: rnam rtog ces bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: The phrase â€œconceptual thoughtsâ€ and so on concludes the discussion.

original: rnam par rtog pa lhan cig tu 'byung ba nyid ma grub po snyam du res 'ga' pha rol po smra ba de'i phyir de'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa lhan cig tu 'byung ba nyid ma grub po snyam du res 'ga' pha rol po smra ba de'i phyir de'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: The opponent might say, â€œThe simultaneous occurrence of conceptual thoughts is not established.â€

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To anticipate this objection, the root text says, â€œConsciousnesses . . .â€

original: gal te rim gyis skye ba yin na ji ltar de cig car rigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rim gyis skye ba yin na ji ltar de cig car rigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they arise sequentially, how can they be considered simultaneous?

original: mgal me bzhin du mgyogs par 'byung //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½mgal me lta bu'i mgal me bzhin te /
analyzed: mgal me bzhin du mgyogs par 'byung // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / mgal me lta bu'i mgal me bzhin te /
translated: They arise quickly, like the circle of a whirling firebrand.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œlike the circle of a whirling firebrandâ€ means that they arise quickly, like the circle of a whirling firebrand.

original: dper na mgal me la myur du @7a * //
analyzed: dper na mgal me la myur du @7a * //
translated: For example, when a firebrand is whirled around quickly, it appears as a circle.

original: bskor ba'i phyir cig car 'khor lo'i rnam par shes te /
analyzed: bskor ba'i phyir cig car 'khor lo'i rnam par shes te /
translated: because they revolve in the form of a wheel.

original: de la lta ba rnams sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lta ba rnams sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: For the views are applied to it.

original: de bzhin du shes pa rnams mgyogs par 'byung ba'i phyir cig car 'byung ba rlom pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa rnams mgyogs par 'byung ba'i phyir cig car 'byung ba rlom pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the cognitions are supposed to occur simultaneously because they arise quickly.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na mgal me'i sgras yul can gyi shes pa la yul nye bar btags pa'i phyir de'i yul can gyi shes pa brjod la gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na mgal me'i sgras yul can gyi shes pa la yul nye bar btags pa'i phyir de'i yul can gyi shes pa brjod la gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Or else, the object is figuratively applied to the cognition which has the object as its object, and the cognition is expressed as having that object. The rest is as before.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma spong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma spong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: No, is the reply, which rejects the former position.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The following is thought:

original: 'dir cig car 'byung ba sgrub par byed pa'i skabs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir cig car 'byung ba sgrub par byed pa'i skabs ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the occasion is not for establishing simultaneity.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: blo rtog pa dang bral bar 'grub pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: blo rtog pa dang bral bar 'grub pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: The occasion is for establishing the absence of conceptualization in cognition.

original: de yang yid gzhan du song ba la yang mngon du gyur ba'i dngos po nyams su myong ba'i dus na de'i ming dang bsre ba'i rnam par rtog pa dmigs pa mtshan nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa ma dmigs pas 'grub pa zhes bya ba 'di la skyon cung zad
analyzed: de yang yid gzhan du song ba la yang mngon du gyur ba'i dngos po nyams su myong ba'i dus na de'i ming dang bsre ba'i rnam par rtog pa dmigs pa mtshan nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa ma dmigs pas 'grub pa zhes bya ba 'di la skyon cung zad
translated: This is called â€œestablished by non-observation.â€

original: ma brjod de /
analyzed: ma brjod de /
translated: In this regard, we do not state the slightest fault.

original: 'di ltar gal te nyes par rim gyis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te nyes par rim gyis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Thus, if the fault is to be understood gradually,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rig par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rig par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skabs la gnod pa med do //
translated: it is not the case that conceptual thought is not to be understood.

original: cig car 'byung bar rlom pa 'di yang 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: cig car 'byung bar rlom pa 'di yang 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this assumption of simultaneous arising is also mistaken, it is said:

original: de ni rlom pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni rlom pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That is also assumed.

original: 'khrul pa ma yin zhes skabs dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ma yin zhes skabs dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be connected with the context: â€œIt is not mistaken.â€

original: de ni rlom pa zhes bya ba ni cig car 'byung ba de'i rlom pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni rlom pa zhes bya ba ni cig car 'byung ba de'i rlom pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: That is also assumed refers to the assumption of simultaneous arising.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i dbang gis 'khrul par rnam par gzhag la gang gis 'khrul par 'gyur ba 'di la gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i dbang gis 'khrul par rnam par gzhag la gang gis 'khrul par 'gyur ba 'di la gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is posited as mistaken by the power of a valid cognition that contradicts it, but there is no valid cognition that contradicts it, by which it would be mistaken.

original: ji ltar med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar med ce na /
translated: How is it that there is none?

original: de ni bar med par gsal te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni bar med par gsal te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, â€œIt is clearly manifest without interruption.â€

original: de ni ste mngon du gyur ba'i don rig pa bar med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni ste mngon du gyur ba'i don rig pa bar med pa ste /
translated: That is, the cognition of the manifest object is without interruption.

original: yul gzhan la yengs pa'i sems dang dus mtshungs par gsal bar nyams su myong la de nyid snang ba'i don rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum du rjod pa'i phyir ga las 'khrul pa yin cig car 'byung ba 'khrul pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa la grub
analyzed: yul gzhan la yengs pa'i sems dang dus mtshungs par gsal bar nyams su myong la de nyid snang ba'i don rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum du rjod pa'i phyir ga las 'khrul pa yin cig car 'byung ba 'khrul pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa la grub
translated: It is clearly experienced at the same time as the mind distracted to another object. Since that itself is called perception, how could it be mistaken?

original: par byed pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: par byed pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not only that there is no proof at all for the position that the simultaneous occurrence of the two is mistaken,

original: slar yang gnod par byed pa nyid yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slar yang gnod par byed pa nyid yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: but moreover, there is a contradiction.

original: gar mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gar mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said, â€œLike a magician, etc.â€

original: blo re re blo ldan lngas bar du bcad pa na yang gar mkhan la blta ba la sogs pa'i gnas @7b skabs na bar mchod pa nyid du snang ste /
analyzed: blo re re blo ldan lngas bar du bcad pa na yang gar mkhan la blta ba la sogs pa'i gnas @7b skabs na bar mchod pa nyid du snang ste /
translated: Even when five intelligent people are watching a dancer, etc., the occasion of seeing the dancer, etc., is not interrupted, because the five consciousnesses arise in sequence.

original: 'di ltar gang kho na'i che gar mkhan mthong ba de kho na'i tshe glu la sogs pa'i sgra thos pa dang / ga pur la sogs pa'i ro myang ba dang sna bug tu chud pa'i me tog la sogs pa'i dri snom pa dang rlung yab la sogs pa'i reg bya la reg pa dang /ğŸ”½gos dang rgyan sbyin pa la sogs pa sems par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na'i che gar mkhan mthong ba de kho na'i tshe glu la sogs pa'i sgra thos pa dang / ga pur la sogs pa'i ro myang ba dang sna bug tu chud pa'i me tog la sogs pa'i dri snom pa dang rlung yab la sogs pa'i reg bya la reg pa dang / gos dang rgyan sbyin pa la sogs pa sems par byed de /
translated: Thus, when one sees a dancer, one hears the sound of singing, etc., one smells the scent of camphor, etc., one smells the scent of flowers that enter the nostrils, one touches the breeze of a fan, etc., and one thinks about giving clothes, ornaments, etc.ğŸ”½If that were not so, then even when many people are watching, the consciousnesses would arise simultaneously due to the power of their rapid occurrence, and the error of simultaneous arising would occur.

original: de lta yin dang mang po dag gis bar du chod na yang mgyogs par 'byung ba'i stobs kyis blo rnams cig car 'byung ba 'khrul pa skye ba de'i tshe lcug ma dang la dang mtsho dang ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa la shes pa
analyzed: de lta yin dang mang po dag gis bar du chod na yang mgyogs par 'byung ba'i stobs kyis blo rnams cig car 'byung ba 'khrul pa skye ba de'i tshe lcug ma dang la dang mtsho dang ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa la shes pa
translated: When that happens, the consciousnesses of bamboo, fire, water, and taste, etc., arise in sequence.

original: re res par du chod pa'i phyir yi ge thos pa rnams shin tu myur bar 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir yi ge cig car snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: re res par du chod pa'i phyir yi ge thos pa rnams shin tu myur bar 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir yi ge cig car snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: Because they are interrupted by the individual letters, the letters are heard very quickly, and therefore the letters appear simultaneously.

original: de lta yin dang mtsho dang ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra thos pa na thos pa tha dad pa'i rtog pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang mtsho dang ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra thos pa na thos pa tha dad pa'i rtog pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, when one hears the words â€œlakeâ€ and â€œroâ€ and so on, the different consciousnesses hearing them would not be different.

original: gzhan yang rigs mi mthun pa'i ming gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas bar ma chod pa'i rnam pa du ma'i rten sems pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa la 'ba' zhig skye ba na mgyogs par 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs mi mthun pa'i ming gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas bar ma chod pa'i rnam pa du ma'i rten sems pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa la 'ba' zhig skye ba na mgyogs par 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, when many aspects of conceptual consciousness arise in succession, such as name consciousness and so on, which are not of the same type, they arise quickly because they are the nature of thought.

original: rim gyis nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rim gyis nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They are not ascertained sequentially.

original: blo thams cad skad cig ma nyid kyis yun ring du mi gnas pa'i phyir mgyogs par 'jug pa yod pas don 'ga' yang rim pa dang ldan par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo thams cad skad cig ma nyid kyis yun ring du mi gnas pa'i phyir mgyogs par 'jug pa yod pas don 'ga' yang rim pa dang ldan par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because all minds do not endure for a long time due to being momentary, they arise quickly. Therefore one does not understand any object in a sequential manner.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gar mkhan la lta ba'i gnas skabs na sgra la sogs pa rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gar mkhan la lta ba'i gnas skabs na sgra la sogs pa rig pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the cognition of sound, etc.

original: gang yang mgal me bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe 'di ni bsgrub byas stong pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang mgal me bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe 'di ni bsgrub byas stong pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The example of the firebrand, which was stated by the opponent, is devoid of the probandum.

original: mgal me yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mgal me yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, [the root text] states, â€œThe firebrand, etc.â€

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni rim pa dang ldan par mthong bar sbyor ba skye ba'i yid kyi 'khrul ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni rim pa dang ldan par mthong bar sbyor ba skye ba'i yid kyi 'khrul ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is seen in sequence, the error of the mind that generates the application is not [the case].

original: 'o na ci zhe na /ğŸ”½cig car dbang po las skyes pa'i 'khor lo'i rnam pa can gyi 'khrul pa tshogs pa'i khyad par gyi stobs kyis gcig nyid skye ba yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / cig car dbang po las skyes pa'i 'khor lo'i rnam pa can gyi 'khrul pa tshogs pa'i khyad par gyi stobs kyis gcig nyid skye ba yin te /
translated: If that is so, then what is it?

original: gsal bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The error that has the aspect of a wheel is generated simultaneously from the sense faculty by the power of a special collection, because it appears as a clear [image].

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa la gsal bar snang ba nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa la gsal bar snang ba nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the appearance of clarity is related to conceptualization.

original: 'di ltar sbyor bar byed pa ni dran pa nyid kyis byed kyi dbang po'i shes pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyor bar byed pa ni dran pa nyid kyis byed kyi dbang po'i shes pas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is memory itself that makes this connection, not a sense consciousness,

original: de ni dngos po nye ba'i stobs kyis 'byung bas 'das pa'i don 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½dran pa'i yul gang yin @8a * //
analyzed: de ni dngos po nye ba'i stobs kyis 'byung bas 'das pa'i don 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro // dran pa'i yul gang yin @8a * //
translated: because the latter arises by the power of the presence of the object, and it does not have the capacity to apprehend a past object.

original: pa de ni gsal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: pa de ni gsal ba ma yin te /
translated: The object of memory is not clear.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has ceased.

original: de lta bas na mi gsal bar snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di yid kyi 'khrul pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi gsal bar snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di yid kyi 'khrul pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it would follow, absurdly, that it would appear unclearly, it is not a mental error.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: dbang po las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa ste /
translated: It is born from the sense faculty.

original: de'i phyir dpe bsgrub byas stong pa yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe bsgrub byas stong pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the example is devoid of the property to be proven.

original: / de ltar mngon sum gyis blo rtogs pa dang bral bar bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: / de ltar mngon sum gyis blo rtogs pa dang bral bar bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus proven that perception is free from conceptual thought,

original: da ni rjes su dpag pas sgrub par byed pa ni /
analyzed: da ni rjes su dpag pas sgrub par byed pa ni /
translated: now he proves it by means of inference.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He says, â€œOr else, etc.â€

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa de ni tha snyad 'dogs pa po rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa de ni tha snyad 'dogs pa po rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: that which is without a reason for positing it as the entity of something is not to be posited as such by those who are rational and who use conventions.

original: dper na ba lang du tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur ba'i lkog shal la sogs pa med pa rta dang ba la ba lang nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang du tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur ba'i lkog shal la sogs pa med pa rta dang ba la ba lang nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, a horse is not a cow, because it does not have the dewlap and so on, which are the reasons for positing the convention â€œcow.â€

original: sngon po la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i yul gyi stobs las byung ba'i mngon sum la yang rnam par rtog pa gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan khyad par dang khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i yul gyi stobs las byung ba'i mngon sum la yang rnam par rtog pa gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan khyad par dang khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And in the case of a perception that arises from the power of an uncommon object, such as blue, there is no apprehension of a qualified object that is a reason for another conceptual cognition. This is a non-apprehension of a cause.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni khra bo dang khu yu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni khra bo dang khu yu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dissimilar class is such things as a multicolored object and a variegated object.

original: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad rnam par 'jog par thal bar 'gyur ba dang rnam par 'jog na yang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad rnam par 'jog par thal bar 'gyur ba dang rnam par 'jog na yang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
translated: The general meaning is: the consequence that everything would be posited in every way, and the consequence that even if it were posited, it would not be due to the prior presentation of a concept.

original: dang pa ni rta dkar po'o //
analyzed: dang pa ni rta dkar po'o //
translated: The word â€œwhiteâ€ is a horse.

original: rigs la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyad par zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyad par zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase â€œbecause of the negation of genus, etc.â€ is a remainder, since it is a specification.

original: rigs la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa yod kyang bla ste /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa yod kyang bla ste /
translated: Even if genus, etc. were to exist as real entities,

original: de lta na yang ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: still, it is not the case that they are not established. In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: tha dad du ni ma bcad phyir //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tha dad du ni ma bcad phyir // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they are not differentiated as distinct.

original: khyad par nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa las zhes khong nas drang ngo //
analyzed: khyad par nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa las zhes khong nas drang ngo //
translated: The phrase â€œfrom form, etc., which are held to be distinctâ€ is to be supplied.

original: gal te rigs tha dad du ma bcad pa de lta na yang ci'i phyir khyad par du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rigs tha dad du ma bcad pa de lta na yang ci'i phyir khyad par du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they are not differentiated as distinct, then why are they not nondistinct?

original: de ltar khyad par yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ltar khyad par yod ma yin //
translated: Thus, there is no distinction.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba tha snyad du ma bcad na'o //ğŸ”½de lta bas na khyad par khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa yod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba tha snyad du ma bcad na'o // de lta bas na khyad par khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa yod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If one does not make a conventional determination in that way,ğŸ”½then, therefore, the reason â€œbecause the particular and the universal are not apprehendedâ€ is not unestablished.

original: 'di snyam du rigs la sogs pa khyad par ma yin mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rigs la sogs pa khyad par ma yin mod /
translated: If one thinks that the particular is not a universal, etc.,

original: sgra'i rang bzhin nyid khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: sgra'i rang bzhin nyid khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems na /

original: sgra'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa @8b smos te /
analyzed: sgra'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa @8b smos te /
translated: then the root text states, â€œThe nature of sound itself, etc.â€

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la brda byed pa ma yin la sgra rang gi mtshan nyid la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la brda byed pa ma yin la sgra rang gi mtshan nyid la yang ma yin te /
translated: One does not make a convention in regard to a specific characteristic, nor is sound itself a specific characteristic,

original: de dag na tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag na tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not correspond at the time of the convention.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid las ma gtogs pa sgra'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid las ma gtogs pa sgra'i rang gi ngo bo gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Apart from a specific characteristic, there is no other nature of sound that exists.

analyzed: brda ma byas pa'i don la sgras sbyar bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that sound is applied to an object that is not the basis of a convention.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: sgra sbyar ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med de /
analyzed: sgra sbyar ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med de /
translated: And there is no conceptual thought without the application of words.

original: de lta bas na brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po ni sgro btags pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po ni sgro btags pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the relation of the expressed and the expresser is a mere superimposition,

original: don dam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not ultimate.

original: 'di snyam du 'o na mngon sum gyis sgro btags pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'o na mngon sum gyis sgro btags pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the understanding of the object by direct perception is conceptual because it is a superimposition,

original: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, Direct perception does not apprehend a thing that is qualified by a word.

original: de ni med pas zhes bya ba ni de yang ldog pa yin phyir zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de ni med pas zhes bya ba ni de yang ldog pa yin phyir zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //

analyzed: de ste rang gi mtshan nyid med pa las de yang ste mngon sum gyis ldog pa yin te /
translated: If it is the case that it is excluded by direct perception because it does not exist as a specific characteristic,

original: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is because it does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med ce na /

original: chod pa la sogs pa srid phyir //
analyzed: chod pa la sogs pa srid phyir //
translated: Because it is possible to obstruct it, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: refutes the other valid cognitions.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œnor is it possible to apply a conventionâ€ means that it is impossible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œjust asâ€ indicates the example.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni yul dang dus kyis bskal pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni yul dang dus kyis bskal pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with â€œNor is it possible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.â€ğŸ”½refutes the other valid cognitions.

original: gzhan la brten min zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma gzhan yang 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan la brten min zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma gzhan yang 'chad de /
translated: The phrase â€œnor is it possible to apply a conventionâ€ means that it is impossible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œjust asâ€ indicates the example.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œNor is it possible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.â€

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin la brda mi nus pa ni brda bya bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin la brda mi nus pa ni brda bya bar mi nus pa'o //

analyzed: ji ltar zhes 'drin rgyu bshad pa / gzhan la brten min zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase â€œjust asâ€ indicates the example.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œNor is it possible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.â€

original: gzhan la brten min ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la brten min ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: means that it is impossible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.

original: tha snyad kyi dus su mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus su mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase â€œjust asâ€ indicates the example.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œNor is it possible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.â€ğŸ”½means that it is impossible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.

original: brda ni tha snyad kyi don du yin pa'i phyir 'di la sgrar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brda ni tha snyad kyi don du yin pa'i phyir 'di la sgrar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The phrase â€œjust asâ€ indicates the example.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œNor is it possible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.â€ğŸ”½means that it is impossible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œjust asâ€ indicates the example.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œNor is it possible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.â€

original: gzhan yang brda 'di yul du byas pa ma yin nam yul du ma byas pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang brda 'di yul du byas pa ma yin nam yul du ma byas pa yin la /
translated: means that it is impossible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œjust asâ€ indicates the example.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œNor is it possible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.â€ğŸ”½means that it is impossible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œjust asâ€ indicates the example.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œNor is it possible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.â€

original: yin na re zhig mngon sum ma skyes pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yul du byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yin na re zhig mngon sum ma skyes pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yul du byed pa ma yin la /
translated: means that it is impossible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œjust asâ€ indicates the example.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œNor is it possible to apply a convention to the nature of blue, etc.â€ğŸ”½means that it is impossible

original: skyes pa na yang brjod pa blangs nas sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa na yang brjod pa blangs nas sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: And when it is produced, it is not applied by taking up the expression,

original: skye ba'i dus dang mngon par brjod pa 'dzin pa'i dus na skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir yul ma yin la /
analyzed: skye ba'i dus dang mngon par brjod pa 'dzin pa'i dus na skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir yul ma yin la /
translated: because at the time of production and at the time of taking up the expression, it is momentary and thus not an object.

original: mngon sum yul can yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum yul can yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And because it is not a subject of direct perception.

original: gang gis gang du sbyor bar byed //ğŸ”½ces bya ba 'di las kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i @9a * //
analyzed: gang gis gang du sbyor bar byed // ces bya ba 'di las kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i @9a * //
translated: By whom and where is it applied?

original: bdag nyid la brda bya bar mi nus so //ğŸ”½de dag ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½brjod dang rjes 'brel can ma yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid la brda bya bar mi nus so // de dag ces bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o // brjod dang rjes 'brel can ma yin //
translated: This also is not possible with respect to the nature of blue, etc.ğŸ”½The expression is not related to it.

original: zhes bya ba ni brjod pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brjod pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: The expression is not associated with it.

original: de la sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la brda ma bzung ba de ni de la rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la brda ma bzung ba de ni de la rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, that which is not taken up as a sign with respect to something will not be imagined with respect to that,

original: dril mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dril mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like the consciousness of a whirled fire-brand.

original: mngon sum gyis kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la brda gzung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid la brda gzung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Direct perception does not take up the sign with respect to the nature of blue, etc.

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The reason is contradictory because it is pervaded by the contradictory of the predicate.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gcer bu pa legs pa'i blo gros kyi lugs kyis gtan tshigs dang po ma grub par rtogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gcer bu pa legs pa'i blo gros kyi lugs kyis gtan tshigs dang po ma grub par rtogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: The Jaina Substantialistâ€™s argument is fallacious because the reason is not established.

original: de ni dngos po thams cad spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyis gnyi ga'i ngo bor brjod la /
analyzed: de ni dngos po thams cad spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyis gnyi ga'i ngo bor brjod la /
translated: The Jaina Substantialist says that all things are both universals and particulars.

original: spyi'i ngo bo yang gnyis te /
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo yang gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of universals:

original: khyab pa rnam par chad pa ni dper na ba lang nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khyab pa rnam par chad pa ni dper na ba lang nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The first is a universal that is a conceptual distinction, like cowness, etc.

original: rnam par ma chad pa ni dper na yod pa dang dngos po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par ma chad pa ni dper na yod pa dang dngos po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The second is a universal that is not a conceptual distinction, like existence, thingness, etc.

original: de la ma chad pa gcig gi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni tog pa med pa lta ba tsam gyi mngon sum gyi spyod yul yin la /
analyzed: de la ma chad pa gcig gi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni tog pa med pa lta ba tsam gyi mngon sum gyi spyod yul yin la /
translated: The first kind of universal is the object of direct perception, which is nonconceptual and merely sees the object.

original: gcig shos ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni de dag gi lugs yin no //
analyzed: gcig shos ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni de dag gi lugs yin no //
translated: The second kind of universal is the object of conceptual cognition. This is the Jaina Substantialistâ€™s position.

original: gzhon nu ma len gyis ni lta ba'i shes pa rtog pa med pa gsal ba rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin la /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len gyis ni lta ba'i shes pa rtog pa med pa gsal ba rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin la /
translated: Kumarila says that the non-conceptual consciousness of seeing has an object that is the intrinsic identity of itself.

original: spyi'i yul can ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum du brjod do //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum du brjod do //
translated: He says that the consciousness that has a universal as its object is conceptual direct perception.

original: 'dir legs pa'i blo gros dang gzhon nu ma len la sogs pas mngon par 'dod pa'i lta ba tsam gyis mngon sum dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir legs pa'i blo gros dang gzhon nu ma len la sogs pas mngon par 'dod pa'i lta ba tsam gyis mngon sum dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to refute direct perception that is merely the view that is asserted by Bhaviveka and Kumarila,

original: gal te don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, â€œIf it is said that the object is different from the consciousness,â€ and so on.

original: de skad du smras pa la dbang po'i mdun na gnas pa'i don tsam po de ci rang gi ngo bos don gzhan med pas khyad par du byas pa 'dzin nam /
analyzed: de skad du smras pa la dbang po'i mdun na gnas pa'i don tsam po de ci rang gi ngo bos don gzhan med pas khyad par du byas pa 'dzin nam /
translated: In response to that statement, one should ask, â€œIs the mere object that is present before the sense faculty apprehended as qualified by the absence of another object due to its own nature?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba 'di dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba 'di dri bar bya'o //
translated: Or is it not?â€

original: gal te 'di ma yin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ma yin no zhes smra na /
translated: If one says, â€œIt is not,â€

original: 'dir brjod pa /ğŸ”½gal te don gzhan rnam gcod pa'i //
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa / gal te don gzhan rnam gcod pa'i //
translated: here it is said:ğŸ”½If it is not apprehended

original: ngo bos 'dzin pa ma yin na //
analyzed: ngo bos 'dzin pa ma yin na //
translated: by way of the exclusion of another object,ğŸ”½then how is it apprehended?

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i don gzhan gang yin pa de las rnam par gcad pa de la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i don gzhan gang yin pa de las rnam par gcad pa de la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that exclusion does not exist in any other object that one wishes to express.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i don la gnas pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i don la gnas pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the nature that resides in the object that one wishes to express.

original: rang bzhin khyad par can gyi don de gal te 'dzin par 'dod na /
analyzed: rang bzhin khyad par can gyi don de gal te 'dzin par 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to apprehend that object that has a distinctive nature,

original: de'i tshe don tsam 'dzin par 'gyur ba las don tsam @9b gang yin pa de ni don gzhan mi srid par rang bzhin dang bral ba de nyid 'dzin par 'gyur ba'am /ğŸ”½ci ste de yang mi 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe don tsam 'dzin par 'gyur ba las don tsam @9b gang yin pa de ni don gzhan mi srid par rang bzhin dang bral ba de nyid 'dzin par 'gyur ba'am / ci ste de yang mi 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
translated: then at that time one would apprehend the mere object, and that mere object is the very apprehension of the absence of any other object, free from intrinsic nature.ğŸ”½But if one does not apprehend that either, then at that time one would not apprehend.

original: mi 'dzin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: One would not apprehend at all.

original: bum pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa'o //
translated: â€œLike a potâ€ is an example.

original: de nyid tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, he says,

original: gal te bum gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te bum gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œIf a pot is different, etc.â€

original: ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis byas pa'i bum pa med pa'i ngo bos gal te bum pa de mi 'dzin na /
analyzed: ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis byas pa'i bum pa med pa'i ngo bos gal te bum pa de mi 'dzin na /
translated: If a pot is not apprehended by the nature of the absence of a pot that is produced by the characteristic of exclusion,

original: de'i tshe bum pa tsam zhig 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: de'i tshe bum pa tsam zhig 'dzin pa'am /
translated: At that time, one would not apprehend just a pot,

original: dngul dang zangs ma la sogs pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig gis khyad par du ma byas pa'i bum pa tsam zhig 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: dngul dang zangs ma la sogs pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig gis khyad par du ma byas pa'i bum pa tsam zhig 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or a pot that is not qualified by some particularity, such as silver, copper, and so on.

original: ci ste bum pa tsam yag 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig kyang mi 'dzin par 'gyur bas bum pa'i 'dzin par mi 'gyur grang /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa tsam yag 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig kyang mi 'dzin par 'gyur bas bum pa'i 'dzin par mi 'gyur grang /
translated: But if one does not apprehend just a pot, then one would not apprehend any object of desire. Therefore, would one not apprehend a pot?

original: de bzhin du khyad par ma bzung ba'i dpe don 'di la yang don tsam 'dzin pa'am mi 'dzin par 'gyur zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par ma bzung ba'i dpe don 'di la yang don tsam 'dzin pa'am mi 'dzin par 'gyur zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Similarly, in this example of the unqualified object, one should ascertain that one either apprehends just the object or one does not apprehend it.

original: ci ste phyogs dang po yin na /
analyzed: ci ste phyogs dang po yin na /
translated: But if the first is the case,

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: then here one might say,

original: gzung bar bya ba gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: â€œThe object that is apprehended is different.â€

original: gal te dbang po'i shes pa gzhan la med pa'i rang bzhin ngo bos khyad par du byas pa'i don 'dzin par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i shes pa gzhan la med pa'i rang bzhin ngo bos khyad par du byas pa'i don 'dzin par 'dod na /
translated: If one asserts that the object that is qualified by the nature that does not exist in other sense consciousnesses is apprehended,

original: de'i tshe rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time it would have conceptualization.

original: ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis khyad par du byas pa'i don 'dzin pa'i phyir 'di ni shing ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo 'ga' zhig gis khyad par du byas pa'i don 'dzin pa'i phyir 'di ni shing ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it apprehends an object qualified by a certain nature, like the cognition that thinks, â€œThis is a tree.â€

original: 'di snyam du gang zhig rang gi ngo bos khyad par can du gzung bar bya ba don tsam zhes bya ba cung zad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang zhig rang gi ngo bos khyad par can du gzung bar bya ba don tsam zhes bya ba cung zad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not like this, because there is no such thing as a mere object that is apprehended as qualified by its own nature.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, is it like?

original: khyod kyis khyad par du mngon par 'dod pa khyad par can gyi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid yod pa yang yin la 'dzin pa yang yin no snyam na /
analyzed: khyod kyis khyad par du mngon par 'dod pa khyad par can gyi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid yod pa yang yin la 'dzin pa yang yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the nature of a particular that you wish to qualify exists and is apprehended,

original: de'i phyir / spyi yis reg pa ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir / spyi yis reg pa ma yin pa'i //
translated: then NÄgÄrjuna explains:

original: khyad par 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no particular

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: that is not contacted by the universal.

original: gang zhig yod pa zhes bya bas brjod pa don tsam zhes bya ba spyir brjod de /
analyzed: gang zhig yod pa zhes bya bas brjod pa don tsam zhes bya ba spyir brjod de /
translated: Here â€œexistsâ€ refers to a mere object, which is a universal.

original: gang zhig gzung bar bya ba de la ltos pa med pa'i khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gzung bar bya ba de la ltos pa med pa'i khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no particular that is apprehended without depending on that.

original: de la 'di snyam du khyod kyi lugs kyis gal te spyi de yod na yang 'dzin pa'i dus su de la mi reg go zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du khyod kyi lugs kyis gal te spyi de yod na yang 'dzin pa'i dus su de la mi reg go zhe na /
translated: But if you think that even though the universal exists, it is not contacted when it is apprehended,ğŸ”½then NÄgÄrjuna explains: If it is apprehended, it is not contacted, because it is not an object of apprehension.

original: gal te 'dzin tshe de ma reg / dngos por med phyir gzung bya'am //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba smos te /ğŸ”½gal te @10a * //
analyzed: gal te 'dzin tshe de ma reg / dngos por med phyir gzung bya'am // zhes bya ba smos te / gal te @10a * //
translated: If it is apprehended, it is not contacted.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba'i phyir de 'dzin pa'i dus na dbang po'i shes pas mi reg gi khyad par tsam nyid 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba'i phyir de 'dzin pa'i dus na dbang po'i shes pas mi reg gi khyad par tsam nyid 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you think that when it is apprehended, the sense consciousness does not contact it, but it apprehends the mere difference,

original: khyad par tsam 'dzin pa de ni yod pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po dang bral bar rang bzhin gyis stong pa rang bzhin med par 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa'i gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par tsam 'dzin pa de ni yod pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po dang bral bar rang bzhin gyis stong pa rang bzhin med par 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa'i gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time the apprehension of the mere difference would be free from the thing called â€œexistent,â€ empty of intrinsic reality, and would become essenceless. Therefore it would not be an object apprehended by a sense consciousness.

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not a thing.

original: dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is free from being a thing, it is like a sky flower.

original: de lta bas na khyad par can gyi yul can gyi blo yin zhing yang rtog pa yang ma yin no zhes tshad mas gnod pa khas len pa na khyod kyi 'di gzu lums yin no zhes mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na khyad par can gyi yul can gyi blo yin zhing yang rtog pa yang ma yin no zhes tshad mas gnod pa khas len pa na khyod kyi 'di gzu lums yin no zhes mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when you accept that it is undermined by valid cognition, that it is a cognition that has a specific object and is also conceptual, you are being inconsistent.ğŸ”½The explanation of the rationale

original: 'di nyid la 'thad pa bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid la 'thad pa bshad pa /
translated: .ğŸ”½The opponent says that the cognition that apprehends a specific object is not conceptual because it is not related to a specific object.

original: khyad par 'brel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par 'brel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is â€œThe cognition that apprehends a specific object is conceptual because it is related to a specific object.â€ğŸ”½The meaning of this is as follows: Just as a stick is not related to a stick, it is not related to itself.

original: dbyig pa dang 'brel pa med par de dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin pa de bzhin du khyad par dang 'brel ba can yang rigs pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyig pa dang 'brel pa med par de dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma yin pa de bzhin du khyad par dang 'brel ba can yang rigs pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is not tenable for it to be related to a specific object.

original: de lta bas na gang zhig khyad par dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa de ni rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang zhig khyad par dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa de ni rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, that which apprehends a specific object is called â€œconceptual.â€

original: sbyor ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur ba'i khyad par can gyi yul can gyi shes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur ba'i khyad par can gyi yul can gyi shes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: â€œThe cognition that has a specific object as its basis is conceptual because it is related to a specific object.â€

original: khyad par can gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir 'di bum pa'o snyam pa sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir 'di bum pa'o snyam pa sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is a consciousness that has a specific object, like the consciousness that thinks â€œThis is a pot.â€

original: rigs mthun rigs ma mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: rigs mthun rigs ma mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is, â€œIt is not the same type, it is not a different type, and so on.â€

original: de'i phyir 'dir gal te tha dad pa'i phyir khyad par dang 'brel ba las khyad par can gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir gal te tha dad pa'i phyir khyad par dang 'brel ba las khyad par can gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don yin na /
translated: Therefore, in this context, if the meaning of the reason â€œbecause it is a consciousness that has a specific objectâ€ is â€œbecause it is related to a specific object because they are different,â€

original: de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: then the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar gang gis de dang 'brel ba gzung ba las khyad par can gyi yul can gyi shes par 'gyur ba sangs rgyas pa la khyad par zhes bya ba cung zad yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis de dang 'brel ba gzung ba las khyad par can gyi yul can gyi shes par 'gyur ba sangs rgyas pa la khyad par zhes bya ba cung zad yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is because for Buddhists, there is no such thing as a so-called specific object that is apprehended by being related to it and that is the object of a consciousness that has a specific object.

original: 'o na ci zhig na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: rigs mthun pa dag las ldog pa'i don tsam 'dzin pas khyad par gyi yul can gyi shes pa 'dzin par 'dod pa de khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa dag las ldog pa'i don tsam 'dzin pas khyad par gyi yul can gyi shes pa 'dzin par 'dod pa de khas len pa yin no //
translated: It is asserted that it is the mere object that is the opposite of things that are of the same type. Therefore it is asserted that it is the apprehension of a consciousness that has a specific object.

original: 'o na 'di ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'o na 'di ni khyad par yin no //
translated: But this is the difference.

original: 'di ni khyad par can nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad dang tha dad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par can nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad dang tha dad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: But how can there be the conventions â€œThis is a distinction,â€ â€œThis is the distinguished,â€ etc., if there is no difference?

original: tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½tha dad pa ni rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa dag las ldog pa yin la /
analyzed: tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / tha dad pa ni rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa dag las ldog pa yin la /
translated: He says, â€œDifference, etc.â€

original: @10b de yang log pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: @10b de yang log pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Difference is the exclusion of the homogeneous and the heterogeneous, and that is nothing other than the negation.

original: dngos po nyid khyad par gzhan spangs nas de tsam shes par 'dod pa na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid khyad par gzhan spangs nas de tsam shes par 'dod pa na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: When one wishes to know just that much, i.e., the thing itself, having excluded other distinctions, one says that.

original: 'di snyam du gal te rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa dag las tha dad pa'i dngos po 'dzin na 'o na 'dzin pa nges par rtogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa dag las tha dad pa'i dngos po 'dzin na 'o na 'dzin pa nges par rtogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If one grasps a thing as different from the homogeneous and heterogeneous, then grasping would be associated with ascertainment,

original: 'dir tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would operate in that way, i.e., as â€œThis is different.â€

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar 'di'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar 'di'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be its object?

original: gal te gzhan gyi rnam pas 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi rnam pas 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: If it operated by way of another,

original: gzhan gyi rnam pas 'jug pa ni de'i yul can du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pas 'jug pa ni de'i yul can du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that the object of that consciousness is the aspect of another,

original: ha can thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: ha can thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de ni tha dad ces sgra dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni tha dad ces sgra dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this qualm, the text says, â€œThat is said to be different,â€ and so on.

original: 'o na ji ltar tha dad ces brjod cing /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar tha dad ces brjod cing /
translated: If that is so, how is it said to be different?

original: rang bzhin las gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½rang bzhin las gzhan pa dngos po ma lus pa gang dag yin pa de dag las ldog pa tha dad pa gzung ba na thun mong ma yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir tha dad par nges pa'i sgra'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed
analyzed: rang bzhin las gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rang bzhin las gzhan pa dngos po ma lus pa gang dag yin pa de dag las ldog pa tha dad pa gzung ba na thun mong ma yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir tha dad par nges pa'i sgra'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed
translated: The text says, â€œFrom the nature,â€ and so on.

original: pa tha dad pa zhes brjod pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: pa tha dad pa zhes brjod pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa skye ba yin no //
translated: From all those things that are different from the nature, when the opposite of that, difference, is apprehended, it is apprehended as the uncommon appearance of blue, and so on. Therefore, the conception that is the subsequent state of the word different is produced.

original: gang gis tha dad pa zhes ming sbyor ba ma bzung ba na mi 'dzin par 'gyur ba dngos po brjod pa'i rang bzhin nam de dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis tha dad pa zhes ming sbyor ba ma bzung ba na mi 'dzin par 'gyur ba dngos po brjod pa'i rang bzhin nam de dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: But the nature of the thing that is the basis of the name â€œdifferentâ€ is not apprehended when it is not grasped, nor is it the nature of the thing that is associated with it.

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore the reason is not established.

original: ci ste dogs pa'i dbang gis khyad par du byas pa'i khyad par can gyi yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don yin na /
analyzed: ci ste dogs pa'i dbang gis khyad par du byas pa'i khyad par can gyi yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don yin na /
translated: But if, due to doubt, the meaning of the reason is that the subject is qualified by the qualifier,

original: khyad par don gzhan dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par don gzhan dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: then because it is not related to a different object,

original: de'i tshe yang rang nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang rang nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: at that time, the reason is uncertain by itself. In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: gzhan gyis byi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œThe other says, â€˜The pot is different from the cloth.â€™â€

original: spyi'i ngo bo ni gnyis te /
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo ni gnyis te /
translated: The nature of the universal is twofold:

original: khyad par gyi rnam par bcad pa'i ngo bo dang / rnam par ma bcad pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rnam par bcad pa'i ngo bo dang / rnam par ma bcad pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the nature that is the exclusion of the particular and the nature that is not the exclusion.

original: de la rnam par bcad pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba 'dod do //
analyzed: de la rnam par bcad pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba 'dod do //
translated: The nature of the exclusion is held to be the object of non-conceptual cognition.

original: de la yang ni spyi la'o //
analyzed: de la yang ni spyi la'o //
translated: And that is in the universal.

original: 'di dang rnam par rtog pa ni shes pas gzung bar bya ba 'di dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di dang rnam par rtog pa ni shes pas gzung bar bya ba 'di dang mtshungs so //
translated: It is similar to this, that is, to the object of conceptual cognition.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ci de khyad par nyid las ni //
analyzed: ci de khyad par nyid las ni //
translated: He says, â€œIs it from the particular itself? â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½gang gi phyir khyad par las khyad par can de ldog pa'i @11a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi phyir khyad par las khyad par can de ldog pa'i @11a * //
translated: and so on.

original: phyir rtogs te /
analyzed: phyir rtogs te /
translated: Because the particular is understood from the universal, since it is excluded from other particulars.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gal te des mi ldog na ni spyi nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te des mi ldog na ni spyi nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: if it were not excluded by that, then it would not be a universal.

original: de lta yin dang spyi 'di khyad par las ldog par 'dzin pa'i shes pa rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang spyi 'di khyad par las ldog par 'dzin pa'i shes pa rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, this cognition apprehending the universal as excluded from the particular would be conceptual,

original: khyad par gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has a particular as its object.

original: khyed kyi lugs kyis 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs kyis 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But it does not happen in your system.

original: de lta bas na rang nyid kyis ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rang nyid kyis ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not ascertained by itself.

original: 'dir legs pa'i blo gros de nyid kyis rang nyid kyi dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: 'dir legs pa'i blo gros de nyid kyis rang nyid kyi dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Here, Bhadramati himself anticipates his own doubt,

original: phyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyis lan 'debs par byed par grag go //
analyzed: phyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyis lan 'debs par byed par grag go //
translated: and it is said that he answers with the reason of uncertainty.

original: de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: That is taught:

original: gal te khyad par med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te khyad par med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If there is no difference, etc.

original: gang zhig rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par can bzung ba na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba khyad par dag las ma gtogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo spyi zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang khyad
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par can bzung ba na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba khyad par dag las ma gtogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo spyi zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang khyad
translated: When something with a specific nature is apprehended, there is nothing at all called a universal, a nature apart from the particulars that are the objects of conceptual consciousness.

original: par med par gzung ba'i tha dad pa nyid spyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par med par gzung ba'i tha dad pa nyid spyi zhes bya'o //
translated: However, the mere non-difference of the apprehended is called a universal.

original: so sor nges pa'i rang gi ngo bo la ltos pa med par rtogs pa ni spyi'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i rang gi ngo bo la ltos pa med par rtogs pa ni spyi'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The realization that does not depend on the individual specific nature is what is expressed by the word universal. That is the meaning.

original: de lta yin dang gang gis te 'dzin par byed pa rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba khyad par de las spyi khyad par can nyid ga las yin /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gang gis te 'dzin par byed pa rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba khyad par de las spyi khyad par can nyid ga las yin /
translated: If that were so, then how could the universal be different from the particular, since it would be the apprehender, and would be associated with conceptual thought?

original: 'o na ji ltar spyi dang khyad par dag ma 'chol ba nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar spyi dang khyad par dag ma 'chol ba nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Well then, how are universals and particulars posited without confusion?

original: mi 'dra ba dang mtshungs pa yi //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba dang mtshungs pa yi //
translated: Similarity and dissimilarity

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: tha dad pa de dag nyid 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyis shes par bya ba go rims bzhin du spyi dang khyad par nyams su myong ba brjod pa nyams su myong nas spyi dang khyad par gyi tha snyad dag yul tha dad par rtogs par byed
analyzed: tha dad pa de dag nyid 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyis shes par bya ba go rims bzhin du spyi dang khyad par nyams su myong ba brjod pa nyams su myong nas spyi dang khyad par gyi tha snyad dag yul tha dad par rtogs par byed
translated: Those very different things are to be known by similarity and dissimilarity, respectively. The experience of the universal and the particular is expressed. Having experienced the universal and the particular, the conventions of universal and particular are understood to be different objects.

original: do // gal te 'dra dang mi 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: do // gal te 'dra dang mi 'dra ba'i //
translated: If similarity and dissimilarity

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: and so on is the reply.

original: tha dad pa zhes bya bar ni ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya bar ni ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: â€œDifferentâ€ means unmixed.

original: spyi yang gzhan nyid yin la /
analyzed: spyi yang gzhan nyid yin la /
translated: The universal is also different.

original: khyad par yang gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //ğŸ”½spyi khyad par las khyad par can yin zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: khyad par yang gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // spyi khyad par las khyad par can yin zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: In particular, it is different from that.ğŸ”½The general is different from the particular, and the particular is different from the general.

original: de bzhin du khyad par yang spyi las khyad par can nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par yang spyi las khyad par can nyid yin no //
translated: The general is different from the particular, and the particular is different from the general.

original: gnyi ga yang phan tshun rang gi ngo bos dben pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang phan tshun rang gi ngo bos dben pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are mutually devoid of intrinsic reality, they are different.

original: ma 'chol bar gnas zhes bya ba ma 'dres par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'chol bar gnas zhes bya ba ma 'dres par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The term â€œunmixedâ€ means â€œunconfused.â€

original: ji skad du legs pa'i blo gros de nyid kyis yod pa la sogs pa'i phyir spyi'i rang bzhin @11b dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyad par mngon sum du byed kyi /
analyzed: ji skad du legs pa'i blo gros de nyid kyis yod pa la sogs pa'i phyir spyi'i rang bzhin @11b dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyad par mngon sum du byed kyi /
translated: As it is said, â€œSubhÅ«ti, because of the existence of the general nature, the particular is perceived,

original: rnam pa gzhan du ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ma yin te /
translated: but not in any other way.â€

original: de'i phyir khyad par rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid kyi ngo bor rigs kyi spyi ni khyad par ma lus pa las ltos pa med par mngon sum du bya bar nus pa'i phyir 'di rtog pa med pa'i yul nyid du 'gal ba med do zhes bshad pa lta
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid kyi ngo bor rigs kyi spyi ni khyad par ma lus pa las ltos pa med par mngon sum du bya bar nus pa'i phyir 'di rtog pa med pa'i yul nyid du 'gal ba med do zhes bshad pa lta
translated: If you say that the universal and the particulars are neither different nor not different,

original: bu ste / 'dir ma 'chol bar gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu ste / 'dir ma 'chol bar gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then NÄgÄrjuna explains:ğŸ”½If they are not different, they are not different from each other.ğŸ”½If they are not not different, they are not different from each other.

original: tha dad par yang ma yin la dbyer med par yang ma yin par 'dod do zhe na /ğŸ”½phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad par yang ma yin la dbyer med par yang ma yin par 'dod do zhe na / phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
