original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni rang bzhin gcig dgag pa rang bzhin gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir phung po gzhan yod pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½gzhan yang khyad par med pa gzung ba dang tha dad pa zhes bya ba phan tshun 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni rang bzhin gcig dgag pa rang bzhin gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir phung po gzhan yod pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½gzhan yang khyad par med pa gzung ba dang tha dad pa zhes bya ba phan tshun 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If they are not different from each other, they are not different.ğŸ”½If they are not not different,

original: khyad par bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In particular, he says, â€œapart from the self, etc.â€

original: tha dad pa dag las khyad par gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dag las khyad par gzhan ma yin te /
translated: There is no other difference apart from the different things.

original: khyad par de yang spyi 'dzin pa'i shes pas ma reg na ji ltar tha dad pa dag nges par 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: khyad par de yang spyi 'dzin pa'i shes pas ma reg na ji ltar tha dad pa dag nges par 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, if that difference is not contacted by the cognition apprehending the universal, how could it be ascertained that the things are different?

original: ma bzung na ni dngos po tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dag kyang mi 'dzin pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ma bzung na ni dngos po tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dag kyang mi 'dzin pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If it is not apprehended, then they are not apprehended either, because they are not different from the thing.

original: ci ste 'dzin pa zhes bya bar 'dod na de'i tshe de'i ngo bos reg na ste /ğŸ”½tha dad pa'i ngo bos reg na bzung na gzung ba dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir bzung ba'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du khyad par yang bzung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa 'di dag la spyi dang khyad par nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i shes
analyzed: ci ste 'dzin pa zhes bya bar 'dod na de'i tshe de'i ngo bos reg na ste / tha dad pa'i ngo bos reg na bzung na gzung ba dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir bzung ba'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du khyad par yang bzung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa 'di dag la spyi dang khyad par nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i shes
translated: But if it is asserted that it is apprehended, then it is contacted by its own nature.ğŸ”½If it is contacted by the nature of the different things, then, because it is not different from the apprehended, like the apprehended thing itself, the difference is also apprehended.

original: pa gang yin pa de rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa gang yin pa de rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cognition that is asserted to be the cognition of the universal and the difference in those different things is conceptual.

original: gzhan yang spyi'i khyad par dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir te de las khyad par can nyid du ma gyur mod /ğŸ”½de lta na yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa nye bar brjod pa med pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi'i khyad par dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir te de las khyad par can nyid du ma gyur mod / de lta na yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa nye bar brjod pa med pa las /
translated: Moreover, because the general is not different from the particular, the particular is not different from the general.ğŸ”½However, the non-existent, such as the horn of a rabbit, is not the object of conceptual consciousness, because it is not a particular.

original: de khyad par can nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gzung bar bya bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de khyad par can nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gzung bar bya bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the object of conceptual consciousness.

original: de lta bas na ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½gang phyir nye bar rjod byed las //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / gang phyir nye bar rjod byed las //
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is not established, he says:ğŸ”½Because it is not the object of expression,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'di snyam du spyi de dngos po med pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin la 'dra ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du spyi de dngos po med pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin la 'dra ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The following is thought: The particular does not exist as different from the non-existent universal, nor is it similar to it.

original: 'di ltar med pa gang yin pa de ni ci yang ma yin par brtag pa de 'dra ba de yang spyi las khyad par can nyid ma yin la @12a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa gang yin pa de ni ci yang ma yin par brtag pa de 'dra ba de yang spyi las khyad par can nyid ma yin la @12a * //
translated: Thus, that which is non-existent is considered to be nothing at all. That similarity is not the particular that is different from the universal,

original: mtshungs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it similar to it,

original: dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it is an entity.

original: 'di ltar gal te stong pa zhes de spyi las khyad par can du 'gyur ba de yang dngos po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te stong pa zhes de spyi las khyad par can du 'gyur ba de yang dngos po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if â€œemptinessâ€ were a particular, it would become a thing.

original: dngos po med pa la ni khyad par du brjod pa'i rang bzhin nyid srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la ni khyad par du brjod pa'i rang bzhin nyid srid pa ma yin no //
translated: For, in the absence of a thing, it is not possible for it to have the nature of being a particular.

original: khyad par du brjod pa'i rang bzhin med pa yang khyad par can du brjod par mi nus shing /
analyzed: khyad par du brjod pa'i rang bzhin med pa yang khyad par can du brjod par mi nus shing /
translated: And that which does not have the nature of being a particular cannot be said to be a particular.

original: dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½dngos po med pa la ni spyi'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // dngos po med pa la ni spyi'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin la /
translated: For, it would follow, absurdly, that it would be a thing.ğŸ”½In the absence of a thing, there is no such thing as a universal.

original: spyi'i ngo bo med pa las mtshungs par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo med pa las mtshungs par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not logical for something to be similar to that which does not have a universal.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de lta bas na stong pa spyi'i ldog mtshams su byas nas mtshungs pa'am /ğŸ”½khyad par can nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de lta bas na stong pa spyi'i ldog mtshams su byas nas mtshungs pa'am / khyad par can nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: For, it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be similar to anything.ğŸ”½Thus, it is illogical to take emptiness as the universal and then say that it is similar or that it is a particular.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig 'di ldog mtshams su byas nas mtshungs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig 'di ldog mtshams su byas nas mtshungs pa'am /
translated: For, it is not logical to take something as the universal and then say that it is similar or that it is a particular.

original: khyad par can du 'gyur ba des na de yang ldog mtshams dang mtshungs pa dang mi 'dra bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par can du 'gyur ba des na de yang ldog mtshams dang mtshungs pa dang mi 'dra bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is also seen as having a limit and as being similar or dissimilar.

original: gal te ldog mtshams de des mtshungs pa'am mi 'dra bar snang bar ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ldog mtshams de des mtshungs pa'am mi 'dra bar snang bar ma gyur na /
translated: If that limit were not seen as similar or dissimilar,

original: cig shos ldog mtshams dang ldan pa yang mtshungs pa'am mi 'dra bar snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig shos ldog mtshams dang ldan pa yang mtshungs pa'am mi 'dra bar snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the other, which has a limit, would not be seen as similar or dissimilar.

original: gzhan yang med pa zhes bya ba dngos po las tha dad pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang med pa zhes bya ba dngos po las tha dad pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, non-existence is not at all different from existence.

original: dngos po nyid dngos po gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po nyid dngos po gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because existence itself is not another existence, it is called non-existence.

original: des na 'di dag las khyad par can yin zhes legs pa'i blo gros kyis smras pa /
analyzed: des na 'di dag las khyad par can yin zhes legs pa'i blo gros kyis smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be different from these.

original: de thams cad zhe la bzhag nas /
analyzed: de thams cad zhe la bzhag nas /
translated: Having considered all of that,

original: dngos pos khyad par zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dngos pos khyad par zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says difference through existence.

original: dngos po gang zhig dngos po las khyad par can nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig dngos po las khyad par can nyid yin te /
translated: What existence is different from existence?

original: de ni cung zad kyang gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni cung zad kyang gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not different in the least.

original: 'on ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci zhe na /
translated: But what is it?

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa mtshan nyid tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa mtshan nyid tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not of the nature of that, i.e., it is not of the same nature as that.

original: spyi de yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa las mtshungs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: spyi de yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa las mtshungs pa nyid yin te /
translated: That universal is the same as the non-existence of the rabbitâ€™s horns, etc.

original: 'di ltar ri bong gi rva la sogs pa don gyi bya ba byed pa thams cad bral ba'i mtshan nyid med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ri bong gi rva la sogs pa don gyi bya ba byed pa thams cad bral ba'i mtshan nyid med pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the rabbitâ€™s horns, etc., are characterized by the absence of all activity of an object, i.e., they are non-existent.

original: spyi ni 'di ltar mi 'dod pa'i phyir 'di de las khyad par can yin par gsal rab pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni 'di ltar mi 'dod pa'i phyir 'di de las khyad par can yin par gsal rab pa yin no //
translated: Since a universal is not accepted in this way, it is clear that it is different from that.

original: de bas med pa las kyang khyad par can du zhugs la med pa dngos po nyid du thal bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni spyi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas med pa las kyang khyad par can du zhugs la med pa dngos po nyid du thal bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni spyi yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a universal because it is different from non-existence, and because it is not the case that non-existence is entailed as an existent thing.

original: gang yang med pa zhes pa gzhan ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la @12b sogs pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang med pa zhes pa gzhan ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la @12b sogs pa de la /
translated: As for what was said above, â€œThere is no other so-called non-existence,â€

original: des rang gis smras pa'i don rnam par ma dpyod pa yin te /
analyzed: des rang gis smras pa'i don rnam par ma dpyod pa yin te /
translated: he has not analyzed the meaning of his own words.

original: 'di ltar dngos po nyid dngos po gzhan ma yin no zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po nyid dngos po gzhan ma yin no zhes smras pa na /
translated: Thus, when it is said that an entity is not another entity,

original: de dngos po gzhan las khyad par can du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dngos po gzhan las khyad par can du bstan pa yin te /
translated: then it is shown that it is distinguished from another entity,

original: de las ldog par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las ldog par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is expressed as the opposite of that.

original: 'di ni rmongs pa'i rnam rol pa yin pas ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas chog go //
analyzed: 'di ni rmongs pa'i rnam rol pa yin pas ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas chog go //
translated: Since this is the manifestation of delusion, it is enough that it leads to absurdity.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma'i 'bras bu nye bar sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma'i 'bras bu nye bar sdud pa yin no //
translated: The result of valid cognition is summarized by â€œTherefore,â€ and so forth.

original: dang por yod pa'i lta ba po //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa pas gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs bstan pa'i sgo nas gang zhig gang gi ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa'i
analyzed: dang por yod pa'i lta ba po // zhes bya ba la sogs pa pas gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs bstan pa'i sgo nas gang zhig gang gi ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa'i
translated: The view that it exists at first,

original: dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: and so forth, present the system of Kumarila. The application of the reason, â€œThere is no reason for positing this as that entity,â€ and so on, is suspected of being unestablished with respect to part of the subject.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum thams cad phyogs su byas pa de la mngon sum zhes bya ba'i chos can thams cad rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan khyad par dang khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa med do zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum thams cad phyogs su byas pa de la mngon sum zhes bya ba'i chos can thams cad rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan khyad par dang khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa med do zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs
translated: Thus, in all direct perception that is posited as a subject, there is no reason for the statement, â€œAll direct perception is conceptual,â€ because there is no apprehension of a qualifier and a qualificand.

original: 'di ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ma grub ste /
translated: This reason is not established,

original: lta ba las ma gtogs pa'i mngon sum gzhan la spyi la sogs pa'i khyad par dang khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba las ma gtogs pa'i mngon sum gzhan la spyi la sogs pa'i khyad par dang khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is apprehension of a qualifier and a qualificand, such as a universal, in a direct perception that is not a view.

original: ci ste lta ba'i shes pa nyid phyogs su byas nas gtan tshigs su brjod na /
analyzed: ci ste lta ba'i shes pa nyid phyogs su byas nas gtan tshigs su brjod na /
translated: But if you state the reason in terms of the view itself,

original: de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no snyam du gzhan dag sems so //ğŸ”½byis dang lkugs sogs blo 'dra ba //
analyzed: de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin no snyam du gzhan dag sems so // byis dang lkugs sogs blo 'dra ba //
translated: then it is an argument that establishes what is already established.ğŸ”½The cognition of the childish is like that of the mute, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni byis pa'i shes pa dang 'dra zhing lkugs pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byis pa'i shes pa dang 'dra zhing lkugs pa la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The cognition of the childish is like that of the mute, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras brgyal ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras brgyal ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word â€œetc.â€ includes those who are in a faint, etc.

original: 'dra ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i khyad par dang bral ba tsam du'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i khyad par dang bral ba tsam du'o //
translated: Similarity is just the absence of the distinction of verbal expression.

original: dag pa'i dngos po yang spyi gnyis kyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa'i dngos po yang spyi gnyis kyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pure entity is also devoid of the two universals.

original: de nyid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsal bar byed pa ni khyad par can ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsal bar byed pa ni khyad par can ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The same is clarified by the second verse: â€œwithout a particular.â€

original: khyad par ni nyi tshe ba'i spyi ste ba lang nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni nyi tshe ba'i spyi ste ba lang nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: A particular is a limited universal, such as cowness, etc.

original: spyi zhes bya ba ni spyi chen po ste /
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba ni spyi chen po ste /
translated: A universal is a great universal,

original: dngos po nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as entityness, etc.

original: de dag ni gzhir gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dag pa'i dngos po bstan te //
analyzed: de dag ni gzhir gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dag pa'i dngos po bstan te //
translated: Those are called the basis. This shows the pure entity.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa de nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa de nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The reason that it is not established in one part of the position is clarified by the words â€œafter that,â€ etc.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni dag pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i dus phyis so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni dag pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i dus phyis so //
translated: After that means after the time of apprehending the pure entity.

original: @13a * // blo gang gis dngos po nges pa'i rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyis so //
analyzed: @13a * // blo gang gis dngos po nges pa'i rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyis so //
translated: By what cognition? By the cognition of the specific entity, such as the universal and so on.

original: de yang mngon sum nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum nyid du 'dod //
translated: And that is accepted as direct perception.

original: ces bya ba dang / rigs la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / rigs la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi don 'dzin pa bstan te /
translated: And by the universal and so on, he shows that the object is apprehended as qualified and qualifier.

original: 'dis ni ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs pa po nyid dang / gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs pa po nyid dang / gtan tshigs kyang ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: And this shows that the object not previously perceived is perceived, and that the reason is not established.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs par ro //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs par ro //
translated: Or, in the third moment and so on.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i rjes 'brangs pa //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i rjes 'brangs pa //
translated: It is related to that, and it follows.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po de dang 'brel pa'i rjes su 'brang bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po de dang 'brel pa'i rjes su 'brang bas so //
translated: It is related to that sense faculty, and it follows.

original: ji snyed ces bya ba la ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o//
analyzed: ji snyed ces bya ba la ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o//
translated: As much as is said, the object not previously perceived is perceived.

original: 'di snyam du gal te dang por dbang po'i byed pa dang ldan pa'i dus su rigs la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i dngos po thams cad mi snang na 'o na de dus phyis kyang snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te dang por dbang po'i byed pa dang ldan pa'i dus su rigs la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i dngos po thams cad mi snang na 'o na de dus phyis kyang snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you think that if all things endowed with the attributes of caste and so on do not appear at the time when they are endowed with the activity of the sense faculties, then they will not appear later on either,ğŸ”½because there is no difference,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na /
translated: then it is said:

original: snang ba nas ni khyim phugs su //
analyzed: snang ba nas ni khyim phugs su //
translated: From the light, in the house,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

analyzed: sgyur byed de ni khyad par yin // zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: That which is made different by its own cognition is a qualifier.

original: yang ci ste /
analyzed: yang ci ste /
translated: â€œOtherwiseâ€ means â€œif it is not so.â€ğŸ”½Moreover, if it is argued that the qualifier is different from the qualified, then the following is said:

translated: Therefore, the former, the specific characteristic alone, is the object.

analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa gcig po de rtog pa dang bcas pa yin nam rtog pa med pa yin grang /

analyzed: de la rtog pa dang bcas pa yin na snga ma ste sngar bshad pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rigs pa de shes par mi 'gyur ro // gzhan dngos la zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: If it is conceptual, then it does not cognize the specific characteristic, because the former, the specific characteristic explained earlier, is not cognized.

analyzed: phyi ma'i zhes bya ba ni spyi'i bdag nyid rigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is nonconceptual, then the latter, the general characteristic, is not cognized, because it is not cognized in other things.

analyzed: de lta yin na re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid yul yin pa'i phyir shes pa phyi ma rnams rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar bsgrubs nas /

translated: now, in order to demonstrate that even if they were conceptual, it would not be tenable for them to be valid knowledge because they apprehend what has already been apprehended,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, â€œBecause they are not different from a single object,â€ and so on.

analyzed: 'di ltar rigs la sogs pa gcig tu gsal ba las gzhan nyid du mi 'dod de /

original: ji skad du /ğŸ”½rigs sogs gsal ba dag las ni //
analyzed: ji skad du / rigs sogs gsal ba dag las ni //
translated: As it was said:

original: gzhan nyid du ni @14b gnas pa min //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du ni @14b gnas pa min //

analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: de lta yin dang dang po nyid kyis lta ba'i shes pas rigs la sogs pa gzung ba'i phyir dran pa'i shes pa bzhin du bzung zin pa'i don 'dzin pa'i phyir phyis rigs la sogs pa'i chos nges pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du rigs
translated: If that were so, then because the cognition of caste, etc. is apprehended by the initial visual cognition, the subsequent cognition that ascertains the attributes of caste, etc. would not be a valid cognition, because it apprehends an object that has already been apprehended, like the cognition of memory.

original: so // sbyor ba ni gang bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: so // sbyor ba ni gang bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: â€œThe cognition that apprehends what has already been apprehended is not a valid cognition,

original: dran pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dran pa bzhin no //
translated: like memory.â€

original: mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang bzung zin pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang bzung zin pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs so //
translated: The subsequent conceptual cognition that arises from direct perception also apprehends what has already been apprehended. This is a contradictory observation of a distinguishing feature.

original: de'i phyir 'dir gal te sgro btags pa'i yul rnam par dpyad pas bzung zin pa zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don yin na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //

translated: Therefore, if the meaning of the reason â€œbecause it apprehends what has already been apprehendedâ€ here is analyzed as an object that is superimposed, then the reason is not established.

analyzed: ci ste ci zhig lta ba bzung zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don yin na de'i tshe rje su dpag pas ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / spyi'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: But if the meaning of the reason is â€œbecause it apprehends something that is seen,â€ then at that time, it is not established for the opponent, as it is not established for the Buddhist.ğŸ”½To demonstrate this, he says, â€œThe object of a subsequent cognition is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition with regard to an unknown object.â€

original: 'di ltar dang por lta ba'i shes pas 'dres pa'i ngo bor rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar dang por lta ba'i shes pas 'dres pa'i ngo bor rtogs kyi /
translated: Thus, first, the cognition of seeing realizes the object in a mixed way.

original: nges pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not in a definite way.

analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma ni nges pa'i tshad ma yin te rjes su dpag pa bzhin du sgro 'dogs rnam par dpyod pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The subsequent one is a definite valid cognition, because it is a subject that analyzes superimposition, like inference.

original: ji ltar mngon sum gyis bzung zin pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i chos can la byas pa la sogs pa'i rtags kyis mi rtag pa nyid nges pa na tshad mar 'gyur ba de bzhin du nges par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par dpyod pa'i yul can du gyur pa yin
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum gyis bzung zin pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i chos can la byas pa la sogs pa'i rtags kyis mi rtag pa nyid nges pa na tshad mar 'gyur ba de bzhin du nges par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par dpyod pa'i yul can du gyur pa yin
translated: Just as when the property of the subject, such as sound, that is apprehended by perception, is ascertained by a reason such as being a product, it is a valid cognition, in the same way, it is a subject that analyzes superimposition and ascertains it.

original: te / 'di ltar nges par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par dpyod pa'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang khyed cag dang yang rtsod pa med de /
analyzed: te / 'di ltar nges par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par dpyod pa'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang khyed cag dang yang rtsod pa med de /
translated: Thus, there is no dispute with you that it is the object of a mind that analyzes and ascertains.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: nges pa dang ni sgro 'dogs yid //
analyzed: nges pa dang ni sgro 'dogs yid //
translated: The mind that ascertains and the mind that superimposes

original: gnod bya gnod byed ngo bo'i phyir //ğŸ”½'di ni sgro 'dogs dben pa la //
analyzed: gnod bya gnod byed ngo bo'i phyir // 'di ni sgro 'dogs dben pa la //
translated: Are in a relation of what is to be refuted and what refutes.ğŸ”½Thus, it is known that this [inference]

original: 'jug ces bya bar shes pa yin //ğŸ”½zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jug ces bya bar shes pa yin // zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Engages in the absence of superimposition.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin te /
translated: The response to this is stated by [the passage beginning with the words] â€œNo, because . . .â€

original: sgro 'dogs pa zhugs pa rnam par gcod pas rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin gyi sgro 'dogs pa'i yul rnam par gcod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa zhugs pa rnam par gcod pas rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin gyi sgro 'dogs pa'i yul rnam par gcod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Inference is a valid cognition because it eliminates superimpositions that have already arisen; it is not a valid cognition merely by virtue of eliminating superimpositions that have yet to arise.

original: dran pa yang tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa yang tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, memory would become a valid cognition.

original: mngon sum gyi rjes thogs su 'byung ba'i ba lang dkar po 'gro bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par @15a * //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rjes thogs su 'byung ba'i ba lang dkar po 'gro bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par @15a * //
translated: The memory that arises in the wake of a direct perception of a white cow going, for example, is not a valid cognition with regard to the object that is the basis of the superimposition that it eliminates.

original: rtog pa sgro 'dogs pa zhugs pa bzlog pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa sgro 'dogs pa zhugs pa bzlog pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The reversal of the superimposition of conceptual thought does not exist,

original: ba lang du sgro 'dogs pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang du sgro 'dogs pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the superimposition of a cow is not produced.

original: ji tar ma skyes she na /
analyzed: ji tar ma skyes she na /
translated: How is it not produced?

original: mngon sum gyi ni mjug thogs su //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi ni mjug thogs su //
translated: Immediately after direct perception,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang dag par ma rig pa skye ba med pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs par sgro btags pa ma skyes pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang dag par ma rig pa skye ba med pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs par sgro btags pa ma skyes pa nyid du grub po //
translated: Because conceptual thought, which is the arising of ignorance, is not produced, the non-apprehension of the characteristic of the object is established as the non-production of superimposition.

original: de ltar rigs 'di thams cad rigs la sogs pa khas blangs nas brjod la /ğŸ”½da ni rigs la sogs pa'i don dam par yod pa nyid ma yin na de'i yul can yin pa nyid kyi mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du ga la 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rigs 'di thams cad rigs la sogs pa khas blangs nas brjod la / da ni rigs la sogs pa'i don dam par yod pa nyid ma yin na de'i yul can yin pa nyid kyi mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du ga la 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having accepted the existence of the class and so on, all of this is expressed.ğŸ”½Now, in order to show that if the class and so on do not exist ultimately, how could the direct perception that has them as its object be conceptual, he says:

original: gang gis rnam par rtog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gis rnam par rtog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: By whom is the conceptual thought of the class and so on, which is the cause of the arising of the superimposition of the object,

original: rigs la sogs pa gsal ba dag las res 'ga' tha dad pa'am /ğŸ”½tha mi dad pa'am /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa gsal ba dag las res 'ga' tha dad pa'am / tha mi dad pa'am /
translated: Are universals, etc. sometimes different from the manifestations,ğŸ”½or are they non-different from them,

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa nyid kyis gnyi ga'i bdag nyid gcig yin /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa nyid kyis gnyi ga'i bdag nyid gcig yin /
translated: or are they both, i.e., both different and non-different?

original: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /ğŸ”½rjes 'gro med phyir te /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te / rjes 'gro med phyir te /
translated: The first possibility is not so,ğŸ”½because there is no concomitance.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no concomitance.

original: dngos po du ma la rjes su 'jug pa'i ngo bo ni spyir brjod la /
analyzed: dngos po du ma la rjes su 'jug pa'i ngo bo ni spyir brjod la /
translated: The nature of a universal is said to be that which pervades many things.

original: gang gis de dag nyid spyir 'gyur ba bsal ba 'di dag phan tshun rjes su 'jug par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de dag nyid spyir 'gyur ba bsal ba 'di dag phan tshun rjes su 'jug par ni ma yin no //
translated: But these exclusions do not mutually pervade each other.

original: rjes su 'jug na yang sna tshogs ngo bo gcig tu 'gyur pa'i phyir spyi nyid med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug na yang sna tshogs ngo bo gcig tu 'gyur pa'i phyir spyi nyid med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if they did pervade, because the various things would have a single nature, it would follow that there would be no universal,

original: de'i rten ni du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten ni du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its basis would be multiple.

original: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The second possibility is not so,

original: tha dad las tha dad par mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad las tha dad par mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because difference is not seen from difference.

original: tha dad las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba las so //
analyzed: tha dad las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba las so //
translated: â€œFrom differenceâ€ means from the manifestation.

original: mi snang ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi snang ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the non-manifestation of the object manifest,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as has been stated:

original: gsal ba rnams ni rjes mi 'gro //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams ni rjes mi 'gro //
translated: The manifest does not follow.

original: rjes 'gro gzhan ni snang ba med //ğŸ”½shes dang tha dad ma yin pa //ğŸ”½ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'brang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rjes 'gro gzhan ni snang ba med // shes dang tha dad ma yin pa // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'brang bar 'gyur //
translated: The other, which follows, is not manifest.ğŸ”½How can the object be manifest,

original: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: if it is not different from the cognition?

original: phyogs gsum pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a third alternative,

original: de nyid dang gzhan dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because identity and difference are mutually exclusive.

original: gang dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de dag ni gcig dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gang dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de dag ni gcig dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Those which are characterized by mutual exclusion, the negation of one is the non-presumption of the other.

original: de nyid dang gzhan dag ni phan tshun spangs nas gnas pa'i phyir dang / gang yang rung ba'i ngo bo rnam par bcad nas gang yang rung ba yongs su @15b gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan dag ni phan tshun spangs nas gnas pa'i phyir dang / gang yang rung ba'i ngo bo rnam par bcad nas gang yang rung ba yongs su @15b gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because identity and difference are mutually exclusive, and because the affirmation of one is the negation of the other.

original: de lta bas na phung po gsum pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na phung po gsum pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a third alternative is impossible.

original: gal te mngon sum rtog pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum rtog pa med pa yin na /
translated: If direct perception is non-conceptual,

original: ji ltar des tha snyad du byed /ğŸ”½'di ltar 'di ni bde ba sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar des tha snyad du byed / 'di ltar 'di ni bde ba sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: how can it make a conventional designation?ğŸ”½In this way, if it is ascertained that â€œthis is the means of attaining pleasure,

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba gal te nges pa de'i tshe de dag thob pa dang spangs pa'i don du 'jug par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½gzhan yang rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par byed pa'i tha snyad kyang med par 'gyur te 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa'i dus su gdon mi za bar chos can nam /ğŸ”½chos tshad ma gzhan gyis nges par gzung bar bya dgos la de yang ma nges pa'i bdag nyid kyis mngon sum gyis ni nges par gzung bar bya bar mi nus la rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba gal te nges pa de'i tshe de dag thob pa dang spangs pa'i don du 'jug par 'gyur ro // gzhan yang rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par byed pa'i tha snyad kyang med par 'gyur te 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa'i dus su gdon mi za bar chos can nam / chos tshad ma gzhan gyis nges par gzung bar bya dgos la de yang ma nges pa'i bdag nyid kyis mngon sum gyis ni nges par gzung bar bya bar mi nus la rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: this is the means of attaining suffering,â€ then one would engage in order to attain and abandon.ğŸ”½Moreover, the conventions of inference and the object of inference would not exist, because at the time of inference, one must certainly apprehend the subject or

original: thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the property of the subject by another valid cognition, and that cannot be apprehended by direct perception because it has the nature of being unapprehended, and it is not by inference, because the fault of infinite regress would ensue.

original: tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir tha snyad thams cad chad par thal bar 'gyur na de lta na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir tha snyad thams cad chad par thal bar 'gyur na de lta na yang ma yin te /
translated: Because there is no other valid cognition, it follows that all conventions would be annihilated. But that is not the case.ğŸ”½Therefore, this thesis â€œThere is no conception in the absence of a basis for conception, such as inference, etc.â€ is undermined by inference.

original: de lta bas na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i rtag las rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba 'di dam bcas pa 'di rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no zhes gang rtsod par byed pa de la /
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i rtag las rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba 'di dam bcas pa 'di rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no zhes gang rtsod par byed pa de la /
translated: To respond to that, it is said:

original: de'i phyir rnams dag skyed nus pa'i //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnams dag skyed nus pa'i // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because of that, the cause of conception is the object.

original: de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Because of that means because of conception.

original: rtog pa med kyang nges pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis tha snyad thams cad kyi yan lag tu 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa med kyang nges pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis tha snyad thams cad kyi yan lag tu 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Even in the absence of conception, it is the cause of ascertainment, and thus it becomes a limb of all conventions.

original: 'di lta mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba yang rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las log pa'i me la sogs pa'i don de'i rnam par snang ba skye ba las rnam par gcod pa skye ba yin te /ğŸ”½de yang nges pa'i ngo bor rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dngos po de nyid la 'di ni me yin gyi shing mya ngan med kyi me tog kha 'bus pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i
analyzed: 'di lta mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba yang rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las log pa'i me la sogs pa'i don de'i rnam par snang ba skye ba las rnam par gcod pa skye ba yin te / de yang nges pa'i ngo bor rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dngos po de nyid la 'di ni me yin gyi shing mya ngan med kyi me tog kha 'bus pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i
translated: In this way, direct perception, which is free from conceptuality, arises from the generation of the appearance of the aspect of the object, such as fire, that is the opposite of that which is similar and dissimilar.

original: rnam pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa skye ba yin no //
translated: From that, the exclusion is generated. Moreover, since it apprehends an entity that is determined in essence, and since it conforms to the aspect of an entity that is the opposite of that which is dissimilar, the aspect of affirmation and negation arises in relation to that entity, such as â€œThis is fire, not an open utpala flower.â€

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang brgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir mi slu ba nyid yin na yang tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang brgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir mi slu ba nyid yin na yang tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod de /
translated: Since those conceptions are indirectly related to entities, they are nondeceptive. However, they are not asserted to be valid knowledge.

original: snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag gcig tu zhen nas 'jug pas dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi rgyu yin @16a * //
analyzed: snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag gcig tu zhen nas 'jug pas dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro // de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi rgyu yin @16a * //
translated: Because it engages by conceiving appearance and the imagined to be one, it does not understand the nature of things because it is nonconceptual.

original: pa'i phyir / rnam pa gsum pa med par ston pa'i yang rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba yin no //ğŸ”½'di ltar de gang la 'jug pa med de snang ba'i phyir de yongs su gcod la 'dir de las gzhan mi dmigs par de'i phyir de rnam par gcod la dngos po thams cad kyang snang ba dang de las gzhan pa phung po gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa'i
analyzed: pa'i phyir / rnam pa gsum pa med par ston pa'i yang rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba yin no // 'di ltar de gang la 'jug pa med de snang ba'i phyir de yongs su gcod la 'dir de las gzhan mi dmigs par de'i phyir de rnam par gcod la dngos po thams cad kyang snang ba dang de las gzhan pa phung po gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa'i
translated: Therefore, it is the reason for teaching the nonexistence of a third type because it is the cause of the two types of conceptuality.

original: phyir / rnam pa gzhan med par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir / rnam pa gzhan med par ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the reason for teaching the nonexistence of another type because it does not engage in that, it eliminates that because of appearance, and it does not observe anything other than that here, and because all things are posited as appearance and that which is other than that.

original: gal te de lta na yang mngon gsum gyi sgra la sogs pa'i chos can bzung zin pa'i phyir de las rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa ni tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang mngon gsum gyi sgra la sogs pa'i chos can bzung zin pa'i phyir de las rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa ni tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But even if that were so, since the subject, such as sound, is already apprehended by direct perception, the conceptual thought that infers it from that would not be a valid cognition.

original: skyon 'di ni med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di ni med de /
translated: This fault does not exist.

original: mngon sum skyes na yang cha gang la zhen pa skyed par byed pa'i cha de nyid las tha snyad du rung bar gzung bar byed kyi /
analyzed: mngon sum skyes na yang cha gang la zhen pa skyed par byed pa'i cha de nyid las tha snyad du rung bar gzung bar byed kyi /
translated: Even when direct perception arises, one should apprehend that aspect that generates the conception of the object as suitable for conventional use.

original: gang du 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dbang gis sgro btags pa 'jug pa'i phyir zhen pa skyed par nus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dbang gis sgro btags pa 'jug pa'i phyir zhen pa skyed par nus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One should not generate a conception that is capable of engaging in superimposition due to the power of the reason for error.

original: de ni tha snyad du mi rung ba'i phyir gzung na yang ma bzung ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir de la sgro btags pa zhugs pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du rjes su 'jug pa ni tshad ma nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ni tha snyad du mi rung ba'i phyir gzung na yang ma bzung ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir de la sgro btags pa zhugs pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du rjes su 'jug pa ni tshad ma nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if one apprehends that, it is as if it were not apprehended because it is not suitable for conventional use. Therefore, in order to eliminate the engagement of superimposition, it is valid cognition that engages in the object.

original: mngon sum gyi mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not a conceptual thought that arises after direct perception.

original: de la sgro btags pa zhugs pa gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sgro btags pa zhugs pa gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cutting off of the entry of superimposition.

original: yang rgyu ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad las log pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyams su myong ba skyes pa na yang de kho na ltar dran pa'i nges pa mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: yang rgyu ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad las log pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyams su myong ba skyes pa na yang de kho na ltar dran pa'i nges pa mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Again, why is it that when the experience of the nature of a thing that is the opposite of all aspects is produced, there is no certainty of recollection just as it is?

original: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir te /ğŸ”½'di ltar nyams su myong zhes te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir te / 'di ltar nyams su myong zhes te /
translated: Because it depends on another cause.

original: nges par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: In this way, the experience is not definite.

original: de ltar goms pa dang don du gnyer ba dag g-yer bag la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar goms pa dang don du gnyer ba dag g-yer bag la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cultivation and the pursuit depend on another cause, such as carelessness.

original: ji ltar skyed pa dang 'don par byed par khyad par med na yang pha 'ong ba mthong nas bdag gi pha 'ong ngo snyam du nges kyi mkhan po'o snyam du ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar skyed pa dang 'don par byed par khyad par med na yang pha 'ong ba mthong nas bdag gi pha 'ong ngo snyam du nges kyi mkhan po'o snyam du ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as, although there is no difference in the production and the recitation, when the father comes, there is the certainty, â€œMy father is coming,â€ and not the thought, â€œThe teacher is coming.â€

original: 'dir dngos po rnam par byed pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i sgo nas kyang tha snyad kyi yan lag nyid 'jig par byed pa dang gang yin pa'i tshad ma de ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po rnam par byed pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i sgo nas kyang tha snyad kyi yan lag nyid 'jig par byed pa dang gang yin pa'i tshad ma de ston pa ni /
translated: Here, the author of the treatise shows the measure of the validity of the refutation of the position that the sense faculties are the conditions for the arising of conceptual cognitions, by way of generating conceptual cognitions such as â€œthe sense faculties are the conditions for the arising of conceptual cognitions.â€

original: rtog med rtog pa skyed nus min //
analyzed: rtog med rtog pa skyed nus min //
translated: A non-conceptual cognition cannot generate a conceptual cognition.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is so,

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: because a sense consciousness is not the cause of a conceptual mental consciousness,

original: yul tha dad pa'i phyir gzugs @16b dang reg pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa'i phyir gzugs @16b dang reg pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because the objects are different, like a visual consciousness of form and a tactile consciousness of touch.

original: rtog pa med pa'i yang phyir te //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i yang phyir te //
translated: It is also because it is non-conceptual,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like an eye consciousness.

original: yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di'i dpe ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di'i dpe ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The example for the reason â€œbecause the objects are differentâ€ is form and so on.

original: rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di mig la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di mig la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The example for the reason â€œbecause it is non-conceptualâ€ is an eye consciousness and so on.

original: des 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad do //
analyzed: des 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad do //
translated: He explains the refutation by â€œhereâ€ and so on.

original: gtan tshigs gnyi ga yang ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyi ga yang ma nges pa yin te /
translated: Both reasons are indeterminate,

original: gtan tshigs bsgrub bya las ldog pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bsgrub bya las ldog pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason is not shown to be contradictory with the probandum.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs dag go //
translated: â€œ Theseâ€ refers to the reasons.

original: yul tha dad pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul dang bcas pa nyid yin na yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub par bstan to //ğŸ”½don dam par rnam par rtog pa yul med pa yin pa de'i tshe yang ma grub pa nyid gsal rab pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul dang bcas pa nyid yin na yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub par bstan to // don dam par rnam par rtog pa yul med pa yin pa de'i tshe yang ma grub pa nyid gsal rab pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: By â€œnor is there a different domain,â€ he shows that the reason â€œbecause they have a different domain of conceptualization, even though they have a domainâ€ is unestablished.

original: dngos su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dngos su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: When conceptualization is ultimately without an object, then unestablished is clearly manifest. In order to show this, he says â€œin realityâ€ and so on.

original: gzugs sgra la sogs blo rnams ni //
analyzed: gzugs sgra la sogs blo rnams ni //
translated: The cognitions of form, sound, and so on

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: are not different in their mode of activity.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin //
translated: Like the cognitions of form and so on,

original: zhes bya ba'i dpe 'di bsgrub par bya ba ma tshangs bar bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dpe 'di bsgrub par bya ba ma tshangs bar bstan to //
translated: This example shows that the proof is inconclusive.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams phan tshun mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bos rgyu nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams phan tshun mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bos rgyu nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is a cause-effect relation between the cognitions of form, sound, etc., by virtue of their being reciprocal antecedent conditions.

original: yang yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par bstan pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang yul tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par bstan pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the reason â€œbecause of the difference of objectâ€ is inconclusive, because it is present in the discordant side, he says,

original: 'di la me dang du ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la me dang du ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œHere, the cognition of fire, etc.,â€

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni yul tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni yul tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di la'o //
translated: â€œHereâ€ refers to the reason â€œbecause of the difference of object.â€

original: ji ltar me la sogs pa'i rtags can gyi blo dang du ba la sogs pa rtags kyi blo yul 'dod pa yin yang rgyu yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshig ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar me la sogs pa'i rtags can gyi blo dang du ba la sogs pa rtags kyi blo yul 'dod pa yin yang rgyu yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshig ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Just as the cognition of fire, etc., and the cognition of smoke, etc., have different objects, yet are causes, so it is in this case as well. Therefore, the reason is inconclusive.

original: de ltar na mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba nyid du bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar na mngon sum rtog pa dang bral ba nyid du bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having established that perception is free from conceptuality,

original: ma 'khrul ba smos pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir ma 'khrul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba smos pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir ma 'khrul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to demonstrate the purpose of mentioning non-deception, he says, â€œNon-deception,â€ and so on.

original: 'dir ma 'khrul ba nyid ni mi slu ba nyid du blta bar bya'o //ğŸ”½dngos po ji ltar gnas pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa nyid kyi @17a * //
analyzed: 'dir ma 'khrul ba nyid ni mi slu ba nyid du blta bar bya'o // dngos po ji ltar gnas pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa nyid kyi @17a * //
translated: Here, non-deception should be seen as non-misleading.

original: ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the mere apprehension of the aspect of an object as it exists.

original: de lta ma yin na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs kyi dmigs pa ma grub pa'i phyir la lugs gnyi ga la brten par 'dod pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ma khyab pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i lugs kyi dmigs pa ma grub pa'i phyir la lugs gnyi ga la brten par 'dod pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ma khyab pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, then in the YogÄcÄra system, the object would not be established, and the definition of perception, which is asserted to be based on both systems, would not be all-encompassing.

original: mi slu ba nyid kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba byed par nus pa'i don thob par nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mi slu ba nyid kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba byed par nus pa'i don thob par nus pa yin gyi /
translated: Non-deception is the ability to obtain an object that is capable of performing the desired function.

original: thob pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thob pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the mere obtaining of the object,

original: gegs byed pa la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gegs byed pa la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because obstacles and so on are possible.

original: gal te de lta na ma 'khrul pa smos pa nyid kyis tshog mod /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ma 'khrul pa smos pa nyid kyis tshog mod /
translated: If that is so, then it is sufficient to mention non-deception.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba smos pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba smos pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the use of mentioning freedom from conceptualization?

original: rnam par rtog pa rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that even conceptual thought would be perception.

original: de yang kha cig yid kyir 'dod //
analyzed: de yang kha cig yid kyir 'dod //
translated: Some believe that it is mental.

original: ces bya ba ni de'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni de dag gi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni de dag gi bsam pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is that it is unreasonable to mention non-error.

original: 'on te yid kyi yin du chug mod de lta na yang ma 'khrul pa smos par bya dgos pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on te yid kyi yin du chug mod de lta na yang ma 'khrul pa smos par bya dgos pa kho na ste /
translated: But even if it is mental, it must be mentioned as non-erroneous.

original: 'dir dbang po'i shes pa kho na'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid rtsom par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dbang po'i shes pa kho na'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid rtsom par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For it is not that only the definition of perception by means of a sense consciousness is being composed here.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la sogs pa yid kyi yang yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la sogs pa yid kyi yang yin te /
translated: It is also mental, such as the consciousness of a yogi.

original: de la rmi lam gyi mthar yang gsal bar snang ba'i phyir rtog pa med pa yang yod kyi /
analyzed: de la rmi lam gyi mthar yang gsal bar snang ba'i phyir rtog pa med pa yang yod kyi /
translated: For, even at the end of a dream, there is non-conceptual mental perception, because it clearly appears.

original: ma 'khrul pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de bzlog pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos pa rigs pa nyid yin no ;
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de bzlog pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos pa rigs pa nyid yin no ;
translated: It is reasonable to say that it is non-erroneous in order to reverse that.

original: /'di ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang dbang po'i 'khrul pa yang srid de /
analyzed: /'di ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang dbang po'i 'khrul pa yang srid de /
translated: This is true, but it is possible that the sense faculties are erroneous.

original: des na 'di dag gi phyogs 'dir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di dag gi phyogs 'dir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable in this context.

original: dbang po las skyes pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir de min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir de min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to prove that it arises from the sense faculties, he says â€œit is not that,â€ and so on.

original: dbang po yod na yod pa'i phyir la dbang por 'gyur na yang gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba nyams pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'i blo bzhin du sgra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa'i blo 'di dbang po las skyesğŸ”½pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po yod na yod pa'i phyir la dbang por 'gyur na yang gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba nyams pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'i blo bzhin du sgra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa'i blo 'di dbang po las skyesğŸ”½pa yin no //
translated: Because it exists when the sense faculties exist and because when the sense faculties are impaired, the characteristics of impairment are observed, like the cognition of anotherâ€™s sense faculties, this cognition of sound, smell, and so on arises from the sense faculties.

original: gzhan yang gal te yid kyi 'khrul bar 'gyur na de'i tshe yid kyi 'khrul pa bzhin du dbang po'i blos bslad pa ma log par yang rgyu las ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te yid kyi 'khrul bar 'gyur na de'i tshe yid kyi 'khrul pa bzhin du dbang po'i blos bslad pa ma log par yang rgyu las ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if it were a mental error, then, just like a mental error, the sensory cognition would not be overturned even when the error is removed.

original: sbrul la sogs pa 'khrul pa bzhin //
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa 'khrul pa bzhin //
translated: Like the error of a snake, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: This is the example.ğŸ”½The other reductio is:ğŸ”½It would appear clearly.

original: gsal bar snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni thal bar 'gyur ba gzhan yin te /ğŸ”½rnam rtog rjes su 'brel pa la //
analyzed: gsal bar snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni thal bar 'gyur ba gzhan yin te / rnam rtog rjes su 'brel pa la //
translated: The response to that is:

original: don gsal snang ba ma yin te //
analyzed: don gsal snang ba ma yin te //
translated: The appearance of an object is not due to the connection with a concept,

original: de ni spyi'i rnam pa nyid kyi 'jug @17b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni spyi'i rnam pa nyid kyi 'jug @17b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages its object in a general way.

original: de yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi skyon gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: de yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi skyon gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The response to the qualm of the opponent that the reason is not established is:ğŸ”½If it exists, etc.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos su yod na yod pa nyid gtan tshigs yin na de'i tshe gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub po //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos su yod na yod pa nyid gtan tshigs yin na de'i tshe gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub po //
translated: If it exists in reality, then its existence is the reason. In that case, any reason is not established.

original: gzhan la 'khrul pa dbang po las dngos su skyes par ma grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan la 'khrul pa dbang po las dngos su skyes par ma grub ste /
translated: The error in the other is not established to arise directly from the sense faculty.

original: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be established.

original: ci ste spyir de yod na yod pa nyid gtan tshigs yin na de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste spyir de yod na yod pa nyid gtan tshigs yin na de'i tshe ma nges pa yin te /
translated: But if existence in general is the reason, then it is inconclusive,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dran pa'i blo la yang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dran pa'i blo la yang rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is concomitant with the cognition of memory, which is adverse to the probandum.

original: yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists.

original: gang yang de 'gyur na 'gyur ba nyid de yang dngos su ma grub la brgyud nas len na yang ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang yang de 'gyur na 'gyur ba nyid de yang dngos su ma grub la brgyud nas len na yang ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: And if it is the reason, then that itself is not established in fact, and if it is accepted indirectly, then it is inconclusive.

original: gang gi phyir 'di bong bu dang rta las skyes pa'i dre'u nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su bar chod na yang de'i rnam par 'gyur ba phyes bong bu'i ngo bo'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di bong bu dang rta las skyes pa'i dre'u nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su bar chod na yang de'i rnam par 'gyur ba phyes bong bu'i ngo bo'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen that even when there is an interruption in the state of the embryo of a mule, which is born from a mare and a donkey, there is a transformation of that, and it follows the form of the nature of the donkey.

original: de lta bas na 'di las dngos su skye bar ma grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di las dngos su skye bar ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that this is born from that in fact.

original: yid kyi 'khrul pa rnam par dpyad pa las ldog go zhes bya ba 'di yang dngos po'i spyi'i blo dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi 'khrul pa rnam par dpyad pa las ldog go zhes bya ba 'di yang dngos po'i spyi'i blo dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: And this statement â€œthe error of the intellect is averted by thorough analysisâ€ is also not ascertained by the cognition of a universal entity.

original: khyed cag gis rigs pas spyi med par rtogs kyang bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po las dngos po zhes bya ba'i spyi yang rung ste /
analyzed: khyed cag gis rigs pas spyi med par rtogs kyang bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po las dngos po zhes bya ba'i spyi yang rung ste /
translated: Even though you have understood by reasoning that there is no universal, still, with regard to an entity such as a pot, the universal â€œentityâ€ is suitable.

original: spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: The conceptual thought that has the aspect of a universal is not averted.

original: ci ste rigs pas rnam par dpyad pa las spyi'i blo 'di dag rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis ldog pa kho na'o snyam du sems na yang 'di yang lan ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste rigs pas rnam par dpyad pa las spyi'i blo 'di dag rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis ldog pa kho na'o snyam du sems na yang 'di yang lan ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that these cognitions of universals do not engage their own characteristics when they are thoroughly analyzed by reasoning, and in this way they are averted, then this is also not a response.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo la yang rig pas rnam par dpyad pa las 'di dag rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis ldog pa kho na'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo la yang rig pas rnam par dpyad pa las 'di dag rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis ldog pa kho na'o //
translated: Because, in the case of the cognition of two moons and so on, when they are thoroughly analyzed by reasoning, they are also averted in this way, by saying â€œthese do not engage their own characteristics.â€

original: de tsam gyis ni yid kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni yid kyi 'khrul par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But that alone does not constitute a mental error.

original: de dag gis yod pa ldog pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gis yod pa ldog pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And they do not deny the existence of the object.

original: de ni spyi'i blo dag dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ni spyi'i blo dag dang mtshungs te /
translated: This is similar to the case of the cognition of universals.

original: de dag kyang rang gi ngo bos ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang rang gi ngo bos ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: And they do not deny the existence of the universal by its own nature.

original: de yod pa na yod pa nyid //
analyzed: de yod pa na yod pa nyid //
translated: When that exists, it exists.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: This is the reply to the objection.

original: ma grub pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang grub pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not unestablished, but rather it is well established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: ma 'khrul pa zla ba gcig gis shes pas bar du bcad par ma grub pa'i phyir te /ğŸ”½bar du gcod pa de dmigs su rung ba las ma @18a * //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa zla ba gcig gis shes pas bar du bcad par ma grub pa'i phyir te / bar du gcod pa de dmigs su rung ba las ma @18a * //
translated: Because the nonerroneous cognition of one moon does not establish an obstruction.

original: dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the obstruction is not perceived, although it is perceptible.

original: 'di nyid gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsal bar byed do //
translated: This is clarified by the words â€œthat very moonâ€ and so on.

original: bar chad med pa ni zla ba gnyis la sogs pa zhes bya ba dang sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa ni zla ba gnyis la sogs pa zhes bya ba dang sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase â€œwithout obstructionâ€ is to be connected with â€œtwo moonsâ€ and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de 'gyur ba na 'gyur ba nyid kyang 'khrul pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de 'gyur ba na 'gyur ba nyid kyang 'khrul pa ma yin no //
translated: And because of that, when it changes, the change itself is not an error.

original: gang gis dre'u la sogs pa dag gis 'khrul bar 'gyur ba de yang bar chod pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis dre'u la sogs pa dag gis 'khrul bar 'gyur ba de yang bar chod pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And the error of the donkey, etc., is not due to an obstruction.

original: dngos po'i spyi'i blo rnams kyang gang gi tshe 'dod pas dpyod par byed pa de'i tshe rtog pa yod pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i spyi'i blo rnams kyang gang gi tshe 'dod pas dpyod par byed pa de'i tshe rtog pa yod pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: And when the idea of the universal of a thing is examined by the will, then there is the presence of imagination.

original: skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa'i blo rnams ni 'dod pas ldog pa srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa'i blo rnams ni 'dod pas ldog pa srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But the idea of a tangle of hair, etc., is not possible to be stopped by the will, and so is not uncertain.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: re zhig mig btsums pa ni 'dod pa'i dbang po'i shes pa yang 'dod pas mig btsums pa na 'dod pa'i dbang gis ldog pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig mig btsums pa ni 'dod pa'i dbang po'i shes pa yang 'dod pas mig btsums pa na 'dod pa'i dbang gis ldog pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The eye consciousness of the desire realm is stopped by the will, when the eye is closed by the will.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: 'dod pa log pa'i de ma thag tu mig gi rnam par shes pa ldog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa log pa'i de ma thag tu mig gi rnam par shes pa ldog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The eye consciousness of the desire realm is not stopped immediately after the will is stopped.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /ğŸ”½re zhig mig btsums pa na ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis byung la /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / re zhig mig btsums pa na ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis byung la /
translated: What is it?ğŸ”½When the eye is closed by the will, the eye consciousness arises from that.

original: de las mig log pa na de'i shes pa ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de las mig log pa na de'i shes pa ldog pa yin no //
translated: When the eye is turned away, the consciousness is stopped.

original: yid kyi 'khrul pa ni dngos su 'dod pa'i dbang gis ldog pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi 'khrul pa ni dngos su 'dod pa'i dbang gis ldog pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: But mental error is not similar, because it is eliminated by the power of desire.

original: 'di de lta bu yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di de lta bu yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: gang gi phyir mig phye ba nas blta bar mi 'dod na yang don mthong ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig phye ba nas blta bar mi 'dod na yang don mthong ba nyid yin te /
translated: Because when one opens oneâ€™s eyes and does not wish to see, one still sees objects.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la 'dod pas dngos su nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la 'dod pas dngos su nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, desire does not directly affect the visual consciousness, etc.

original: rang gi sde pa kha cig nyid ma 'khrul pa smos par mi 'dod pa de /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa kha cig nyid ma 'khrul pa smos par mi 'dod pa de /
translated: Some of our own schools do not accept the statement that it is non-erroneous.

original: dung ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa yang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dung ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa yang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the erroneous consciousness of a yellow conch, etc. is also not direct perception.

original: 'di ltar de ni rtags las ma skyes pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rtags las ma skyes pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin la /
translated: In this way, it is not inference because it is not born from a logical mark.

original: mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yang yin te /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yang yin te /
translated: But it is a valid cognition because it is non-deceptive.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mtshan nyid du ma 'khrul bas smos pa ma mdzad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mtshan nyid du ma 'khrul bas smos pa ma mdzad do //
translated: For that very reason, the master DignÄga did not state that it is non-erroneous in the definition.

original: 'khrul dang kun rdzob shes pa dang // rjes dpag ces bya ba la sogs pas mngon sum ltar snang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul dang kun rdzob shes pa dang // rjes dpag ces bya ba la sogs pas mngon sum ltar snang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and the knowledge of error and of the conventional, and inference, etc.

original: rtog pa dang bral zhing mi slu ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa de lta bu slob dpon mtshan nyid du bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral zhing mi slu ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa de lta bu slob dpon mtshan nyid du bzhed pa yin no //
translated: The Master has accepted the definition of direct perception as being free from conceptualization and non-erroneous.

original: rab rib bcas zhes bya ba'i rab rib kyi sgra 'di ni mi shes pa'i rnam grangs yin te /ğŸ”½rmongs pa rnams kyi rab rib 'joms //
analyzed: rab rib bcas zhes bya ba'i rab rib kyi sgra 'di ni mi shes pa'i rnam grangs yin te / rmongs pa rnams kyi rab rib 'joms //
translated: The word â€œcataraâ€ in the verse is a synonym for ignorance.

original: zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the statement: â€œThe eye is afflicted by cataracts.â€

original: @18b rab rib las byung ba ni rab rib can te bslu ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @18b rab rib las byung ba ni rab rib can te bslu ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The one who has cataracts is the one who has cataracts. The meaning is: the one who is deceived.

original: de min zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de min zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies to that in the following:

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not a valid cognition in the two modes,

original: snang ba ji lta ba bzhin du mi slu ba'am zhen pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin /
analyzed: snang ba ji lta ba bzhin du mi slu ba'am zhen pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin /
translated: because it is non-erroneous in accordance with appearance or because it is as it is in accordance with adherence.

original: de la 'dir snang ba ji lta ba bzhin du mi slu ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir snang ba ji lta ba bzhin du mi slu ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not non-erroneous in accordance with appearance.

original: de'i ser por snang ba de lta bur ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ser por snang ba de lta bur ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not obtain the appearance of yellow in that way.

original: zhen pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi slu ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zhen pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi slu ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it nondeceptive with regard to the object as it is conceived,

original: khyad par can gyi don bya ba byed pa nyid kyi ser po nyid du zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi don bya ba byed pa nyid kyi ser po nyid du zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is conceived to be yellow in the sense of performing the function of a special object.

original: de'i ngo bo'i don byed pa thob pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo'i don byed pa thob pa ma yin la /
translated: It does not obtain the performance of the function of that entity.

original: ma zhen pa'i don la mi slu ba nyid kyis kyang tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
