analyzed: ma zhen pa'i don la mi slu ba nyid kyis kyang tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it valid knowledge by virtue of being nondeceptive with regard to an object that is not conceived,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because that would be absurd.

original: sgra shad la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang snang ba la sogs pa ma zhen pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra shad la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang snang ba la sogs pa ma zhen pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the cognition of a sound's impermanence and so on obtains the nonconception of appearance and so on.

original: yang gal te zhen pa'i kha dog ma thob kyang dbyibs ni thob pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yang gal te zhen pa'i kha dog ma thob kyang dbyibs ni thob pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that even though the color as conceived is not obtained, the shape is definitely obtained,ğŸ”½then to respond:

original: de'i phyir kha dog las ni tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kha dog las ni tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The shape of a pot is not different from the color of a pot.

original: go bar zad do //
analyzed: go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is clear.

original: gal te rnam pa gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa klags te bstan to //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa klags te bstan to //
translated: If you think that the cognition of a pot is valid with regard to the shape of a pot,ğŸ”½then the cognition of a pot would be valid with regard to the color of a pot.

original: don byed pa la mi slu ba nyid tsam gyis rnam pa la ma ltos par tshad ma nyid du brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: don byed pa la mi slu ba nyid tsam gyis rnam pa la ma ltos par tshad ma nyid du brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not imagine that mere nondeceptiveness with respect to the objectâ€™s functioning is valid knowledge, without regard to the aspect.

original: yul gyi rnam pa la tshad ma ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa la tshad ma ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For it would follow, absurdly, that it would not be valid knowledge with respect to the aspect of the object.

original: de'i dbo zhes bya ba ni shes pa rang snang ba de'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de'i dbo zhes bya ba ni shes pa rang snang ba de'i ngo bo'o //
translated: â€œ Its objectâ€ is the object that is the nature of the cognition that appears to itself.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ji ltar don gyi rnam pa dang dkar ba la sogs pa nyid du skye ba de'i ngo bo'i yul de gzhal bya yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i slob dpon gyi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ji ltar don gyi rnam pa dang dkar ba la sogs pa nyid du skye ba de'i ngo bo'i yul de gzhal bya yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i slob dpon gyi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase â€œand so onâ€ indicates that it would contradict the masterâ€™s statement that the object that is the nature of the arising of the aspect of the object and of whiteness, etc. is the object of comprehension.

original: don byed pa la mi slu ba ni sngar gyi don nyams su myong ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i tshad ma gzhan las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar nges par bya'o //
analyzed: don byed pa la mi slu ba ni sngar gyi don nyams su myong ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i tshad ma gzhan las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar nges par bya'o //
translated: One should ascertain that nondeceptiveness with respect to the objectâ€™s functioning arises from another valid cognition, which is the full maturation of the latent potentialities of the experience of the previous object.

original: dung ser por shes pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rgyu ni dung dkar po nyid yin te /
analyzed: dung ser por shes pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rgyu ni dung dkar po nyid yin te /
translated: The cause of the full maturation of the latent potentialities of the cognition of the yellow conch is the white conch itself.

original: de'i dkar pos de yongs su smin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dkar pos de yongs su smin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its whiteness is fully matured.

original: bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rgyu las mi slu ba gang zhig kun nas bslangs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rgyu las mi slu ba gang zhig kun nas bslangs pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is fully matured from the cause of the latent impressions, and which is not deceptive, is what is meant by that.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rang rig pa rnams ji ltar mngon sum yin zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rang rig pa rnams ji ltar mngon sum yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the self-awareness of pleasure, etc. is direct perception?

original: yid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œthe mind, etc.â€

original: rigs pa gang zhes bya ba ni brda mi nus pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa gang zhes bya ba ni brda mi nus pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œWhat is reasonableâ€ refers to the inability to make conventional symbols, etc.

original: 'dir gal te yang yid kyi rigs pa ma brjod pa de lta @19a * //
analyzed: 'dir gal te yang yid kyi rigs pa ma brjod pa de lta @19a * //
translated: Here, although the mind is not mentioned,

original: na yang dbang po'i shes pa la brda mi nus pa'i rigs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: na yang dbang po'i shes pa la brda mi nus pa'i rigs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: nevertheless, what is reasonable for the sensory consciousnesses, the inability to make conventional symbols,ğŸ”½is the same for that.

original: de la yang mtshungs pa'am yang na 'di la rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa yang yid yin la /
analyzed: de la yang mtshungs pa'am yang na 'di la rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa yang yid yin la /
translated: Or else, in this case, the yogic perception is also the mind,

original: de yang chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that would be cut off.

original: lung la grags pa yin pa'i phyir 'dir yid kyi mtshan nyid ma byas la /
analyzed: lung la grags pa yin pa'i phyir 'dir yid kyi mtshan nyid ma byas la /
translated: Since it is well known in the scriptures, the definition of the mind is not given here.

original: tshad mas gnod pa ni slob dpon gyis bsgrub pa zin pa'i phyir yang kho bo cag gis bsgrub par mi bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa ni slob dpon gyis bsgrub pa zin pa'i phyir yang kho bo cag gis bsgrub par mi bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The master has already established this, so we do not need to prove it again.

original: gzhan rig byed pa yang ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas bye brag pa'i lugs kyi dogs pa bsu pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan rig byed pa yang ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas bye brag pa'i lugs kyi dogs pa bsu pa yin te /
translated: The phrase â€œnor is it a cognition of something externalâ€ anticipates the objection of the VaiÅ›eá¹£ika school.

original: rang rig pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi phyi rol gyi don rig par byed pa ma yin pa de ni shes pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang rig pa ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi phyi rol gyi don rig par byed pa ma yin pa de ni shes pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is not only not a form of reflexive awareness, it is also not a cognition of an external object, nor is it a cognition that has the nature of consciousness.

original: de dag gi grub pa'i mtha' ni bdag cag la 'dun pa'i shes pa rig par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi grub pa'i mtha' ni bdag cag la 'dun pa'i shes pa rig par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Their philosophical tenet is that the object of the desirous cognition is the self.

original: phyi rol dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gegs par byed do ;
analyzed: phyi rol dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gegs par byed do ;
translated: The phrase â€œexternal thingsâ€ and so on rejects this.

original: 'di ni dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni dam bca' ba mngon sum dang 'gal bar bshad do //
translated: This is explained as a thesis that contradicts direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir spyi'i dngos po dmigs pa'i shes pa dang dus mnyam du bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba de'i tshe gang gis na don gcig la ston pa'i shes pas rig par bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyi'i dngos po dmigs pa'i shes pa dang dus mnyam du bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba de'i tshe gang gis na don gcig la ston pa'i shes pas rig par bya bar 'gyur /
translated: Because when one experiences pleasure and so on simultaneously with the consciousness that observes a general object, how could the object be known by the consciousness that observes the object?

original: re zhig phyi rol la dmigs pa'i mig la sogs pa'i shes pa de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phyi rol la dmigs pa'i mig la sogs pa'i shes pa de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the eye consciousness and so on that observes the external object that knows it,

original: de'i dmigs pa ni phyi rol yin pa'i phyir dang / bde ba la sogs pa ni nang du rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi shes pas rig par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni phyi rol yin pa'i phyir dang / bde ba la sogs pa ni nang du rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi shes pas rig par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its object is external and because pleasure and so on are known internally and because it is asserted that they are known by mental consciousness.

original: de'i dus na yid kyi shes pa srid pa yang ma yin te ;
analyzed: de'i dus na yid kyi shes pa srid pa yang ma yin te ;
translated: Also, at that time, mental consciousness does not exist,

original: shes pa rnams ni rim gyis skye ba yin no zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rnams ni rim gyis skye ba yin no zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that consciousnesses arise in sequence.

original: ci ste yang shes pa rnams kyi skye ba rim gyis khas blangs kyi gnas pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang shes pa rnams kyi skye ba rim gyis khas blangs kyi gnas pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that consciousnesses arise in sequence but do not endure in sequence,

original: 'di yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that also is not correct.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad skad cig ma nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad skad cig ma nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has already been proven that all that is produced is momentary.

original: mgyogs par 'jug pas cig car 'khrul pa gang yin pa de yang sngar gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: mgyogs par 'jug pas cig car 'khrul pa gang yin pa de yang sngar gsal ba nyid do //
translated: And the error that it is simultaneous because it operates quickly was already clarified above.

original: gzhan yang bde ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid yin na dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos gsal bar snang bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid yin na dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos gsal bar snang bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if pleasure and so on were the objects of conceptual consciousness, they would not appear clearly in the aspect of joy, sorrow, and so on,

original: yid kyi shes pas rig par bya ba @19b nyid du khas len pa'i phyir dang / de yang rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi shes pas rig par bya ba @19b nyid du khas len pa'i phyir dang / de yang rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that they are known by mental consciousness and because that is conceptual.

original: rnam rtog rjes su 'brel pa la //
analyzed: rnam rtog rjes su 'brel pa la //
translated: When there is a connection with conceptuality,

original: don gsal snang ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don gsal snang ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: there is no clear appearance of an object.

original: kho bo cag gis ni yul gyi de ma thag pa yul lhan cig byed pa can gyi dbang po'i shes pas bskyed pa nyid mngon sum du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni yul gyi de ma thag pa yul lhan cig byed pa can gyi dbang po'i shes pas bskyed pa nyid mngon sum du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: We accept that the object immediately preceding it is generated by the sense consciousness that has the object as its cooperative condition.

original: ; gzhan yang bde ba la sogs pa la gzung bar bya ba yin no /
analyzed: ; gzhan yang bde ba la sogs pa la gzung bar bya ba yin no /
translated: Moreover, pleasure, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par chad par snang bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par chad par snang bar 'gyur na /
translated: would be perceived as separate from the consciousness, like blue, etc.

original: sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo shes pa las rnam par chad par dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo shes pa las rnam par chad par dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But the essence of pleasure, etc. is not perceived as separate from the consciousness.

original: sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos shes pa las tha mi dad par 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos shes pa las tha mi dad par 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the consciousness is mistaken in apprehending the essence of pleasure, etc. as not different from itself,

original: 'on te de lta na bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yang dag par reg pa'i ngo bo yod par grub ste /
analyzed: 'on te de lta na bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yang dag par reg pa'i ngo bo yod par grub ste /
translated: then the essence of the real contact that has the nature of pleasure, etc. is established as existing,

original: sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the characteristic of being the mere essence of pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa de'i ngo bo yin no zhe na ni bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin yin par grub bo //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa de'i ngo bo yin no zhe na ni bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rang bzhin yin par grub bo //
translated: If you say that the essence of the consciousness of pleasure, etc. is that, then the nature of the consciousness of pleasure, etc. is established.

original: tha dad par ma grub pas 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par ma grub pas 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established as different, there is no mistake.

original: sim pa ni rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sim pa ni rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: Agreeable is favorable.

original: de las ldog pa ni sim pa ma yin pa ni sogs pa'i sgras btang snyoms gzung ngo //
analyzed: de las ldog pa ni sim pa ma yin pa ni sogs pa'i sgras btang snyoms gzung ngo //
translated: The opposite of that is not pleasure, etc. The word â€œetc.â€ includes equanimity.

original: gal te rang gi rgyud la skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i yod pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi nyams su myong ba yin no zhes ni khas mi len gyi 'on kyang de'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba yin pa de'i
analyzed: gal te rang gi rgyud la skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i yod pa gang yin pa de nyid de dag gi nyams su myong ba yin no zhes ni khas mi len gyi 'on kyang de'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba yin pa de'i
translated: If pleasure, etc. exist in the form of the characteristics of arising in oneâ€™s own continuum, then that itself is their experience.

original: tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa na de nyams su myong ba bzhin du dkar ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs mtshungs par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½rgyud tha dad du 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa na de nyams su myong ba bzhin du dkar ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs mtshungs par 'gyur ro // rgyud tha dad du 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: When yogins apprehend the pleasure, etc. of others, they are similar to those who experience them in terms of the state of clarity, etc.

original: gnas skabs mtshungs pa zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs mtshungs pa zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: But it is not correct to say that they are similar in state because they engage in different continua.

original: rang gi rgyud la 'jug pa ni de dag gi nyams su myong bar khas mi len no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la 'jug pa ni de dag gi nyams su myong bar khas mi len no //
translated: It is not accepted that the experience of those is engagement in oneâ€™s own continuum.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba yin la /
translated: It is the arising of consciousness that has them as its object.

original: de yang rgyud gzhan 'dzin pa dag la yang yod pa'i phyir mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rgyud gzhan 'dzin pa dag la yang yod pa'i phyir mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since the otherâ€™s continuum also exists, it follows that the otherâ€™s continuum would also experience the feeling.

original: ci ste bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam pa gnyi ga nyams su myong bar khas len par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam pa gnyi ga nyams su myong bar khas len par byed na /
translated: If you accept that both aspects of pleasure and so on are experienced,

original: de'i tshe rang gi rgyud la 'jug pa nyid du nyams su myong ba na bde ba la sogs pa bdag nyid rig par grub pa nyid do //ğŸ”½de lta na ni rang gi rgyud la 'jug pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan rgyud gzhan la @20a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi rgyud la 'jug pa nyid du nyams su myong ba na bde ba la sogs pa bdag nyid rig par grub pa nyid do // de lta na ni rang gi rgyud la 'jug pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan rgyud gzhan la @20a * //
translated: then when they are experienced as engaging oneâ€™s own continuum, it is established that pleasure and so on are reflexive awareness.

original: 'jug pa las khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa las khyad par can yin no //
translated: In that case, the reason that they engage oneâ€™s own continuum is distinguished from engaging anotherâ€™s continuum.

original: gal te rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin na 'o na gang dag gi ltar na rnal 'byor pa ma grub pa dpyod pa la sogs pa de dag gi ltar na ji ltar de dag gis thal bar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin na 'o na gang dag gi ltar na rnal 'byor pa ma grub pa dpyod pa la sogs pa de dag gi ltar na ji ltar de dag gis thal bar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: If they are reflexive awareness, then how could the MÄ«mÄá¹ƒsakas and so on, who do not accept reflexive awareness, be refuted?

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, â€œIf you say that the otherâ€™s suffering . . .â€

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams bzhin du gzhan gyi ltar na don dam par rjes su dpag pa yul med pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams bzhin du gzhan gyi ltar na don dam par rjes su dpag pa yul med pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: For others, unlike Buddhists, inference does not have a nonexistent object in the ultimate.

original: de lta bas na gzhan gyi sdug bsngal rjes su dpag pa na rjes su dpog pa po dang yang nyams su myong ba mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan gyi sdug bsngal rjes su dpag pa na rjes su dpog pa po dang yang nyams su myong ba mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when one infers anotherâ€™s pain, the one who infers and the one who experiences are similar.

original: bde byed pa bdag po ni bde ba la sogs pa ni shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: bde byed pa bdag po ni bde ba la sogs pa ni shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The creator of pleasure is the master of pleasure, etc., but pleasure, etc., are not of the nature of consciousness,

original: shes pa zhes tha snyad du ma byas pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: shes pa zhes tha snyad du ma byas pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: because they are not designated as consciousness, like a pot, etc.

original: gal te brda zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad de /
analyzed: gal te brda zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad de /
translated: If they are different, etc., explains the refutation.

original: gal te brda gzhan nyid kyis rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur na de lta na gang gi tshe shes pa yin na yang 'ga' zhig gis shes pa ma yin zhes brda byas pa de'i tshe sems la shes pa zhes tha snyad du byas pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te brda gzhan nyid kyis rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur na de lta na gang gi tshe shes pa yin na yang 'ga' zhig gis shes pa ma yin zhes brda byas pa de'i tshe sems la shes pa zhes tha snyad du byas pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: If pleasure, etc., are different from consciousness, then when consciousness is designated as something else, at that time, since consciousness is not designated as consciousness, it would not be consciousness.

original: khyed cag la shes pa yang shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed cag la shes pa yang shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: For you, consciousness would not be consciousness.

original: ci ste gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa gsal bar nyams su myong ba'i phyir shes pa ma yin par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa gsal bar nyams su myong ba'i phyir shes pa ma yin par mi 'gyur na /
translated: But if it is not so because manifest consciousness is experienced as manifest,

original: de lta na 'di thams cad bde ba la sogs pa la yang mtshungs la /
analyzed: de lta na 'di thams cad bde ba la sogs pa la yang mtshungs la /
translated: then this is the same for all, even pleasure, etc.

original: gtan tshigs kyang 'di nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang 'di nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: And because this very reason is deceptive, this is nothing at all.

original: 'chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen par grub par ro //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen par grub par ro //
translated: It will be explained means in the Proof of Omniscience.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the misconception about the result of valid cognition,

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says Here, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi gzhal bya la yul rtogs pa ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi gzhal bya la yul rtogs pa ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The object of comprehension of external objects is the result of valid cognition,

original: 'dra ba ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: and similarity is valid cognition.

original: rang rig pa la yang 'di rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du snang ba'i phyir shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi gzhal bya la rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: rang rig pa la yang 'di rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du snang ba'i phyir shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi gzhal bya la rang rig pa ni 'bras bu yin la /
translated: And in the case of reflexive awareness, it is the object that is of the nature of consciousness that appears in a manner corresponding to its object. Reflexive awareness is the effect.

original: rung ba nyid ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rung ba nyid ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: And the suitability is the valid cognition.

original: bya ba dang bcas pa'i shes pa nye bar blangs nas gang gis de'i bdag nyid rig par byed kyi /
analyzed: bya ba dang bcas pa'i shes pa nye bar blangs nas gang gis de'i bdag nyid rig par byed kyi /
translated: The cognition that is engaged in the action is the subject that is aware of itself.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba dang 'dra ba'i rung ba nyid ni shes pa kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba dang 'dra ba'i rung ba nyid ni shes pa kho na'i yin no //
translated: It is not a pot, for example. The suitability belongs only to cognition.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i rung ba nyid kyi shes pa bdag @20b nyid gsal ba nyid du mtshon pa'i phyir rung ba nyid kyis rang rig pa tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i rung ba nyid kyi shes pa bdag @20b nyid gsal ba nyid du mtshon pa'i phyir rung ba nyid kyis rang rig pa tshad ma yin no //
translated: The suitability that is the cause is the cognition that is the subject that is illuminated. Because it is indicated, the suitability of reflexive awareness is the valid cognition.ğŸ”½And that is explained as follows:

original: de yang / de la'ang nyams myong bdag nyid phyir //ğŸ”½rang bdag rig pa de rung nyid //
analyzed: de yang / de la'ang nyams myong bdag nyid phyir // rang bdag rig pa de rung nyid //
translated: Because it has the nature of experience,ğŸ”½the self-awareness of that is the suitability.

original: de phyir rung nyid de tshad bdag //
analyzed: de phyir rung nyid de tshad bdag //
translated: Therefore, the suitability is the self of valid cognition.

original: gzhal bya rang rig 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: gzhal bya rang rig 'bras bu yin //
translated: The object of comprehension is the effect of reflexive awareness.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: And that is explained as follows:

original: ji ltar seng ldeng bcad gyur na //
analyzed: ji ltar seng ldeng bcad gyur na //
translated: Just as when a piece of acacia wood is cut,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun m'a la ri la'i klan ka'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun m'a la ri la'i klan ka'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: This is Kumarilaâ€™s objection anticipated.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu tha dad par smra ba rnam sla sangs rgyas pas gal te tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag tha dad pas khas len na /
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu tha dad par smra ba rnam sla sangs rgyas pas gal te tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag tha dad pas khas len na /
translated: The result of valid cognition is different, according to the Buddhist, who is easy to refute. If you accept that valid cognition and its result are different,

original: de'i tshe tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag yul tha dad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag yul tha dad par 'gyur na /
translated: then valid cognition and its result would have different objects.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not reasonable.

original: gcod par byed pa'i sta re seng ldeng la bab pa na /
analyzed: gcod par byed pa'i sta re seng ldeng la bab pa na /
translated: When an axe strikes an acacia tree,

original: pa la sha 'chad par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa la sha 'chad par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: the acacia does not break.

original: de lta bas na tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag yul gcig pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa ma yin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag yul gcig pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa ma yin no zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, because valid cognition and its result have the same object, they are not different.

original: 'dir ku m'a la ri las /
analyzed: 'dir ku m'a la ri las /
translated: Here Kumarila says:

original: gang zhig yul gcig 'dod pa na //
analyzed: gang zhig yul gcig 'dod pa na //
translated: If you assert that they have the same object,

original: tshad ma 'bras bu nyid smra ba //
analyzed: tshad ma 'bras bu nyid smra ba //
translated: and that valid cognition is the result,

original: de la bsgrub bya sgrub byed dag / tha dad 'jig rten pa yis gnod //
analyzed: de la bsgrub bya sgrub byed dag / tha dad 'jig rten pa yis gnod //
translated: then the mundane would refute that the probandum and the proof are different.

original: ji ltar gcod byed seng ldeng la //
analyzed: ji ltar gcod byed seng ldeng la //
translated: How could the acacia

original: bab pas pa la sha mi 'chad //
analyzed: bab pas pa la sha mi 'chad //
translated: The axe does not cut the wood,ğŸ”½and the world does not cut the axe.

original: de bzhin 'jig rten na gcod dang // sta re lhan cig gcig ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes smras so //
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig rten na gcod dang // sta re lhan cig gcig ma yin // zhes smras so //
translated: Thus, in the world, the axe does not exist simultaneously with the cutting.

original: 'dis gcod par byed pas na gcod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis gcod par byed pas na gcod pa'o //
translated: The axe is the instrument because it cuts.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan bshad do //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan bshad do //
translated: The reply to this is:

original: 'di ni sngon po rigs pa yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes yul rtogs pa rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni don dang 'dra ba nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par bya ba dang rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i
analyzed: 'di ni sngon po rigs pa yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes yul rtogs pa rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan ni don dang 'dra ba nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par bya ba dang rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i
translated: The reason for positing the cognition of an object is the similarity to the object, not anything else.

original: ngo bos bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed par rnam par gzhag gi bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos pos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bos bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed par rnam par gzhag gi bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos pos ni ma yin no //
translated: The instrument is established by its nature as that which accomplishes the object to be accomplished, not by the relation of producer and produced.

original: gang gi phyir don dam par byed pa po dang byed pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par byed pa po dang byed pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because ultimately the entities of the agent, instrument, etc. do not exist.

original: chos thams cad ni skad cig ma nyid kyis bya ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni skad cig ma nyid kyis bya ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are devoid of action, since they are momentary.

original: shes pa yul gyi rnam par skye ba na yul yongs su gcod bzhin pa na bya ba dang bcas pa lta bur snang ste /
analyzed: shes pa yul gyi rnam par skye ba na yul yongs su gcod bzhin pa na bya ba dang bcas pa lta bur snang ste /
translated: When consciousness arises in the aspect of an object, it appears as if it has action, while it is apprehending the object.

original: don la shes pa'i chos shes par byed pa'i bya ba ni 'di nyid yin gyi /ğŸ”½med na mi 'byung ba tsam ma yin no //ğŸ”½gang gis shes pa nyid tshad mar 'gyur ba myu gu la sogs pa sa bon la sogs pa med @21a * //
analyzed: don la shes pa'i chos shes par byed pa'i bya ba ni 'di nyid yin gyi / med na mi 'byung ba tsam ma yin no // gang gis shes pa nyid tshad mar 'gyur ba myu gu la sogs pa sa bon la sogs pa med @21a * //
translated: In reality, this is the action of consciousness that causes the object to be known.ğŸ”½It is not merely the non-arising of consciousness without the object.

original: na mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: na mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the sprout, etc. are non-arising without the seed, etc.

original: de lta bas na shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, consciousness with an aspect is not a valid cognition.

original: rnam pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa tshad ma nyid kyis bsten par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa tshad ma nyid kyis bsten par bya ba yin la /
translated: It is not without an aspect. This is the presentation that should be relied upon by valid cognition.

original: rnam par 'jog pa yang de'i rjes la thob pa'i rnam par rtog pas yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa yang de'i rjes la thob pa'i rnam par rtog pas yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And the presentation is to be understood as being by conceptual thought that is subsequent to that.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten na grags pa nyid kyis gnod pa bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten na grags pa nyid kyis gnod pa bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the objection is invalidated by what is well known in the world, as in the case of the different concepts.

original: gzhu la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni gzhus 'bigs so //
analyzed: gzhu la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni gzhus 'bigs so //
translated: Like a bow, etc.

original: gzhu la brten nas mdas 'bigs so zhes ji ltar gzhu gcig la byed pa po la sogs pa brtag pa mi 'gal ba de bzhin du 'di la yang yin no //
analyzed: gzhu la brten nas mdas 'bigs so zhes ji ltar gzhu gcig la byed pa po la sogs pa brtag pa mi 'gal ba de bzhin du 'di la yang yin no //
translated: Just as it is not contradictory to say that an arrow is shot by a bow, and that the arrow is shot in dependence on the bow, so it is here.

original: sta res shing la sogs pa bcad do zhes brjod pa na gcad par bya ba'i rdzas la zhugs pa nyid gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: sta res shing la sogs pa bcad do zhes brjod pa na gcad par bya ba'i rdzas la zhugs pa nyid gnas pa yin no //
translated: When it is said that a tree, etc. is cut by an axe, the axe is engaged with the substance to be cut.

original: zhugs pa de la yang sta re'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir don dam par gcod pa dang lhan cig gcig yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: zhugs pa de la yang sta re'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir don dam par gcod pa dang lhan cig gcig yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: And in that engagement, since the axe is the nature of the axe, it is not ultimately contradictory to be one with the cutter, because it is a quality.

original: rnam par gzhag pa grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ston pa yin no //
translated: He shows that with â€œthe establishment of the presentation,â€ etc.

original: ji ltar ku m'a la ri las /
analyzed: ji ltar ku m'a la ri las /
translated: As it says in the KumÄrila:

original: yongs su gcod pa'i 'bras bu yis //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i 'bras bu yis //
translated: The result of the determination

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bos tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa byas pa de bzhin du kho bo cag la yang mi 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bos tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa byas pa de bzhin du kho bo cag la yang mi 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, the result of valid cognition is posited in terms of the nature of that which is produced and that which produces it. In the same way, there is no contradiction in our system.

original: ji skad du slob dpon gyis de la yang mig la sogs pa de'i rgyu la mngon sum nyid du btags pas 'gal ba med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji skad du slob dpon gyis de la yang mig la sogs pa de'i rgyu la mngon sum nyid du btags pas 'gal ba med do zhes bshad do //
translated: As the Acarya has said, â€œIn that case, there is no contradiction, since the eye, etc. are designated as the cause of that.â€

original: gdon mi za bar thog mar rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed par rnam par gzhag par bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig smra ba yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar thog mar rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed par rnam par gzhag par bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig smra ba yin no //
translated: We are simply saying that it is necessary to first establish the object of demonstration and the means of demonstration by way of positing them.

original: rig pa tha dad pa yul tha dad par rnam par ma bzhag par nges par 'jug par mi rigs la /
analyzed: rig pa tha dad pa yul tha dad par rnam par ma bzhag par nges par 'jug par mi rigs la /
translated: It is not correct to engage in ascertainment without positing different awarenesses with different objects.

original: rig pa tha dad par rnam par 'jog na yang 'dra ba nyid rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir shugs kyis 'dra ba sgrub byed dam pa nyid du thob po //
analyzed: rig pa tha dad par rnam par 'jog na yang 'dra ba nyid rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir shugs kyis 'dra ba sgrub byed dam pa nyid du thob po //
translated: And when different awarenesses are posited, since similarity is the reason, similarity is implicitly established as the best object of demonstration.

original: shes pa ni 'dra ba nyid kyis 'jug par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: shes pa ni 'dra ba nyid kyis 'jug par byed pa yin la /
translated: Cognition engages its object by way of a likeness.

original: 'jug par byed na yang tshad ma nyid du 'jug par 'dod pas dpyad par bya'i zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par byed na yang tshad ma nyid du 'jug par 'dod pas dpyad par bya'i zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: And when it engages, it is accepted as valid cognition, so it is to be analyzed, but not by way of adherence.

original: ji skad du don byed pa don du nye bar rtog pa dang @21b ldan pa thams cad tshad ma ma tshad ma ma yin pa tshol gyis zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du don byed pa don du nye bar rtog pa dang @21b ldan pa thams cad tshad ma ma tshad ma ma yin pa tshol gyis zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: As it is said, â€œAll who seek valid cognition in order to understand objects that perform functions should seek valid cognition, not non-valid cognition.â€

original: de'i shes pa cha gang gis 'jug par 'gyur ba de nyid bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i shes pa cha gang gis 'jug par 'gyur ba de nyid bstan par bya'o //
translated: We should teach that very aspect of cognition by which it engages.

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ngo bos tshad ma rnam par 'jog na 'jug par byed pa'i yan lag 'dra ba nyid rtog ste /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ngo bos tshad ma rnam par 'jog na 'jug par byed pa'i yan lag 'dra ba nyid rtog ste /
translated: If valid cognition is posited by way of the produced and producer, then the aspect of engagement is imagined.

original: de lta yin dang skye ba'i sgo nas tshad ma rnam par 'jog pa 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang skye ba'i sgo nas tshad ma rnam par 'jog pa 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, positing valid cognition by way of production would be pointless.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis de'i sgo nas tshad ma rnam par 'jog pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin no snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis de'i sgo nas tshad ma rnam par 'jog pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin no snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: Therefore the master thinks that positing valid cognition by way of that is not an aspect of engagement.

original: 'dis nye bar btags pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis nye bar btags pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: This is based on what is designated.

original: de lta bas na rnam par gzhag pa grub na /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par gzhag pa grub na /
translated: Therefore, when the establishment is accomplished,

original: de rnam pa gzhan du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bos rtog pa de lta na yang skyon med pa nyid do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa gzhan du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bos rtog pa de lta na yang skyon med pa nyid do zhes bya'o //
translated: even if one imagines that it is to be generated in another aspect, and that it is the nature of the generator, there is no fault.

original: tshad ma'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ku m'a la ri la'i 'bras bu rnam par 'jog pa de nyid ston to //
analyzed: tshad ma'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ku m'a la ri la'i 'bras bu rnam par 'jog pa de nyid ston to //
translated: By valid cognition, etc., he shows that the establishment of the fruit of the KumÄrÄ«la tree is just that.

original: 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'jug pa ste mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'jug pa ste mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The engaged is the engagement, the eye, etc.

original: 'bras bu gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni dor ba dang blang ba dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid kyi blo'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni dor ba dang blang ba dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid kyi blo'o //
translated: The other fruit is the cognition characterized by rejection, acceptance, and equanimity.

original: gzhan 'di yang ku m'a la ri la nyid kyis smras pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan 'di yang ku m'a la ri la nyid kyis smras pa yin te /
translated: This other one also is stated by KumÄrÄ«la himself.

original: rang rig pa ni bkag pa'i phyir tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid du mi rigs la yul gyi rnam pa can yang tshad ma yin na tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag yul tha dad pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni bkag pa'i phyir tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid du mi rigs la yul gyi rnam pa can yang tshad ma yin na tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag yul tha dad pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because reflexive awareness is refuted, it is not tenable that it is the result of valid knowledge. If the aspect of the object is valid knowledge, then it follows that valid knowledge and its result would be different objects.

original: 'di ltar yul gyi rnam pa ni phyi rol gyi yul yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul gyi rnam pa ni phyi rol gyi yul yin la /
translated: In this way, the aspect of the object is an external object.

original: rang rig pa ni shes pas rang rig ngo bos yul yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa ni shes pas rang rig ngo bos yul yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Reflexive awareness is the object of the essence of consciousness.

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: He replies to that with â€œAll . . .â€

original: dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin na //
analyzed: dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin na //
translated: If the object is not directly perceived,

original: don mthong rab tu 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: don mthong rab tu 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: then seeing the object will not be established.

original: zhes bya bas don thams cad mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rang rig pa dgag par mi nus la /
analyzed: zhes bya bas don thams cad mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rang rig pa dgag par mi nus la /
translated: Since it follows that all objects would not be directly perceived, reflexive awareness cannot be refuted.

original: yul tha dad pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical that it follows that they would be different objects.

original: gang gi phyir de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa yin yang don rig par 'dod la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa yin yang don rig par 'dod la /
translated: Because it is its result, even though it is reflexive awareness, it is asserted to be the awareness of the object.

original: rang rig pa ni de dang 'dra ba'i phyir de'i rang bzhin nyid ni ma yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rang rig pa ni de dang 'dra ba'i phyir de'i rang bzhin nyid ni ma yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: because self-awareness is similar to that, it is not its nature, so there is no contradiction.

original: tshad ma rang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bde byed bdag po tshad ma byed pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma rang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bde byed bdag po tshad ma byed pa yin te /
translated: As for the statement beginning â€œIf valid cognition were to arise from itself,â€ the author of the Bá¹›haspati Upaniá¹£ad is the one who makes the argument.

original: tshad ma ni bdag las tha dad pa'i phyir @22a * //
analyzed: tshad ma ni bdag las tha dad pa'i phyir @22a * //
translated: The argument is this: â€œValid cognition is different from itself,

original: bya ba byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa yin te /
translated: so it is an object of activity,

original: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ste'u la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ste'u la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: because it is an agent, like a saw and so on.â€

original: don med ces bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: don med ces bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin par byed de /
translated: The refutation of this is stated in the lines beginning â€œThis is pointless.â€

original: don med pa ni bsgrub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa ni bsgrub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pointlessness is because there is a fault in the proof of the probandum.

original: gang phyir yongs su gcod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyed par byed pa'i 'bras bu gzhan yang smras pa yin no //
analyzed: gang phyir yongs su gcod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyed par byed pa'i 'bras bu gzhan yang smras pa yin no //
translated: The other effect, the produced, is stated in the lines beginning â€œBecause it is the ascertainment.â€

original: ni'i sgra ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The word â€œbecauseâ€ is the reason.

original: ste'u la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe yang bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin te /
analyzed: ste'u la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe yang bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin te /
translated: The example, â€œlike a saw and so on,â€ is also incomplete with respect to the probandum.

original: gcod pa dang lhan cig nyid du bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcod pa dang lhan cig nyid du bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been explained to be simultaneous with the act of cutting.

original: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang skyed par byed pa nyid du brjod par 'dod na yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang skyed par byed pa nyid du brjod par 'dod na yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa ste /
translated: If you say that it is the agent because it is the producer, the reason is not established,

original: sgrub par byed pa ni rnam par 'jog par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni rnam par 'jog par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the proof is asserted to be the very establishment of the object.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.

original: 'jog par byed pa nyid brjod par 'dod na yang ma nges pa yin te /ğŸ”½'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½spyir brjod par 'dod na yang ma nges pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'jog par byed pa nyid brjod par 'dod na yang ma nges pa yin te / 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro // spyir brjod par 'dod na yang ma nges pa yin te ;
translated: If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.

analyzed: 'gal ba nye bar ma bstan pa'i phyir ro // gal te shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can du gyur na de'i tshe yul dang 'dra ba tshad ma nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.ğŸ”½If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.

original: ji srid du gzung bar bya ba'i yul dang mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji srid du gzung bar bya ba'i yul dang mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa skye ba ma yin te /
translated: If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established.

original: gzung bar bya ba de las rigs gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba de las rigs gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you assert that it is the establishment because it is the producer, the reason is not established

original: gzugs dang ro dag bzhin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang ro dag bzhin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: It is like the case of form and taste.ğŸ”½This is explained in the following lines:ğŸ”½If consciousness were the object grasped,

original: gal te shes pa gzung ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te shes pa gzung ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: etc.

original: kho bo cag rnam par shes pa smra ba rig pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis 'di 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chad pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag rnam par shes pa smra ba rig pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis 'di 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chad pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: We who are proponents of consciousness and followers of reason do not suffer from the slightest fault, because we accept this.

original: 'di ltar gang cung zad khyed cag gis brjod par gzung bar bya ba'i sun 'byin pa mi gsol ba 'di ni kho bo cag gis gzung bar bya ba rnam par dpyad pa'i don du sgrub par byed pa gsal por brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang cung zad khyed cag gis brjod par gzung bar bya ba'i sun 'byin pa mi gsol ba 'di ni kho bo cag gis gzung bar bya ba rnam par dpyad pa'i don du sgrub par byed pa gsal por brjod do //
translated: In this way, whatever you may say, you do not offer any refutation of the object of our analysis of the object of apprehension. We have clearly stated the proof of that.

original: gzung bar bya ba la 'dzin pa ni mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba la 'dzin pa ni mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: The apprehension of the object of apprehension is adherence.

original: de rnam par dpyad pa ni sel ba'o //
analyzed: de rnam par dpyad pa ni sel ba'o //
translated: The analysis of that is the refutation.

original: sgrub par byed pa gsal po de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa gsal po de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that clear proof?

original: bdag nyid thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œAll of its own nature,â€ etc.

original: don rigs mi mthun pa ji snyed cig las ldog pa de snyed cig kho na las shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: don rigs mi mthun pa ji snyed cig las ldog pa de snyed cig kho na las shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dra ba'o //
translated: As many as are the dissimilar things that are excluded, that many alone are known. This is the similarity in all respects.

original: dngos po cung zad tsam las ldog pa ni cha shas kyis mtshungs @22b pa'o ;
analyzed: dngos po cung zad tsam las ldog pa ni cha shas kyis mtshungs @22b pa'o ;
translated: The exclusion of a mere slight thing is by part.

original: ;'o na ji ltar 'di tshad ma nyid don dang 'dra bar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ;'o na ji ltar 'di tshad ma nyid don dang 'dra bar brjod ce na /
translated: How then is this a valid cognition that is said to be similar to the object?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œHowever,â€ and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba yod pa'am rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba yod pa'am rnam pa'o //
translated: â€œ Thatâ€ refers to the existence of similarity or the aspect.

original: yul dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa de gang la yod pa de ni rnam bcas so //
analyzed: yul dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa de gang la yod pa de ni rnam bcas so //
translated: That which has the aspect that is similar to the object is said to be â€œwith aspect.â€

original: gzung ba las zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don las so //
analyzed: gzung ba las zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don las so //
translated: â€œ From the objectâ€ means from the external object.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: â€œ Reflectionâ€ refers to the aspect of consciousness.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yul dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yul dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œ Because it is similar to thatâ€ means because it is similar to the object.

original: btags nas zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags nas so //
analyzed: btags nas zhes bya ba ni nye bar btags nas so //
translated: â€œ Having designatedâ€ means having imputed.

original: rig byed nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don gyi zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rig byed nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don gyi zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The term â€œonlyâ€ is understood to apply to the object.

original: ston pa ni rten no //
analyzed: ston pa ni rten no //
translated: The teacher is the basis.

original: yul la sogs log par rtogs pa ni spyi dngos por gyur ba bkag pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: yul la sogs log par rtogs pa ni spyi dngos por gyur ba bkag pa'i phyir la /
translated: The erroneous conception of the object, etc., is refuted by the general refutation of real entities.

original: dngos po'i yul can du 'dod pa'i mngon sum yang rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i yul yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i shugs kyis bstan pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can du 'dod pa'i mngon sum yang rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i yul yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i shugs kyis bstan pa'i phyir ro /
translated: And the direct perception that is accepted as having a real entity for its object is also indirectly indicated by the statement that it does not have an object that is other than its own intrinsic nature.

original: logs shig tu gsal ba ma byas so //ğŸ”½gang dag 'di mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: logs shig tu gsal ba ma byas so // gang dag 'di mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is not stated separately.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid byed pa ni ci nas kyang de'i ngo bos mtshon pa'i phyir de las gzhan dag 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam pas yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid byed pa ni ci nas kyang de'i ngo bos mtshon pa'i phyir de las gzhan dag 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam pas yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Some believe that this is not a definition of direct perception because the definition of a valid cognition is intended to indicate its intrinsic nature so that others can engage in it, not to define it.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa mtshon pa ni 'jig rten 'jug pa dang ldog par yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa mtshon pa ni 'jig rten 'jug pa dang ldog par yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: And the indication of freedom from conceptual thought, etc., is not relevant to engaging in or turning away from the world.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: gang gi mtshan nyid gzhan du byed par 'gyur ba rang gi 'dod pa dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi mtshan nyid gzhan du byed par 'gyur ba rang gi 'dod pa dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The nature of things that is accepted by you is not posited as a characteristic that is different from them.

original: 'on kyang ji lta ba bzhin du gzhag pa nyid kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin rjes su brjod nas grags pa dang ma grags pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par bstan par 'dod pas dper nas ni sra ba nyid lta bur de rigs pa mtshan nyid byed pa yin te
analyzed: 'on kyang ji lta ba bzhin du gzhag pa nyid kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin rjes su brjod nas grags pa dang ma grags pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par bstan par 'dod pas dper nas ni sra ba nyid lta bur de rigs pa mtshan nyid byed pa yin te
translated: However, the nature of things is described as it is, and then the difference between the nature of things that is renowned and the nature of things that is not renowned is taught. For example, the characteristic of earth is hardness.

original: / de lta ma yin na mi srid pa'i skyon gyis sun phyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de lta ma yin na mi srid pa'i skyon gyis sun phyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the opponent would be faulted for asserting an impossibility.

original: mngon sum gyis mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa dag las gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa dag las gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no characteristic that is illustrated by direct perception that is different from being free of conceptuality and being nondeceptive.

original: 'di ltar de la gdon mi za bar ma 'khrul par khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la gdon mi za bar ma 'khrul par khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: Thus, it is definitely necessary to accept that it is nondeceptive.

original: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is valid knowledge.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba yang yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also free of conceptuality.

original: dngos su rang gi mtshan nyid yul can yin pa'i phyir dang rang gi mtshan nyid la yang brda mi nus pa nyid kyis te rig pa ni mngon par ma brjod pa nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis rigs @23a * //
analyzed: dngos su rang gi mtshan nyid yul can yin pa'i phyir dang rang gi mtshan nyid la yang brda mi nus pa nyid kyis te rig pa ni mngon par ma brjod pa nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis rigs @23a * //
translated: because it is actually the subject of its own characteristics, and because it is impossible to apply a term to its own characteristics.

original: pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid brjod pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid brjod pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the wise have taught that the definition of a valid cognition is that it is nondeceptive.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams mtshan nyid 'di las 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag tu mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams mtshan nyid 'di las 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag tu mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Those who are rational do not engage in or refrain from activities based on this definition,

original: 'di ltar bum pa'i 'debs pa dang spyi dang grangs la sogs pa'i shes pa dang ngo bo shes pa'i shes pa dang de bzhin du dung la ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa gzhan dag gis mngon sum nyid du btags pa ni ci rigs su rtog pa dang
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa'i 'debs pa dang spyi dang grangs la sogs pa'i shes pa dang ngo bo shes pa'i shes pa dang de bzhin du dung la ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa gzhan dag gis mngon sum nyid du btags pa ni ci rigs su rtog pa dang
translated: because in this way, the cognition of a pot, the cognition of a universal, the cognition of number, etc., the cognition of the nature of something, and likewise, the cognition of yellow in a conch, etc., are designated as direct perception by other cognitions.

original: bcas pa nyid dang 'khrul pa nyid kyi mngon sum yin pa nges par bzung na de'i yul can nyid du nye bar btags pa'i grangs la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid du mngon par zhen pa las ldog par byed de /
analyzed: bcas pa nyid dang 'khrul pa nyid kyi mngon sum yin pa nges par bzung na de'i yul can nyid du nye bar btags pa'i grangs la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid du mngon par zhen pa las ldog par byed de /
translated: If one ascertains that it is direct perception that is both correct and non mistaken, then one will turn away from the conception that the things counted, etc., are real entities that are the objects of that direct perception.

original: gang yang bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid dngos po snyam du zhen nas de la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: gang yang bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid dngos po snyam du zhen nas de la 'jug par byed de /
translated: One may conceive that the intrinsic identity of blue, etc., which is not to be taught, is a real entity and then engage in it.

original: ji ltar mngon sum rtog pa med pa yin yang 'jug par byed pa nyid yin pa de ltar ni dang po nyid du bstan zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum rtog pa med pa yin yang 'jug par byed pa nyid yin pa de ltar ni dang po nyid du bstan zin to //
translated: Just as direct perception is nonconceptual, still it engages its object. This has already been explained above.

original: gal te de ltar na rtog pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid gcig nyid bya bar rigs par gyi ma 'khrul pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rtog pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid gcig nyid bya bar rigs par gyi ma 'khrul pa ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then it is proper to posit a single characteristic that is free from conceptuality. But it is not non mistaken.

original: 'di ltar 'jug pa las sngar rab tu grags pa gang yin pa de nyid 'jug par 'dod pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid du bya bar rigs kyi ma grags pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jug pa las sngar rab tu grags pa gang yin pa de nyid 'jug par 'dod pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid du bya bar rigs kyi ma grags pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is proper to posit as the characteristic of that which is asserted to engage its object that which is well known prior to engagement, not that which is not well known.

original: de ni med pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni med pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is as if it does not exist.

original: ma 'khrul pa nyid du nges pa ni don bya ba la mi slu ba las sngar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa nyid du nges pa ni don bya ba la mi slu ba las sngar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: One cannot ascertain non-error prior to non-deceptiveness with regard to an objectâ€™s function,

original: gang gi phyir tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis de'i 'bras bu rtog pa med par shes pa'i don ji lta ba nyid shes par mi nus te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis de'i 'bras bu rtog pa med par shes pa'i don ji lta ba nyid shes par mi nus te /
translated: because those who see only the present cannot know the object as it really is without conceiving its effect,

original: de dag gi dngos po'i nus pa ni rtag tu 'bras bu las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / don ji lta ba bzhin du ji ltar nye bar btags pa'i don thob par nus pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po'i nus pa ni rtag tu 'bras bu las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / don ji lta ba bzhin du ji ltar nye bar btags pa'i don thob par nus pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their capacity for things is always inferred from its effect, and because it is characterized by the ability to obtain the object as it is, just as it is designated.

original: dus phyis don ji lta ba bzhin du nges par bzung na yang 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dus phyis don ji lta ba bzhin du nges par bzung na yang 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if one ascertains it as it is later, it is not fruitful,

original: de la yang mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because one does not engage it.

original: de ni klan ka ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni klan ka ma yin te /
translated: This is not a criticism,ğŸ”½because it is not a criticism of the thesis.

original: ji ltar skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa'i blo rnams kyang tshad ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ha cang khyab pa'i skyon du 'gyur du 'ong ba de'i phyir gdon mi za bar ma 'khrul bar smos par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa'i blo rnams kyang tshad ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ha cang khyab pa'i skyon du 'gyur du 'ong ba de'i phyir gdon mi za bar ma 'khrul bar smos par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: with regard to.

original: gang yang 'jug pa las sngar mi nges pa'i rgyu ni tshu rol mthong @23b ba nyid yin par brjod pa de yang ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang yang 'jug pa las sngar mi nges pa'i rgyu ni tshu rol mthong @23b ba nyid yin par brjod pa de yang ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: As for the statement in the Avatara that the reason why the world is not certain is because they are only able to see a limited range of possibilities, this is not certain.

original: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis 'ga' zhig tu ma nges par 'gyur du dogs so zhes pa gang yin pa 'di la su zhig gis gegs byas /
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis 'ga' zhig tu ma nges par 'gyur du dogs so zhes pa gang yin pa 'di la su zhig gis gegs byas /
translated: What is to stop one from suspecting that those who see only a limited range of possibilities are not certain in some cases?

original: de lta na ni de dag gis cung zad kyang mi nges so zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na ni de dag gis cung zad kyang mi nges so zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: If that were the case, then they would not be certain in the least.

original: de lta yin dang de dag sems pa med pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de dag sems pa med pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And if that were the case, then they would be devoid of thought.

original: gang gi phyir goms pa'i stobs kyis skye ba'i shes pa'i bag chags 'jug pa'i phyugs kyi phru gu dag kyang 'di ni bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir goms pa'i stobs kyis skye ba'i shes pa'i bag chags 'jug pa'i phyugs kyi phru gu dag kyang 'di ni bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Because of the power of habit, the latent impressions of the consciousness that arises from the habit are deposited.

original: 'di ni bde ba ma yin pa'i snyam du 'jug pa las sngar des na g-yang sa la sogs pa spong ba dang nu ma la sogs pa len par byed par mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba ma yin pa'i snyam du 'jug pa las sngar des na g-yang sa la sogs pa spong ba dang nu ma la sogs pa len par byed par mthong ba nyid do //
translated: Even calves, when they see their mothers, approach them with the thought, â€œThis is my source of comfort,â€ and avoid what is not comfort.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa goms pa'i 'dod pa dang mya ngan dang 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams kyang goms pas chos mthun pa la sogs pa dran pa la ltos pa med par shes pa gsal bar snang ba skyed pa'i nus pa dmigsğŸ”½pa nyid do ;
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa goms pa'i 'dod pa dang mya ngan dang 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams kyang goms pas chos mthun pa la sogs pa dran pa la ltos pa med par shes pa gsal bar snang ba skyed pa'i nus pa dmigs pa nyid do ;
translated: Thus, even though they are not real, the minds of sentient beings, which are habituated to desire, sorrow, fear, and so on, generate clear appearances of consciousness without depending on the memory of similar past experiences.ğŸ”½The capacity of those minds to generate such clear appearances is observed.

original: / gang du goms pa med pa der ni de dag gi nus pa nyid 'bras bu dpag par bya ba nyid yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / gang du goms pa med pa der ni de dag gi nus pa nyid 'bras bu dpag par bya ba nyid yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin no //
translated: Where there is no habit, the capacity of those minds to generate such clear appearances is inferred from the effect, but not everywhere.

original: 'dis ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags nges pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags nges pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the certainty of the reason, such as smoke.

original: gang gi phyir de la yang de dang de ma yin pa'i 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis phan tshun zhig tu dpen pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la yang de dang de ma yin pa'i 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis phan tshun zhig tu dpen pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even in that case, the effect of that, such as smoke, is essentially different from that, and their natures are essentially mutually exclusive.

original: des dpen par nges pa'i rgyu yang goms pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir rtags nges pa srid pas des na rjes su dpag pa mi spong ngo //
analyzed: des dpen par nges pa'i rgyu yang goms pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir rtags nges pa srid pas des na rjes su dpag pa mi spong ngo //
translated: And the cause of the ascertainment of that exclusion is also familiarization, etc., so the certainty of the reason is possible. Therefore inference is not rejected.

original: 'on te thog mar 'jug pa yod na sgom pa grub par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te thog mar 'jug pa yod na sgom pa grub par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if there is initial engagement, isn't cultivation established?

original: gang gi phyir de nyid ji ltar 'gyur ba brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid ji ltar 'gyur ba brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: Because of that, it must be stated how that is so.

original: smras pa / the tshom las so //ğŸ”½mngon sum the tshom gyi rgyu yin na ji ltar de la tshad ma nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / the tshom las so // mngon sum the tshom gyi rgyu yin na ji ltar de la tshad ma nyid yin zhe na /
translated: We say: From doubt.ğŸ”½If direct perception is the cause of doubt, how can it be valid cognition?

original: nges pa'i rgyu yang ji ltar tshad ma nyid yin /
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu yang ji ltar tshad ma nyid yin /
translated: And how can the cause of ascertainment be valid cognition?

original: nges pa bskyed par byed pas don du gnyer ba rnams de la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa bskyed par byed pas don du gnyer ba rnams de la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it generates certainty, those who seek certainty engage in it.

original: 'di ni the tshom gyi rgyu la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni the tshom gyi rgyu la yang mtshungs so //
translated: This is similar to the cause of doubt.

original: gal te yang de la rtog pa don du gnyer ba don gyi rnam pa las bzlog pa nges pa de ltar na yang mngon sum de rnam pa des 'jug par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang de la rtog pa don du gnyer ba don gyi rnam pa las bzlog pa nges pa de ltar na yang mngon sum de rnam pa des 'jug par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if one seeks to ascertain that object, certainty is the opposite of the aspect of the object, but direct perception does not engage in that aspect.

original: de ltar nges pa'i don don du mi gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar nges pa'i don don du mi gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not seek certainty in that way.

original: zlog par byed pa yang ma yin te /ğŸ”½rtog pa don du gnyer ba'i @24a * //
analyzed: zlog par byed pa yang ma yin te / rtog pa don du gnyer ba'i @24a * //
translated: Nor does it turn away,ğŸ”½because seeking conceptual thought

original: don nges pa'i rgyu nyid kyis don du gnyer ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don nges pa'i rgyu nyid kyis don du gnyer ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the cause of ascertaining the object, and seeking engages in it.

original: de ltar ma yin te the tshom gyi rgyu yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te the tshom gyi rgyu yin na /
translated: If it were not so, if it were the cause of doubt,

original: mngon sum las don du gnyer ba 'jug par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mngon sum las don du gnyer ba 'jug par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: one would not engage in seeking the object from direct perception,ğŸ”½and one would not turn away.

original: ldog par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thob na de lta na yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ldog par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thob na de lta na yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Even if it were so, it is not like that.

original: 'on kyang don du gnyer ba rnams la don med par 'byung ba mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang don du gnyer ba rnams la don med par 'byung ba mi srid pa yin te /
translated: But it is not possible that it arises without a purpose for those who seek a purpose.

original: don du gnyer ba nyid kyis 'jug pa stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba nyid kyis 'jug pa stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Because of the very seeking of a purpose, the engagement is powerful.

original: 'dis ni mngon sum nges pa'i rgyu yin pa las 'di khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon sum nges pa'i rgyu yin pa las 'di khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: This is no different from the cause of the ascertainment of perception.

original: gang du mtha' gcig tu rtogs pa'i don las bzlog pa'i rnam pa nges pa'i rgyu nyid dam /
analyzed: gang du mtha' gcig tu rtogs pa'i don las bzlog pa'i rnam pa nges pa'i rgyu nyid dam /
translated: Where there is no cause of ascertainment of the form of the object that is understood in one way, or

original: nges pa mi skyed pa der ni des rnam pa thams cad du don du gnyer ba mi 'jug pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa brjod par rigs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa mi skyed pa der ni des rnam pa thams cad du don du gnyer ba mi 'jug pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa brjod par rigs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: where ascertainment is not produced, it is reasonable to say that it is not a valid cognition because of the non-engagement of the seeker of a purpose in every way, but not otherwise.

original: ha cang spros pas chog go //
analyzed: ha cang spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this excessive elaboration.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'brel las mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid brtag pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'brel las mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid brtag pa ste /
translated: This concludes the examination of the definition of perception in the Compendium of Reality.

original: nyi shu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: nyi shu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-second chapter.

original: // / da ni rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: // / da ni rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pa /
translated: Now, the definition of inference is explained:

original: rang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: One's own and others' and so on.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Inference is twofold, according to its division into oneâ€™s own purpose and the purpose of others.
