original: gang gi phyir gzhan du yang bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ba kho na zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan du yang bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ba kho na zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Because it is established elsewhere, as has been explained.

original: de lta bas na phyogs kyi chos bstan pa las ma gtogs par gtan tshigs brjod pa'i 'bras bu gzhan brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na phyogs kyi chos bstan pa las ma gtogs par gtan tshigs brjod pa'i 'bras bu gzhan brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, apart from the teaching of the property of the subject, it is not possible to state any other result of stating the reason.

original: de bzhin du dang por gtan tshigs brjod pa de nyid kyi phyogs kyi @33b chos nyid bstan pa yin la de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du dang por gtan tshigs brjod pa de nyid kyi phyogs kyi @33b chos nyid bstan pa yin la de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, first the reason is stated, and then the property of the subject is taught. In order to teach that,

original: nye bar sbyar ba len par byed pa na zlos pa nyid du bsal bar rab tu ston par byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ga las yin /
analyzed: nye bar sbyar ba len par byed pa na zlos pa nyid du bsal bar rab tu ston par byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ga las yin /
translated: when the application is made, it is clearly shown that there is no repetition. So how can the reason be unestablished?

original: gzugs brnyan yang don med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan yang don med pa nyid yin te /
translated: A reflection is also meaningless.

original: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi chos tsam ste gtan tshigs brjod pas sngar bstan zhing de la bsgrub bya'i chos kyi khyad par bstan pa na brjod par 'dod pa'i don grub pa'i phyir brjod pa na zlos par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di la yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi chos tsam ste gtan tshigs brjod pas sngar bstan zhing de la bsgrub bya'i chos kyi khyad par bstan pa na brjod par 'dod pa'i don grub pa'i phyir brjod pa na zlos par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di la yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid
translated: Because by merely stating the reason, the property of the subject is stated, and when the specific property of the probandum is stated, the desired meaning is established.

original: ga las yin /ğŸ”½de la gtan tshigs bstan nas dam bca' ba yang brjod pa ni mjug sdud pa'o zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ga las yin / de la gtan tshigs bstan nas dam bca' ba yang brjod pa ni mjug sdud pa'o zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, how could the reason be unestablished?ğŸ”½Stating the thesis after stating the reason is called conclusion, which is the definition of conclusion.

original: gtan tshigs bstan nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bstan nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Stating the thesis after stating the reason is called conclusion, which is the definition of conclusion.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, in statements like Therefore, it is impermanent,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis gtan tshigs kyi nus pa dper brjod pa grub par bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis gtan tshigs kyi nus pa dper brjod pa grub par bstan nas /
translated: by this therefore, the power of the reason is shown to establish the example,

original: dam bca' ba'i don yang rjod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni mjug sdud pa ste /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i don yang rjod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni mjug sdud pa ste /
translated: and that which states the meaning of the thesis is the conclusion.

original: dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dang nye bar sbyor ba don gcig pa nyid du 'dis shes par byed 'brel par byed pas na mjug sdud do //
analyzed: dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dang nye bar sbyor ba don gcig pa nyid du 'dis shes par byed 'brel par byed pas na mjug sdud do //
translated: This is understood to be the same as the thesis, reason, example, and application, because it connects them.

original: de la re zhig dam bca' ba sbyor ba nyid med na /
analyzed: de la re zhig dam bca' ba sbyor ba nyid med na /
translated: If the thesis is not connected,

original: gal te de rjes su brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi mjug sdud pa yin pas de'i phyir mjug sdud sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de rjes su brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi mjug sdud pa yin pas de'i phyir mjug sdud sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
translated: then since it is a conclusion that is the nature of a restatement, therefore the conclusion is not a branch of proof.

original: de la slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyi mjug sdud pa zlos pa yin pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin no zhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: de la slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyi mjug sdud pa zlos pa yin pa'i phyir / sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin no zhes smras pa de la /
translated: In that regard, master DignÄga said that the conclusion is a repetition,ğŸ”½so it is not a branch of proof.

original: 'dod byed pa la sogs pa na re 'dir zlos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod byed pa la sogs pa na re 'dir zlos pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who assert that say, â€œHere there is no repetition,

original: gang gi phyir dam bca' ba ni bsgrub bya ston pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam bca' ba ni bsgrub bya ston pa yin la /
translated: because the thesis teaches the probandum,

original: mjug sdud pa ni grub pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni grub pa ston pa yin no //
translated: and the conclusion teaches the established.

original: yang gi sgra ni 'dra ba la yin te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni 'dra ba la yin te /
translated: The word â€˜againâ€™ is for similarity.

original: des na dam bca' ba dang 'dra ba brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dam bca' ba dang 'dra ba brjod pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the statement is similar to a thesis.

original: mjug sdud pa med par ni grub pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mjug sdud pa med par ni grub pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Without a conclusion, there is no proof,

original: 'di ltar de med na de las gzhan pa'i yan lag rnams brjod na yang ci sgra mi snyan pa yin nam snyam pa'i dogs pa mi ldog go //
analyzed: 'di ltar de med na de las gzhan pa'i yan lag rnams brjod na yang ci sgra mi snyan pa yin nam snyam pa'i dogs pa mi ldog go //
translated: because if it were absent, even if the other members were stated, the doubt â€œIs it a Kuru?â€ would not be eliminated.

original: de'i phyir dogs pa de zlog pa'i phyir mjug sdud pa logs shig tu brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //ğŸ”½des na 'dir tshul gsum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dogs pa de zlog pa'i phyir mjug sdud pa logs shig tu brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro // des na 'dir tshul gsum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate that doubt, the conclusion should be stated separately.

original: gang gi tshe @34a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe @34a * //
translated: Thus, here it is said, â€œThe trimodal condition,â€ and so on.ğŸ”½When impermanence is ascertained as the property of the subject, sound,

original: mi rtag pa nyid du bstan pa med na mi 'byung ba'i byas pa nyid chos can sgra las nges pa na 'dir bzlog pa'i dgos pa ga las yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du bstan pa med na mi 'byung ba'i byas pa nyid chos can sgra las nges pa na 'dir bzlog pa'i dgos pa ga las yin /
translated: then why would there be a need to reverse it?

original: me 'bar ba'i tshogs yongs su gnas par nges pa'i bdag nyid kyis phyogs na sems rang bzhin du ga nas pa grang ba yod par dogs par bya bar rigs pa ma yin pa ma yin la de yang rigs pa med par tshig tsam gyis mjug sdud pa lasğŸ”½ldog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: me 'bar ba'i tshogs yongs su gnas par nges pa'i bdag nyid kyis phyogs na sems rang bzhin du ga nas pa grang ba yod par dogs par bya bar rigs pa ma yin pa ma yin la de yang rigs pa med par tshig tsam gyis mjug sdud pa las ldog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And that is unreasonable, not concluded by mere words.

original: rnam phug pa na re /
analyzed: rnam phug pa na re /
translated: The VaibhÄá¹£ika says:

original: sil bur gyur pa'i tshig rnams kyis //
analyzed: sil bur gyur pa'i tshig rnams kyis //
translated: The words that have become scattered

original: don gcig ston pa ma yin te //
analyzed: don gcig ston pa ma yin te //
translated: do not teach a single meaning,

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa grub don du //ğŸ”½mjug sdud logs shig brjod par bya //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa grub don du // mjug sdud logs shig brjod par bya //
translated: therefore, for the sake of establishing the connection,

original: zhes zer te /
analyzed: zhes zer te /
translated: the conclusion should be stated separately.

original: 'di la 'brel pa can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la 'brel pa can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, it is said to be the one with connection.

original: gtan tshigs bsgrub bya dang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ston pa na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bsgrub bya dang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa ston pa na /
translated: When the connection characterized by the reason and the probandum and arising from that is shown,

original: don gyi sgo nas 'brel pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis don gcig shugs kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi sgo nas 'brel pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis don gcig shugs kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du ston pa yin no //
translated: In terms of meaning, the reason that is the property of the subject, which is related to the probandum, implicitly indicates the probandum, just as it is intended.

original: gal te tshig rnams sil bu yin pa de lta na yang 'brel pa nyid kyi don gcig la nye bar sdud pa'i phyir 'brel pa grub par bya ba'i don du mjug sdud pa logs shig tu brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te tshig rnams sil bu yin pa de lta na yang 'brel pa nyid kyi don gcig la nye bar sdud pa'i phyir 'brel pa grub par bya ba'i don du mjug sdud pa logs shig tu brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Even if the words are scattered, because they are related to the same meaning, they are collected together. Therefore, a conclusion should not be stated separately in order to establish the relation.

original: kha cig ces bya ba ni gzhon nu ma len pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba ni gzhon nu ma len pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Some refers to Kumarila and others.

original: de dag ni rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis te khyad par du mthong ba dang spyir mthong ba'o zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis te khyad par du mthong ba dang spyir mthong ba'o zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: They say that there are two types of inference: seeing a specific instance and seeing a general rule.

original: de la khyad par du mthong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la khyad par du mthong ba gang zhe na /
translated: Among them, what is seeing a specific instance?

original: gang dag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is stated with those very... and so on.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: thog mar chos kyi bye brag dga' zhig tu me dang du ba'i khyad par dag mngon sum gyis bzung nas dus gzhan du thag ring por song nas gang gi tshe yang dang yang du du ba'i khyad par de nyid mthong nas /
analyzed: thog mar chos kyi bye brag dga' zhig tu me dang du ba'i khyad par dag mngon sum gyis bzung nas dus gzhan du thag ring por song nas gang gi tshe yang dang yang du du ba'i khyad par de nyid mthong nas /
translated: First, having perceived by direct perception the difference of fire and smoke in a particular place, later, having gone to a distant place, when one sees again and again that very difference of smoke,

original: sngar yongs su bzung ba'i phyir med de nyid rjes su dpog par byed pa de ni khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa yin te ;
analyzed: sngar yongs su bzung ba'i phyir med de nyid rjes su dpog par byed pa de ni khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa yin te ;
translated: one infers that very fire that was previously perceived. That is inference from seeing a particular.

original: sngar mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i khyad par yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i khyad par yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the particular that was previously perceived by direct perception is the object.

original: bzung zin pa ni 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: bzung zin pa ni 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not that it is not a valid cognition because it grasps what was already grasped,

original: gang gi phyir ji me de yod dam shi zhes the tshom zlog par byed pa bla lhag yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji me de yod dam shi zhes the tshom zlog par byed pa bla lhag yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: because it is the cause of the reversal of doubt, thinking Is that fire there or has it gone out? This is the summarized meaning.

original: yang yan lag gi @34b don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang yan lag gi @34b don brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meaning of the parts should be stated.

original: 'brel pa mngon sum gyis mthong nas zhes bya ba la 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa mngon sum gyis mthong nas zhes bya ba la 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: Having seen the relation by direct perception, what is the relation?

original: 'dir brjod pa khyod rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa khyod rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid smras pa /
translated: Here, you have stated the definition of inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni 'brel pa zhes phyogs gcig mthong ba las gzhan phyogs gcig nye ba ma yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni 'brel pa zhes phyogs gcig mthong ba las gzhan phyogs gcig nye ba ma yin par shes pa'o //
translated: Inference is the knowledge of the presence of one thing from the perception of another thing with which it is related.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: 'brel pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba dang 'brel pa spyir mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba dang 'brel pa spyir mthong ba'o //
translated: inference based on the perception of a particular relation and inference based on the perception of a general relation.

original: 'brel pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba ni dper na du ba'i rnam par mthong ba las me'i rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba ni dper na du ba'i rnam par mthong ba las me'i rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Inference based on the perception of a particular relation is, for example, the knowledge of the presence of fire from the perception of smoke.

original: 'brel pa spyir mthong ba yang dper na lha sbyin 'gro ba sngon du song ba can yul gzhan du phyir par dmigs nas nyi ma 'gro ba dran no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa spyir mthong ba yang dper na lha sbyin 'gro ba sngon du song ba can yul gzhan du phyir par dmigs nas nyi ma 'gro ba dran no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Inference based on the perception of a general relation is, for example, the recollection of the sun's motion from the observation of Devadatta's motion.

original: de la gzhon nu ma len 'brel ba mngon sum gyis mthong ba rjes su dpag pa ni 'chad par 'dod nas /
analyzed: de la gzhon nu ma len 'brel ba mngon sum gyis mthong ba rjes su dpag pa ni 'chad par 'dod nas /
translated: In this regard, Kumarila, wishing to explain inference based on the perception of a particular relation, states:

original: 'brel pa mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The perception of a relation, etc.

original: 'brel pa mngon sum mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa 'di lta bu yin no zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: 'brel pa mngon sum mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa 'di lta bu yin no zhes 'brel te /
translated: This is the inference that follows from the direct perception of the relation.

original: gang gi phyir snga ma 'das ma thag pa'i tshigs su bcad par de lta bas na de ltar smra'o zhes bya ba skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snga ma 'das ma thag pa'i tshigs su bcad par de lta bas na de ltar smra'o zhes bya ba skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the previous verse ends with â€œtherefore,â€ the present verse is the response.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni me dang du ba'i khyad par yul du gyur pa gang dag ste /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni me dang du ba'i khyad par yul du gyur pa gang dag ste /
translated: â€œThoseâ€ refers to the particular fire and smoke that are the objects.

original: skyes bu me dang du ba de dag ba lang gi lci ba'i bud shing las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu me dang du ba de dag ba lang gi lci ba'i bud shing las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Those people, the fire and smoke, arise from the fuel of cow-dung.

original: ba lang gi lci ba'i bud shing gi khyad par gyi blor byas te bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba'i bud shing gi khyad par gyi blor byas te bskyed pa yin no //
translated: They are produced by the mind that takes the particular fuel of cow-dung as its object.

original: de bzhin du me dang du ba 'di dag ni ri la sogs pa'i yul gyi khyad par na gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du me dang du ba 'di dag ni ri la sogs pa'i yul gyi khyad par na gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, these fire and smoke exist in the particular place of the mountain, etc.

original: ri la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi blor byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi blor byas pa yin no //
translated: They are produced by the mind that takes the particular mountain, etc. as its object.

original: me dang du ba gang dag la ba lang gi lci pa'i bud shing yod pa de dag ni lci ba'i bud shing can no //
analyzed: me dang du ba gang dag la ba lang gi lci pa'i bud shing yod pa de dag ni lci ba'i bud shing can no //
translated: Those fires and smokes that have the fuel of cow-dung are â€œhaving cow-dung fuel.â€

original: yul de gang dag la yod pa de dag ni yul lo //
analyzed: yul de gang dag la yod pa de dag ni yul lo //
translated: Those that exist in that place are the object.ğŸ”½They are also the fuel of cow-dung, and they are the object of that.

original: de dag ni ba lang gi lci ba'i bud shing can yang yin la de'i yul can yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ni ba lang gi lci ba'i bud shing can yang yin la de'i yul can yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The compound is to be resolved in this way.

original: de dag nyid khyad par te /ğŸ”½gang dag la de dag la sogs pas rdzas ras sa la dang / sa la ke la sogs pa kye khye la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams so //
analyzed: de dag nyid khyad par te / gang dag la de dag la sogs pas rdzas ras sa la dang / sa la ke la sogs pa kye khye la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams so //
translated: Those very things are the distinction.ğŸ”½Those things that are distinguished by those, such as the substance cloth, the cloth on the ground, the ground, the ground-cloth, and so on, are the distinctions of the cloth, the ground, and so on.

original: de'i yul can gyi khyad par ba lang gi lci ba bud shing la sogs pa de dag ste /
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi khyad par ba lang gi lci ba bud shing la sogs pa de dag ste /
translated: The distinction of that is the fuel of cow-dung and so on.

original: de blo zhes bdun pa sbyor ba'i rnam par dbye bas bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de blo zhes bdun pa sbyor ba'i rnam par dbye bas bsdu ba yin no //
translated: That is the cognition. The seventh case is included by the analysis of the compound.

original: rtog pa po gang gis de lta bur gyur @35a * //
analyzed: rtog pa po gang gis de lta bur gyur @35a * //
translated: By whom is the cognition thus produced?

original: pa'i mngon sum du blos byas pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i mngon sum du blos byas pa ste /
translated: The one who conceives is the one who produces that kind of cognition.

original: bskyed pa de ni yul de na gnas pa'i du ba'i rtags de nyid kyis gang gi tshe me de nyid dus gzhan du rtogs zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: bskyed pa de ni yul de na gnas pa'i du ba'i rtags de nyid kyis gang gi tshe me de nyid dus gzhan du rtogs zhes 'brel te /
translated: When that fire is realized at another time by that very sign of smoke existing in that place, the connection is made.

original: de'i tshe rtogs pa de mngon sum gyi bdag nyid las tshad ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtogs pa de mngon sum gyi bdag nyid las tshad ma nyid yin te /
translated: At that time, that understanding is valid knowledge because it is the nature of direct perception.

original: tshad ma gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is another valid knowledge.

original: yang na snga ma'i rtog pa'i rgyu'i phyir me de nyid rtogs so zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: yang na snga ma'i rtog pa'i rgyu'i phyir me de nyid rtogs so zhes 'brel te /
translated: Or else, it is connected that fire is understood because it is the cause of the previous understanding.

original: ci me de yod dam 'on te shi zhes bya ba de lta bu'i the tshom gang la yod pa'i dngos po de ni de lta bu yin te /
analyzed: ci me de yod dam 'on te shi zhes bya ba de lta bu'i the tshom gang la yod pa'i dngos po de ni de lta bu yin te /
translated: That thing which has doubt such as whether that fire exists or has gone out is like that.

original: de ni de yang yin la dngos po yang yin pa'i phyir de lta bu de rtogs pa yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni de yang yin la dngos po yang yin pa'i phyir de lta bu de rtogs pa yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Because it is that and also a thing, that is understood in that way. The words are connected in that way.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'brel pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa 'di ni khyad par du mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba de ltar 'bigs byed na gnas pa smra'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'brel pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa 'di ni khyad par du mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba de ltar 'bigs byed na gnas pa smra'o //
translated: The one who lives in the Vindhya mountains says that this inference that sees the connection as explained is an inference that sees a specific instance.

original: spyir mthong ba bshad pa ni me dang du ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyir mthong ba bshad pa ni me dang du ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The explanation of seeing in general is stated with fire and smoke, etc.

original: 'di'i 'brel ba ni bshad pa byed pas spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa la yul gzhan du phyin pas nyi ma 'gro bar dran pa dper brjod pa de la klan na ka 'di yod de /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel ba ni bshad pa byed pas spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa la yul gzhan du phyin pas nyi ma 'gro bar dran pa dper brjod pa de la klan na ka 'di yod de /
translated: The author of the commentary replies: In general, when inferring from seeing something in one place, one remembers the sun moving to another place.ğŸ”½But if one were to object that the sun is not a universal, then the author of the commentary would reply:

original: 'on te gang gi phyir me gzhan la du ba gzhan gyis spyi chos la brten nas rjes su dpog par byed pa de'i tshe me dang du ba dag las spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gang gi phyir me gzhan la du ba gzhan gyis spyi chos la brten nas rjes su dpog par byed pa de'i tshe me dang du ba dag las spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa yin na /
translated: If one infers a universal based on a universal, such as fire from smoke, then it is an inference based on seeing a universal.ğŸ”½Why does the author of the commentary, having discarded the proximity of fire and smoke because they are clear to the mind, cite the sun as an example of seeing a universal?

original: ci'i phyir bshad pa byed pas me dang du ba blo la gsal ba nyid kyis nye ba dor nas nyi ma kho na spyir mthong ba'i dper brjod ces bya ba'i klan ka 'di dogs pa bsu nas ku m'a la ri las bshad pa byed pa'i dogs pa brjod
analyzed: ci'i phyir bshad pa byed pas me dang du ba blo la gsal ba nyid kyis nye ba dor nas nyi ma kho na spyir mthong ba'i dper brjod ces bya ba'i klan ka 'di dogs pa bsu nas ku m'a la ri las bshad pa byed pa'i dogs pa brjod
translated: In anticipation of this objection, KumÄrila states the author of the commentaryâ€™s doubt in the ÅšlokavÄrttika:

translated: â€œFire and smoke are different.â€

original: spyi yis 'jal ba ste /
analyzed: spyi yis 'jal ba ste /
translated: He is saying that it is an evaluation of a universal.

original: spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa la me dang du ba nyid kyis dper brjod par bya ba la /
analyzed: spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa la me dang du ba nyid kyis dper brjod par bya ba la /
translated: In general, inference based on seeing is exemplified by fire and smoke.

original: bshad pa byed pas nyi ma dper brjod pa byas pa gang yin pa de ni dus thams cad du nyi ma'i 'gro ba mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa byed pas nyi ma dper brjod pa byas pa gang yin pa de ni dus thams cad du nyi ma'i 'gro ba mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But the author of the commentary took the sun as an example, because the movement of the sun is not directly perceived at all times.

original: gcig tu ste mtha' gcig tu nyi ma'i 'gro ba la spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa kho na yin gyis khyad par du mthong ba ni ma yin no snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: gcig tu ste mtha' gcig tu nyi ma'i 'gro ba la spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa kho na yin gyis khyad par du mthong ba ni ma yin no snyam du bsams nas /
translated: He thought that the movement of the sun is only inference based on seeing in general, not inference based on seeing in particular.

original: yul ma 'dres pa bstan pa'i don du nyi ma nyid dper rjod pa nyid du smras kyi /
analyzed: yul ma 'dres pa bstan pa'i don du nyi ma nyid dper rjod pa nyid du smras kyi /

original: du ba dang me dag la spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du ba dang me dag la spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there is no inference based on seeing in general with regard to smoke and fire.

original: de'i phyir @35b 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyon bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir @35b 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyon bshad do //
translated: Therefore, he explains the error in this by the words â€œin this case,â€ and so on.

original: khyab pa zhes bya ba ni du ba dang me la sogs pa dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa zhes bya ba ni du ba dang me la sogs pa dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa'o //
translated: â€œPervasionâ€ means that smoke and fire pervade all things.

original: skad cig ma nyid yin na yang rgyun gcig yin pa'i phyir gcig nyid yin no zhes na /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin na yang rgyun gcig yin pa'i phyir gcig nyid yin no zhes na /
translated: If it is momentary, it is one because it is a single continuum.

original: btags zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: btags zhes bya ba smos te /

original: de'i tshe btags pa'i gcig nyid yin te ;
analyzed: de'i tshe btags pa'i gcig nyid yin te ;

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: but not ultimately,

analyzed: don dam par ni nyung zad kyang gnas pa med do //
translated: because ultimately not even the slightest thing remains.

original: de lta yin dang yul de na gnas pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs la btags pa dngos po nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang yul de na gnas pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs la btags pa dngos po nyid kyang ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom za ba yod pa'i dngos po rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'brel pa med pa yin no //

analyzed: ci ste yang rtog pas sgro btags pa'i gcig nyid la brten nas khyad par du mthong bar brjod kyi yang dag pa ni ma yin no snyam na / khyed kyi tshad mas yul med par //
translated: But if you think that the seeing of a difference is based on the one that is imagined by thought, and is not real,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then he says, â€œYour valid cognition would have no object,â€ and so on.

translated: particulars.

original: gsal bya ba nyid ni rigs so //

translated: The class is the particularâ€™s manifestation.

analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni khas len na'o //
translated: â€œIfâ€ means â€œif you accept.â€ğŸ”½Since the class and the particulars are accepted as being one, how can the

analyzed: rigs dang gsal ba dag gzhan gyis gcig nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir gsal ba zhig pa rigs pa gnas par ga la 'gyur /
translated: class remain when the particular is destroyed? If it were not so, then, sinceğŸ”½the established and the happy would be different, they would have to be

analyzed: de lta ma yin na grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir gcig tu de dag tha dad par khas blang bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yod na zhes bya ba 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod pa nyid yin te /
translated: â€œIf it existsâ€ is said on the assumption that it exists.

original: re zhig gcig gi tshe rigs rgya par bkag pa'i phyir de yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: re zhig gcig gi tshe rigs rgya par bkag pa'i phyir de yod pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /

analyzed: yod na yang de bden na de yang skad cig ma nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: exist? Even if it did exist, if it were real, it would be momentary.

analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rtogs zin pa'i don rtogs pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /

analyzed: ma yin te /

analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba la yang mtshungs so //

analyzed: @36a * // bar du 'jug pa'i the tshom ldog par byed pa'i mngon sum gyis mthong ba las bla lhag pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that there is something superior to seeing by direct perception, which stops the doubt that intervenes,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /

original: de lta bas na thams cad du spyir mthong ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad du spyir mthong ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, in all cases, it is seeing in general,

analyzed: skad cig gis 'jig pa'i dngos po rnams la rjes su dpag pa khyad par mthong ba zhes bya ba cung zad med do //
translated: There is not the slightest inference called â€œseeing a differenceâ€ in things that are momentary and perishable.

original: lta ba ngan pa kha cig ces bya ba ni phur bu pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa kha cig ces bya ba ni phur bu pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œSome bad viewsâ€ are those of the BÄrhaspatya and so on.

original: rjod par byed ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rjod par byed ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa tshul gyis so //

original: 'dis ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba bshad pa yin te /
translated: This explains the contradiction with his own words.

original: 'di ltar tshig gi rtags las brjod par 'dod pa rtog par byed do snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig gi rtags las brjod par 'dod pa rtog par byed do snyam du bsams nas /

analyzed: gzhan la rang gi bsam pa rig par bya ba'i phyir tha snyad du rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du bstan pa dang / de tshad ma ma yin no zhes smra ba na de nyid 'gegs pa'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
translated: in order to make his own thought known to others, he taught that conventionally inference is a means of valid cognition, and when he says that it is not a means of valid cognition, he contradicts himself.

analyzed: 'di'i sun 'byin pa phyis gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir log pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir log pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is preceded by a reason that has the three modes, like a mistaken consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don byed de bsags pa yin pa'i phyir mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pa'i tshul gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don byed de bsags pa yin pa'i phyir mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pa'i tshul gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye and so on are for the benefit of others because they are aggregates, like the parts of a bed and seat. This is because it is a three-mode reason that refutes the assertion.

original: log pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'di'i bskyed par bya ba ste tshul gsum pa'i rtags las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'di'i bskyed par bya ba ste tshul gsum pa'i rtags las byung ba yin no //
translated: Like a mistaken consciousness, it arises from a reason that has the three modes.

original: 'dir tshul gsum pa nyid kyang rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir tshul gsum pa nyid kyang rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Here, having the three modes is not the cause of inference,

original: rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa yod pa'i phyir tshul gnyis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa yod pa'i phyir tshul gnyis pa bzhin no //
translated: because there is inference that does not have the three modes, like the two modes.

original: gzhan yang thams cad du sgrub par byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad du sgrub par byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin te /

analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya'i chos ni chos can gyi khyad par ma yin te /
translated: The property to be established, which is the object of the desire to speak, is not a qualifier of the subject,

original: 'di'i tshogs pa'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di'i tshogs pa'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: because it is one part of the collection, like the intrinsic nature of the subject.

original: 'di ni rjes su dpag pa thams cad rjes su dpag pa ma yin par bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rjes su dpag pa thams cad rjes su dpag pa ma yin par bsgrubs pa yin no //

original: thams cad rjes su dpag pa khyad par dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: thams cad rjes su dpag pa khyad par dang 'gal ba yang yin te /

original: dper na sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir bum pa @36b bzhin no zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la /
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir bum pa @36b bzhin no zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la /
translated: For example, someone shows contradiction to the qualifier in the application, â€œSound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot.â€

original: kha cig khyad par dang 'gal ba ston par byed do /
analyzed: kha cig khyad par dang 'gal ba ston par byed do /
translated: How is this a contradiction to the qualifier?

original: ji ltar gtan tshigs 'di mi rtag bsgrub par byed pa de bzhin du nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gtan tshigs 'di mi rtag bsgrub par byed pa de bzhin du nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as this reason establishes impermanence, in the same way it also establishes that sound is not a quality of space.

original: thams cad du 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yang srid pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yang srid pa yin te /
translated: It is possible that all are contradictory to non-erroneous.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag pa ste /
translated: For example, â€œSound is impermanent,ğŸ”½because it is produced.â€

original: byas pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la /
translated: The syllogism is: â€œSound is permanent because of being audible, like sound.â€

original: kha cig sgra ni rtag ste mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can du 'chad do //
analyzed: kha cig sgra ni rtag ste mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can du 'chad do //
translated: Some explain that this is a nonerroneous contradictory syllogism, such as â€œSound is permanent because of being audible, like sound.â€

original: de lta bu la sogs pa de kho na nyid kyi 'grel bshad las dper brjod par spros par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa de kho na nyid kyi 'grel bshad las dper brjod par spros par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Such examples should be seen as elaborations in the commentary on thatness.

original: de bzhin du rje seng ges smras pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du rje seng ges smras pa /
translated: Similarly, the lord SengÃ© says:

original: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis dngos po rnams kyi nus pa la tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis dngos po rnams kyi nus pa la tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The potency of things is different due to the differences of place, time, and occasion.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i khong du 'du bar nges par bya mi nus te /ğŸ”½lha sbyin ni khur khur bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i khong du 'du bar nges par bya mi nus te / lha sbyin ni khur khur bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it cannot be ascertained that it is included within inference.ğŸ”½It is not possible to ascertain through inference, for example, that Devadatta is not able to carry a load

original: lha sbyin yin pa'i phyir byis pa'i gnas skabs kyi lha sbyin bzhin no zhes de ltar rjes su dpag pa las nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lha sbyin yin pa'i phyir byis pa'i gnas skabs kyi lha sbyin bzhin no zhes de ltar rjes su dpag pa las nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: because he is Devadatta, like Devadatta at the stage of being a child.

analyzed: 'dir gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis nus pa'i bye brag srid pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: But here, because of the difference in the state, there is a difference in the potency, and so there is error.

original: de bzhin du yul gyi bye brag gis skyu ru ra dang yung ba la sogs pa rnams kyi ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa'i bye brag mthong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul gyi bye brag gis skyu ru ra dang yung ba la sogs pa rnams kyi ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa'i bye brag mthong ste /

original: gnas skabs de la skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu thams cad bska ba yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs de la skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu thams cad bska ba yin te /
translated: At that time, all myrobalan fruits are astringent,

analyzed: zos pa'i skyu ru ra bzhin no zhes ni bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: but it cannot be said that all myrobalan fruits are astringent like the myrobalan fruit that has been eaten.

analyzed: de bzhin du dus kyi bye brag gis khron pa'i chu la sogs pa rnams grang ba dang dro ba'i bye brag yod de /
