analyzed: de la chu thams cad grang ba yin no zhes nges par bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: It cannot be said that all the water is cold.

original: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi //
translated: Because of the difference in place,

original: zhes bya ba ni tha dad ces bya ba ltos nas drug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tha dad ces bya ba ltos nas drug pa'o //
translated: the word â€œdifferenceâ€ is the sixth case, the ablative.

original: dngos rnams zhes bya ba grub pa la ltos so //
analyzed: dngos rnams zhes bya ba grub pa la ltos so //
translated: The word â€œthingsâ€ depends on the word â€œestablished.â€

original: de bzhin du mi rtsva la sogs pa'i nges par sreg par nus pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtsva la sogs pa'i nges par sreg par nus pa yin la /
translated: In the same way, fire is able to burn men, grass, etc.

original: 'di sprin la nus pa nyams te /
analyzed: 'di sprin la nus pa nyams te /
translated: But its power is lost with respect to clouds.

original: de la 'di ltar sprin ni mes bsreg par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar sprin ni mes bsreg par bya ba yin te /
translated: For clouds are burned by fire,

original: sa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rtsva la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rtsva la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are of the nature of earth, like grass, etc.

original: rjes su dpag par bya bar mi nus so //ğŸ”½de bzhin du gzhan gyi don du rtogs pa'i don yang ches mkhas pa gzhan dag @37a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya bar mi nus so // de bzhin du gzhan gyi don du rtogs pa'i don yang ches mkhas pa gzhan dag @37a * //
translated: It is not possible to infer that they are not burned.

original: gis rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa'i phyir mthar thug pa med do //
analyzed: gis rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa'i phyir mthar thug pa med do //
translated: In the same way, the meaning of the realization for the sake of others is not final, because other very wise men understand it in another way.

original: yang gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: Moreover, another says:

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni smra ba po la ltos nas rjes su brjod pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni smra ba po la ltos nas rjes su brjod pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: Inference for the sake of others is not a means of valid cognition, because it is a repetition with regard to the speaker.

original: nyan pa po la ltos nas ni rang gi don nyid yin par te /
analyzed: nyan pa po la ltos nas ni rang gi don nyid yin par te /
translated: But with regard to the hearer, it is for one's own sake,

original: thos pa'i sgo nas don de rtog par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: thos pa'i sgo nas don de rtog par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: because the hearer understands the meaning through hearing.

original: mthong ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba 'di la khyad par ci yod ji ltar lta ba'i dbang po'i bya ba yod na gzhan gyi don gyi tha snyad du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyan pa'i dbang po'i bya ba yod na yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba 'di la khyad par ci yod ji ltar lta ba'i dbang po'i bya ba yod na gzhan gyi don gyi tha snyad du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyan pa'i dbang po'i bya ba yod na yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the difference between seeing and hearing? Just as the activity of the eye faculty does not constitute the convention of otherâ€™s welfare, the activity of the ear faculty does not constitute it either.

original: 'dis lta bar byed pas ni lta ba ni mig gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'dis lta bar byed pas ni lta ba ni mig gi dbang po'o //
translated: The eye faculty is seeing because it sees.

original: rig pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is cognition.

original: de bzhin du tshig nyan pa po la ltos nas gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig nyan pa po la ltos nas gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, inference for others is not in relation to the listener,

original: nyan pa po'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ram shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyan pa po'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ram shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is the cause of the cognition that occurs in the listenerâ€™s continuum or because it causes the listener to know, like the sense faculties.

original: nyan pa po rgyud kyis shes par byed pa nyid ces zlas phye nas gtan tshigs gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: nyan pa po rgyud kyis shes par byed pa nyid ces zlas phye nas gtan tshigs gnyis bstan to //
translated: The two reasons are stated by distinguishing the listener as the cause of knowledge in the continuum and as the cause of knowledge.

original: dper na dbang po'i ji bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ston pa'o //
analyzed: dper na dbang po'i ji bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ston pa'o //
translated: â€œLike the sense facultiesâ€ shows the example.

original: 'dir ni sbyor ba gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni sbyor ba gzhan yin te /
translated: Here the syllogism is different.

original: nyan pa po la ltos nas tshig gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan pa po la ltos nas tshig gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not an inference for the sake of another in relation to the listener,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba dngos su dpag pa'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel ba shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba dngos su dpag pa'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel ba shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because the object of inference is directly inferred, like the cognition of the invariable relation.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos su dpag par gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos su dpag par gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because the object of inference is directly inferred.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba bsal ba de'i phyir nyan pa po la ltos nas tshig tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba bsal ba de'i phyir nyan pa po la ltos nas tshig tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Since the object of inference is directly inferred, therefore the statement is not a valid means of knowledge in relation to the listener,

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel ba shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don no //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel ba shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don no //
translated: like the cognition of the invariable relation. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i bsgrub byas sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel ba de nyid dam /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i bsgrub byas sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel ba de nyid dam /
translated: The relation that establishes the invariable concomitance, or

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel ba bsgrub par bya bas rtags gang zhig gis shes pa de la zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel ba bsgrub par bya bas rtags gang zhig gis shes pa de la zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: the cognition of the invariable relation by which the reason is established, is what is referred to by the phrase in that case.

original: ci ste gzhan gyi byed ba la ltos nas 'di gzhan gyi don du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyi byed ba la ltos nas 'di gzhan gyi don du brjod pa yin no //
translated: But if it is said that it is stated for the sake of others in dependence on the activity of others,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That also is not correct.

original: rang gi don yang gzhan gyi don nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi don yang gzhan gyi don nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it follows that even oneâ€™s own aim is the aim of another,

original: gzhan nyid ni ltos pa yin pa'i phyir pha rol dang tshu rol bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni ltos pa yin pa'i phyir pha rol dang tshu rol bzhin no //
translated: because otherness is dependent, like this side and the other side.

original: rtags kyi tshul gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: rtags kyi tshul gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He answers with â€œThe three modes of the reason, etc.â€

original: de la sbyor ba dang po la tshul gsum pa'i rtags sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di @37b 'gal ba nyid du 'chad do //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba dang po la tshul gsum pa'i rtags sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di @37b 'gal ba nyid du 'chad do //
translated: There, he explains that the reason, â€œbecause it is preceded by a reason having the three modes,â€ in the first syllogism, is contradictory.

original: mtshan nyid mi slu zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid 'dis mtshon par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi slu zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid 'dis mtshon par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: â€œThe definition is nondeceptiveâ€ means that it is defined by this definition.

original: 'di ltar tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni brgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni brgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel ba nyid de /
translated: Thus, the cognition that arises from a reason having the three modes is indirectly related to the thing,

original: de'i phyir mi slu bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi slu bar byed pa yin te /
translated: and therefore it is nondeceptive,

original: mngon sum bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin no //
translated: like perception.

original: ji skad du ;
analyzed: ji skad du ;
translated: As it is said:

original: / de ltar rtags can rtags blo dang / brgyud pa yis ni dngos po dang // 'brel phyir der snang ba yis ni //ğŸ”½stong yang slu byed nyid ma yin //
analyzed: / de ltar rtags can rtags blo dang / brgyud pa yis ni dngos po dang // 'brel phyir der snang ba yis ni // stong yang slu byed nyid ma yin //
translated: through the continuum, are related to the thing,ğŸ”½and, although empty, the appearance there

original: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: is not deceptive.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The definition of that is the definition of nondeceptiveness.ğŸ”½As it is said:

original: tshad ma slu ba med tsam gyi //
analyzed: tshad ma slu ba med tsam gyi //
translated: The mere nondeceptiveness of valid knowledge

original: shes pa zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: is called â€œcognition.â€

original: de tshad mar smra bas mngon sum las kyang tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan mi slu bar las gzhan bstan par mi nus la /
analyzed: de tshad mar smra bas mngon sum las kyang tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan mi slu bar las gzhan bstan par mi nus la /
translated: The proponent of valid knowledge cannot demonstrate any reason for positing valid knowledge other than nondeceptiveness, even in the case of perception.

original: de yang tshul gsum gyi rtags kyis bskyed pa la yang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang tshul gsum gyi rtags kyis bskyed pa la yang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: And that is also present in what is produced by a sign that has the three modes.

original: ci'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags sngon du 'gro ba can de nyid las mi slu ba'i rgyu tshad ma nyid 'gegs par byed de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags sngon du 'gro ba can de nyid las mi slu ba'i rgyu tshad ma nyid 'gegs par byed de /
translated: Why then does he refute the very cause of nondeceptiveness, which is valid knowledge, in that which is preceded by a sign that has the three modes?

original: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag don gyis 'gal bar bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag don gyis 'gal bar bstan te /
translated: This shows that the probandum and the probans are mutually exclusive.

original: 'di ltar gang du tshul gsum pa'i rtags sngon du 'gro ba can de mi slu ba nyid yin pa der ni tshad ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang du tshul gsum pa'i rtags sngon du 'gro ba can de mi slu ba nyid yin pa der ni tshad ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, where there is a reason that is trimodal, it is nondeceptive, and in that case it is a valid cognition.

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te /
translated: Valid cognitions and nonvalid cognitions are mutually exclusive,ğŸ”½because they are contradictory in the sense of being mutually exclusive.

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir shugs kyis gtan tshigs 'gal bar bstan to //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir shugs kyis gtan tshigs 'gal bar bstan to //
translated: Thus, by implication, the reason is shown to be contradictory.

original: 'dod la gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod la gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du bshad do //
translated: The example, â€œbecause it is harmful to the desire,â€ is explained as having a conclusion that is not complete.

original: gang gi phyir rgol ba'i 'dod pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir de yang tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgol ba'i 'dod pa las bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir de yang tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because it proves the opposite of what the opponent wants, it is not a valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar gal te bsgrub bya gzhan la ltos nas thams cad tshad ma yin pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur na mngon sum la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te bsgrub bya gzhan la ltos nas thams cad tshad ma yin pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur na mngon sum la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if everything were posited as a valid cognition in dependence on another object of comprehension, then direct perception would also be a valid cognition.

original: phyogs snga ma la ltos nas de log pa'i shes par brjod kyi dngos po gnas pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma la ltos nas de log pa'i shes par brjod kyi dngos po gnas pas ni ma yin no //
translated: In dependence on the opponent, it is called a mistaken consciousness, but not because of the way things are.

original: snga ma ni dang po smras pa'i phyogs ni phyogs snga ma ste /
analyzed: snga ma ni dang po smras pa'i phyogs ni phyogs snga ma ste /
translated: The former is the prior position, that is, the first position stated.

original: de la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word â€œin relation toâ€ is supplied.

original: gang dag mig la sogs pa bogs dbyung du med pa gcig gi don byed pa nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: gang dag mig la sogs pa bogs dbyung du med pa gcig gi don byed pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: Those who assert that the eye and so on are not susceptible to enhancement and that they function as the cause of a single effect

original: de'i bsam pa la ltos nas log pa'i shes par brjod kyi /ğŸ”½mig la sogs pa rnams mi rtag pa dang du ba'i rnam @38a * //
analyzed: de'i bsam pa la ltos nas log pa'i shes par brjod kyi / mig la sogs pa rnams mi rtag pa dang du ba'i rnam @38a * //
translated: in relation to that assertion, it is called a â€œwrong consciousness.â€

original: par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du grub pa'i phyir 'gal ba zhes bya ste /ğŸ”½tshul gsum pa'i rtags sngon du 'gro ba can la /
analyzed: par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du grub pa'i phyir 'gal ba zhes bya ste / tshul gsum pa'i rtags sngon du 'gro ba can la /
translated: Since the eye and so on are established as the cause of consciousness that is impermanent and has the aspect of smoke and so on, it is called a â€œcontradictoryâ€ consciousness.

original: tshad ma yin pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because there is no valid knowledge that is preceded by a reason that has the three modes,

original: tshad ma ni 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pa'i shes pa 'di nyid la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ni 'dod pa la gnod pa byed pa'i shes pa 'di nyid la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because valid knowledge is the consciousness that contradicts what is asserted.

original: 'on te 'jig rten rgyang pan pa la gnod pa 'gal ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten rgyang pan pa la gnod pa 'gal ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you say that the contradictory consciousness that contradicts LokÄyata is not an example that is not established,

original: dpe ma grub pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: dpe ma grub pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: is it not the case that the example is not established?

original: gzhan dag ni 'dod pa la gnod pa skyed pa'i tshad mar 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'dod pa la gnod pa skyed pa'i tshad mar 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But others do not assert that it is a valid cognition that harms the desire.

original: gang yang rung ba la gnod pa ma grub pa dang sun 'byin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la gnod pa ma grub pa dang sun 'byin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that any of these are not established as refutations or confutations.

original: rgol ba gnyis ka la nges pa gang yin pa de nyid sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rig pas so zhe na /
analyzed: rgol ba gnyis ka la nges pa gang yin pa de nyid sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rig pas so zhe na /
translated: It is the very ascertainment of both parties that is the proof and the confutation, because of the reasoning that says, â€œIt is the very ascertainment of both parties that is the proof and the confutation.â€

original: brjod pa gal te yang 'dir gzhan gyi tshig tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de lta na yang mi slu ba nyid ni bsnyon par mi nus pa'i phyir 'dod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: brjod pa gal te yang 'dir gzhan gyi tshig tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de lta na yang mi slu ba nyid ni bsnyon par mi nus pa'i phyir 'dod pa nyid yin la /
translated: We reply: Even if here the words of the other are asserted to be valid cognition, still, because nondeceptiveness cannot be denied, it is asserted.

original: de 'dod pas shugs kyis de tshad ma yang dngos po gnas pas khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: de 'dod pas shugs kyis de tshad ma yang dngos po gnas pas khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: Since that is asserted, it is necessary to accept implicitly that it is valid cognition, because of the nature of things.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pas 'gal bar brjod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pas 'gal bar brjod kyi /
translated: Because it engages by the power of the thing, it is called a contradiction.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i ngor byas nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i ngor byas nas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not made in terms of the otherâ€™s assertion.

original: yang na gtan tshigs 'gal ba ston par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na gtan tshigs 'gal ba ston par byed pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Or it is contradictory because it shows a contradictory reason.

original: de 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni gang mi slu ba de ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni gang mi slu ba de ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: The argument that contradicts that is: Whatever is nondeceptive is a valid cognition,

original: mngon sum bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin no //
translated: like direct perception.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'i shes pa yang mi slu ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'i shes pa yang mi slu ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cognition produced by a reason having the three modes is nondeceptive. This is an argument from nature.

original: rang bzhin med pa dang rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma grug pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa dang rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma grug pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Because it would absurdly follow that it would be essenceless and causeless, it is not unestablished.

original: mngon sum tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And because it would absurdly follow that it would not be a valid perceptual cognition, it is not indeterminate.

original: bsgrub bya med pa nyid ces bya ba 'di la bsgrub bya yod pa ma yin pas bsgrub bya med pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med pa nyid ces bya ba 'di la bsgrub bya yod pa ma yin pas bsgrub bya med pa'o //
translated: As for the phrase â€œthe absence of the object of affirmation,â€ the object of affirmation does not exist, and so it is absent.

original: de'i dngos po ni bsgrub bya med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bsgrub bya med pa'i phyir /
translated: The thing that is that is the absence of the object of affirmation.

original: de bsgrub bya ma tshang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bsgrub bya ma tshang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is what is meant by â€œthe incompleteness of the object of affirmation.â€

original: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The second

original: rtags kyi tshul gsum tshul gnyis bzhin //
analyzed: rtags kyi tshul gsum tshul gnyis bzhin //
translated: is like the two modes of the reason.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ces bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ces bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this and other passages, there is no inference at all that is not established by a reason.

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni de'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni de'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: â€œBy these two aspectsâ€ means by the method of the trimodal logical reason, and so on.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba la sogs @38b pa la lan bshad pa ni /ğŸ”½de bdag de las byung ba yi //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba la sogs @38b pa la lan bshad pa ni / de bdag de las byung ba yi //
translated: The response to the objection that it contradicts inference, and so on, is as follows.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, for example, that â€œit arises from that self.â€

original: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang 'gal ba de las byung ba'i 'brel ba la'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang 'gal ba de las byung ba'i 'brel ba la'o //
translated: â€œSuchâ€ refers to the relation of identity and causality.

original: bdag dang rgyu dag ces bya ba ni go rims bzhin du rang bzhin dang rgyu dang med par de rtags su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang rgyu dag ces bya ba ni go rims bzhin du rang bzhin dang rgyu dang med par de rtags su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: â€œSelf and causeâ€ means that, respectively, the absence of intrinsic existence and the absence of a cause are not the evidence.

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid dang rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid dang rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no intrinsic existence and no cause.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni chos can gyi khyad par ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de la gal te bsgrub bya'i chos chos can gyi khyad par ma yin pa de'i tsho tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni chos can gyi khyad par ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de la gal te bsgrub bya'i chos chos can gyi khyad par ma yin pa de'i tsho tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: If the predicate of the probandum is not the specific property of the subject, then the collection does not exist, because it is a part of the collection.

original: de lta yin dang tshogs pa'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang tshogs pa'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then this reason, â€œbecause it is a part of the collection,â€ would not be established.

original: gang yang thams cad du rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni 'gal ba yin no zhes smras pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang thams cad du rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni 'gal ba yin no zhes smras pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: Also, it is not correct to say that the object of inference is always contradictory,

original: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'dod kyi khyad par bsgrub par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'dod kyi khyad par bsgrub par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because we assert that something is contradictory if it contradicts the probandum, but we do not assert that it is contradictory if it establishes a specific property.

original: dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can srid pa'i yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can srid pa'i yang ma yin te /
translated: The object of inference that engages through the power of the thing is not contradictory and is not nonerroneous.

original: chos can 'gal bar bya ba phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi //
analyzed: chos can 'gal bar bya ba phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // yul dang dus dang gnas skabs kyi //
translated: because it would follow that the subject would be contradictory, having two contradictory properties.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /ğŸ”½mtshan nyid la ni goms rnams kyi //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la / mtshan nyid la ni goms rnams kyi //
translated: As for what was said, â€œin regard to place, time, and state,â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in response to that, it is said, â€œfor those who are familiar with the characteristics,â€ and so on.

original: shin tu gtan la phan pa'i rtags ni go bar byed par 'dod kyi the tshom za ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shin tu gtan la phan pa'i rtags ni go bar byed par 'dod kyi the tshom za ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is asserted that a sign that is very certain is understood, not one that is doubtful.

original: rlangs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor the tshom za ba'i du ba med ces nges par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rlangs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor the tshom za ba'i du ba med ces nges par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one is certain that there is no smoke that is doubtful in nature as steam, and so on.

original: rtags nges pa nyid ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: rtags nges pa nyid ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is the sign itself certain?

original: goms pa las so //
analyzed: goms pa las so //
translated: It is from familiarity.

original: ji ltar nor bu'i gzugs la sogs pa la rigs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu'i gzugs la sogs pa la rigs pa bzhin te /
translated: It is like the case of a jewelâ€™s color and so on.

original: 'di ltar goms pa ni du ba la sogs pa de'i mtshan nyid du rlangs pa la sogs pa dag las rnam par 'byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar goms pa ni du ba la sogs pa de'i mtshan nyid du rlangs pa la sogs pa dag las rnam par 'byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus familiarity distinguishes smoke and so on as having that characteristic from steam and so on.

original: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par phye nas 'jug pa dag ni me thob par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par phye nas 'jug pa dag ni me thob par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, those who engage in a very thorough analysis will certainly obtain fire.

original: de lta bas na gang gi phyir shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rtags pa'i 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gi phyir shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rtags pa'i 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Thus, because there is no error in a very thorough analysis,

original: des na gnas skabs la sogs pa bye brag gis tha dad pa rnams kyis 'grub pa rnyed par dka' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gnas skabs la sogs pa bye brag gis tha dad pa rnams kyis 'grub pa rnyed par dka' ba ma yin no //
translated: it is not difficult for those who are distinguished by their circumstances, etc., to obtain success.

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rtags las @39a * //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rtags las @39a * //
translated: From a very thorough analysis,

original: nges pa'i don ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus la /
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus la /
translated: the definitive meaning cannot be made otherwise.

original: shin tu rnam par gtan la phab pa'i du bas dpag pa'i me ni rnam pa gzhan gyi ngo bos bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par gtan la phab pa'i du bas dpag pa'i me ni rnam pa gzhan gyi ngo bos bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Fire inferred from very thoroughly analyzed smoke cannot be made otherwise by the nature of another aspect,

original: gcig la rang bzhin 'gal ba gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la rang bzhin 'gal ba gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because two contradictory natures are not possible in one thing.

original: gang yang lha sbyin ni khur khur bar nus pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang yang sprin ni mes tshig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras pa de ni rtags nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang lha sbyin ni khur khur bar nus pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang yang sprin ni mes tshig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras pa de ni rtags nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not a reason,

original: de la tshul gsum nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshul gsum nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not have the three modes.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par bya ba mi nus te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par bya ba mi nus te /
translated: One cannot negate the dissimilar class by mere nonobservation,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa nyid kyang min zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa nyid kyang min zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: because it is not the case that mere nonobservation of the dissimilar class is a negation.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel ba nges pa las med na mi 'byung ba nges pa yin te /ğŸ”½rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel ba nges pa las med na mi 'byung ba nges pa yin te / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am //
translated: It is ascertained that the absence of a relation of identity or causality is a relation of invariable concomitance.ğŸ”½It is said,ğŸ”½â€œThe relation of cause and effect

original: rang bzhin nges par byed pa las //
analyzed: rang bzhin nges par byed pa las //
translated: or the relation of intrinsic nature

original: med na mi 'byung nges pa ste //ğŸ”½ma mthong las min mthong las min //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nges pa ste // ma mthong las min mthong las min //
translated: is ascertained as the relation of invariable concomitance.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is not from nonobservation, nor is it from observation.â€

original: 'di la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel ba yang yod pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½'di snyam du shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rtag pa'i 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las /
analyzed: 'di la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel ba yang yod pa ma yin no // 'di snyam du shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rtag pa'i 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba 'di nyid ga las /
translated: Nor is there a relation of identity or origination between them.ğŸ”½If you think, â€œHow can there be a nonerroneous, completely clear perception of the permanent?â€

original: 'di la rigs pa yod pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di la rigs pa yod pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: We reply, there is no reason for that.

original: rgyu dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text says, â€œThe reason is the nature and the effect.â€

original: rtags ni rnam pa gnyis nyid de /
analyzed: rtags ni rnam pa gnyis nyid de /
translated: There are two kinds of reasons:

original: 'di lta ste rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: the nature and the effect.

original: mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyi khongs su 'dus so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyi khongs su 'dus so //
translated: Nonobservation is included in the nature.

original: 'di nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di nas brtsams te /
translated: From here on,

original: de yang gang gis 'khrul bar gyur ba'i rang bzhin dang rgyu zhes bya ba'i rtags can med par rtags de dag srid pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gang gis 'khrul bar gyur ba'i rang bzhin dang rgyu zhes bya ba'i rtags can med par rtags de dag srid pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the reason is not possible without the reason called the nature and the cause, which are the basis for error.

original: ci'i phyir mi srid na zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi srid na zhe na /
translated: Why is it not possible?

original: smras pa / tha dad pa dang rgyu mtshan med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / tha dad pa dang rgyu mtshan med par 'gyur te /
translated: We reply, they would be different and without a reason.

original: tha dad pa dang rgyu mtshan med pa de dag thob ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang rgyu mtshan med pa de dag thob ste /
translated: Having obtained that difference and the absence of a reason,

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs tha dad pa ste /
translated: The reason of nature is different from the reason of effect.

original: rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: If it were not nature,

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni rgyu mtshan med pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni rgyu mtshan med pa ste /
translated: the reason of effect would be without a reason,

original: rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would be causeless.

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu las ma gtogs pa'i rtags gzhan ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu las ma gtogs pa'i rtags gzhan ni mi 'dod de /
translated: A reason other than nature and effect is not accepted,

original: gzhan du 'brel ba med pas med na mi 'byung bas me rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'brel ba med pas med na mi 'byung bas me rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because without a relation, there is no invariable concomitance, as in the case of fire and smoke.

original: de dag med na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag ste /
analyzed: de dag med na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag ste /
translated: If those do not exist,

original: 'di ni gnyis @39b kyi tshig gi mtha' can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis @39b kyi tshig gi mtha' can yin no //
translated: this has the ending of a dual particle.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin te zhes gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin te zhes gang smras pa de la /
translated: As for what was said, â€œinference for the sake of others is not inference,â€

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½tshig gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / tshig gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: he says, â€œThe statement of a reason having the three modes,â€ and so on.ğŸ”½Because it is an inference for the sake of others,

original: gang yin pa de ni gnyan pa po la ltos nas yin te /
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni gnyan pa po la ltos nas yin te /
translated: or because it is dependent on another,ğŸ”½it is not inference.

original: des na smra ba po la ltos nas 'byung ba'i skyon skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na smra ba po la ltos nas 'byung ba'i skyon skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the faults that arise in dependence on the speaker are not faults.

original: nyan pa po la ltos nas kyang /
analyzed: nyan pa po la ltos nas kyang /
translated: In dependence on the hearer,

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: the sign that has the three modes is taught.

original: nye bar btags nas rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: nye bar btags nas rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because it is the cause of inference that is designated,

original: brda la rjes su dpag pa nyid du bshad de /
analyzed: brda la rjes su dpag pa nyid du bshad de /
translated: it is explained as inference in regard to a convention.

original: nus pa ston par byed pa nyid la rjes su dpag pa'i ming sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa ston par byed pa nyid la rjes su dpag pa'i ming sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the name â€œinferenceâ€ is applied to that which teaches ability.

original: des na dbang po dang / med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel ba shes pa ni /
analyzed: des na dbang po dang / med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel ba shes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the relation of invariable concomitance between the reason and the property to be established,

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is the inference for the sake of another,

original: ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: does not suffer from the fault of overextension.

original: de dag la nus pa ston par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la nus pa ston par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no teaching of ability in those.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mthong ba'i rtsa ba can gyi rig pa 'di las 'di nyid khyad par yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mthong ba'i rtsa ba can gyi rig pa 'di las 'di nyid khyad par yin te /
translated: Therefore, this knowledge that has seeing as its root has this as its distinguishing feature.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i shes pas dngos po du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i shes pas dngos po du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rtogs kyi /
translated: Thus, the consciousness that sees realizes the sign, such as smoke,

original: nyan pa'i shes pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan pa'i shes pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but the consciousness that hears does not.

original: des dngos su sgra nyid 'dzin gyi sgra ni du ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi don la ltos nas gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: des dngos su sgra nyid 'dzin gyi sgra ni du ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi don la ltos nas gzhan ma yin te /
translated: That directly apprehends sound itself, but sound is not like smoke in that it is not different in reliance on an external object,

original: brjod par 'dod pa dang 'brel pa ni phyi rol dang 'brel bar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa dang 'brel pa ni phyi rol dang 'brel bar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is related to the object to be expressed is not established as related to an external object.

original: de ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags ston par byed pa nyid kyis brda'i dbang gis de ltar nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la ltos nas gzhan gyi don bzhin brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: de ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags ston par byed pa nyid kyis brda'i dbang gis de ltar nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la ltos nas gzhan gyi don bzhin brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: That is because it is the mere expression of the sign, such as smoke, that generates the conception that ascertains it in that way by the power of convention.

original: brjod par 'dod pa go bar bya ba ni nyan pa po la ltos nas rang gi don nyid yin te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa go bar bya ba ni nyan pa po la ltos nas rang gi don nyid yin te /
translated: That which is to be understood, the object to be expressed, is the object of oneself in reliance on the hearer,

original: 'di ltar de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir du ba bzhin du brjod par 'dod pa go bar byed pa 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir du ba bzhin du brjod par 'dod pa go bar byed pa 'dod kyi /
translated: because it is the effect of that, just like smoke.

original: rjod par byed pa nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: But not by the very act of expression,

original: de las shes pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las shes pa'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the cognition is understood from that.

original: brjod pa don med de zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin //
analyzed: brjod pa don med de zhes bya ba ni / rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin //
translated: The statement, â€œExpression is useless,â€ğŸ”½is a syllogism.

original: bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: bya ba 'di'o //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: 'di ltar rtogs par bya ba 'ga' zhig khyod kyi tshig las brjod par 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs par bya ba 'ga' zhig khyod kyi tshig las brjod par 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, you do not understand anything that you want to express from the words of others.

original: 'dis ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba bshad pa 'di yang sngar bshad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba bshad pa 'di yang sngar bshad pa nyid yin no //
translated: This also explains the contradiction with your own words, as was previously explained.

original: dbang pos @40a * //
analyzed: dbang pos @40a * //
translated: Indra said:

original: smras pa / 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni tshu rul mdzes pa rnams kyis kyang 'dod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni tshu rul mdzes pa rnams kyis kyang 'dod pa nyid yin la /
translated: â€œThe inference that is well known in the world is accepted even by the most refined logicians.
